rider.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/af/Horse_rider.png)
Stardew Valley is an open-ended country-life RPG! You’ve inherited your grandfather’s old farm plot in Stardew Valley. Armed with hand-me-down tools and a few coins, you set out to begin your new life. Can you learn to live off the land and turn these overgrown fields into a thriving home? It won’t be easy. Ever since Joja Corporation came to town, the old ways of life have all but disappeared. The community center, once the town’s most vibrant hub of activity, now lies in shambles. But the valley seems full of opportunity. With a little dedication, you might just be the one to restore Stardew Valley to greatness! | | | | Basics | The Farm | Environment | Gameplay | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | ![Animals Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b2/Animals_Icon.png)[Getting Started](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Getting_Started "Getting Started")

It can be used in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"), serving as a purple dye at the dye pots, located in [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane"). ## Fish Pond Void Salmon can be placed in a [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"), where they will reproduce every 4 days. The initial pond capacity is 1 fish, but the capacity can be increased to 10 by completing four quests. When the population of the pond reaches 3, the color of the water changes to purple. The primary output is purple Void Salmon [Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe"), but more valuable items are possible starting at population 8. **[Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond")** | Pond Capacity | Quest Item | Fishing XP Granted | | --- | --- | --- | | Before Quest | After Quest | | 1 | 3 | 5 [Void Essence](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Void_Essence "Void Essence") | 40 | | 3 | 5 | 10 [Bat Wings](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bat_Wing "Bat Wing") | 40 | | 5 | 7 | 1 [Diamond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Diamond "Diamond") or 1 [Void Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Void_Egg "Void Egg") | 40 | | 7 | 10 | 1 [Iridium Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Ore "Iridium Ore") | 40 | **[Produce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Produce "Fish Pond")** | Item(s) Produced | Fishing XP Granted | Population | % of Items | Overall Daily Chance | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | ![Purple Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Purple_Roe.png)[Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") (1) | 14 | 1-7 | 100% | 23-71% | | 8 | 92% | 73% | | 9-10 | 39% | 34-37% | | ![Purple Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Purple_Roe.png)[Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") (2) | 14 | 9-10 | 24% | 21-23% | | ![Purple Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Purple_Roe.png)[Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") (3) | 14 | 9-10 | 24% | 21-23% | | ![Void Essence.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/1f/Void_Essence.png)[Void Essence](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Void_Essence "Void Essence") (5-10) | 12 | 8 | 8% | 6% | | 9-10 | 8% | 7% | | ![Void Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/58/Void_Egg.png)[Void Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Void_Egg "Void Egg") (1) | 12 | 9-10 | 5% | 4-5% | | _Nothing_ | | 1-7 | 0% | 77-29% | | 8 | 0% | 21% | | 9-10 | 0% | 13-5% | ## Quests Void Salmon is not used in any [quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests "Quests"). ## History - [1.1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.1 "Version History"): Introduced. - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Introduced potential use in the missing bundle. Added iridium quality. # Refined Quartz From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | Refined Quartz | | [![Refined Quartz.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/98/Refined_Quartz.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Refined_Quartz.png) | | A more pure form of quartz. | | Information | | Source | [Furnace](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Furnace "Furnace") | | Sell Price | data-sort-value="50">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)50g | | Crafting | | Equipment | ![Furnace.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/0f/Furnace.png)[Furnace](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Furnace "Furnace") | | Processing Time | ![Time Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Time_Icon.png) 1.5h | | Ingredients | ![Quartz.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/cf/Quartz.png)[Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quartz "Quartz") (1)![Coal.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a7/Coal.png)[Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") (1)or![Fire Quartz.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5b/Fire_Quartz.png)[Fire Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fire_Quartz "Fire Quartz") (1)![Coal.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a7/Coal.png)[Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") (1) | **Refined Quartz** is created by smelting 1 [Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quartz "Quartz") in a furnace with 1 coal for fuel. 1 [Fire Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fire_Quartz "Fire Quartz") can also be placed in a furnace with 1 coal to produce 3 Refined Quartz. It can also be obtained in a [variety of ways](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Locations). It can be sold for data-sort-value="50">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)50g. Until obtaining the [Crystalarium](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crystalarium "Crystalarium") it is a lot faster and easier to obtain Refined Quartz via the [Recycling Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Recycling_Machine "Recycling Machine") than from [quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quartz "Quartz") itself. ## Contents - [1Locations](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Locations) - [2Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Crafting) - [3Buildings](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Buildings) - [4Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Gifting) - [5Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Bundles) - [6Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Tailoring) - [7Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#Quests) - [8History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Refined_Quartz#History) ## Locations - Can very rarely be found in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") by breaking large crystals. - Can be created by smelting 1 [Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quartz "Quartz") in a [furnace](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Furnace "Furnace") with 1 [Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal"). Smelting takes 1.5 in-game hours. - Can be created by smelting 1 [Fire Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fire_Quartz "Fire Quartz") in a [furnace](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Furnace "Furnace") with 1 [Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal"), which produces 3 Refined Quartz. Smelting takes 1.5 in-game hours. - Can be created by [recycling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Recycling_Machine "Recycling Machine") a [Broken CD](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Broken_CD "Broken CD") or [Broken Glasses](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Broken_Glasses "Broken Glasses"). - Can occasionally be found in [Garbage Cans](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garbage_Can "Garbage Can") after receiving the [Furnace](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Furnace "Furnace") blueprints from [Clint](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clint "Clint"). - Can be a rare drop from [Ghosts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ghost "Ghost") in [The Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines"). (Floors 51-79) - Can be dropped by [Carbon Ghosts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carbon_Ghost "Carbon Ghost") in the [Skull Cavern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern "Skull Cavern"). (10% chance) - Can be produced by [Ghostfish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ghostfish "Ghostfish") [Fish Ponds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") when the population reaches 9. ## Refined Quartz can now be used in Tailoring. Can be requested in [Fish Pond quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond"). Can be produced by Fish Ponds. - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Is now used in a remixed bundle. Now used as an ingredient in the Solar Panel and Farm Computer recipes. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Now used in [Sonar Bobber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sonar_Bobber "Sonar Bobber") recipe. | Resources | | --- | | Basic | [Battery Pack](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack "Battery Pack") • [Bone Fragment](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bone_Fragment "Bone Fragment") • [Cinder Shard](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cinder_Shard "Cinder Shard") • [Clay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clay "Clay") • [Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") • [Fiber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiber "Fiber") • [Hardwood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hardwood "Hardwood") • [Moss](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Moss "Moss") • [Stone](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stone "Stone") • [Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") | | Ore | [Copper Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Copper_Ore "Copper Ore") • [Iron Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Ore "Iron Ore") • [Gold Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Ore "Gold Ore") • [Iridium Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Ore "Iridium Ore") • [Radioactive Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Radioactive_Ore "Radioactive Ore") | | Bars | [Copper Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Copper_Bar "Copper Bar") • [Iron Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Bar "Iron Bar") • [Gold Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Bar "Gold Bar") • [Iridium Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Bar "Iridium Bar") • [Radioactive Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Radioactive_Bar "Radioactive Bar") • Refined Quartz | Retrieved from " [https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Refined\_Quartz&oldid=180176](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Refined_Quartz&oldid=180176)" [Category](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Special:Categories "Special:Categories"): - metadata.title: Refined Quartz - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Refined Quartz is created by smelting 1 Quartz in a furnace with 1 coal for fuel. 1 Fire Quartz can also be placed in a furnace with 1 coal to produce 3 Refined Quartz. It can also be obtained in a variety of ways.

# Saves

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#searchInput)

_For information about how the game saves progress on mobile devices, see [Mobile Saves](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mobile_Saves "Mobile Saves")._

The game **saves** progress when the [in-game day](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Day_Cycle "Day Cycle") ends, _i.e.,_ when the farmer goes to bed, collapses from exhaustion, or collapses at 2am. All progress during a day is lost if the player quits the game without ending the day. In [multiplayer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Multiplayer "Multiplayer"), the game saves after all players click through the prompts at end of day and wake up in the morning.

Save files are tagged with the version of the game that last saved the file ( _e.g.,_ `<gameVersion>1.6.15</gameVersion>`). An older version of the game is not able to load a newer save file, but a _newer_ version can load an older save. Once a newer version saves over an older save file ( _e.g.,_ when you save for the first time after the game itself was updated to a new version), the save file will be tagged with the newer version number.

A save file may be transferred to a different device family ( _e.g.,_ from mobile to PC) as long as the game version on the receiving device is not older than the save file's version tag. For example, a save file from a mobile device running version 1.5 can be transferred to and used on a PC running 1.6.15, but a 1.6.15 PC save file will not run on a mobile device with version 1.5.

## Contents

- [1Save format](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Save_format)
- [2Find your save files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files)
  - [2.1Windows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Windows)
  - [2.2Linux](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Linux)
  - [2.3Mac](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Mac)
  - [2.4Mobile (Android)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Mobile_.28Android.29)
  - [2.5Mobile (iOS)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Mobile_.28iOS.29)
  - [2.6PS Vita](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#PS_Vita)
  - [2.7Nintendo Switch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Nintendo_Switch)
- [3Transfer a save](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Transfer_a_save)
  - [3.1Back up or transfer between two PCs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Back_up_or_transfer_between_two_PCs)
  - [3.2Android](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Android)
  - [3.3iOS](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#iOS)
  - [3.4Chromebook to iPhone](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Chromebook_to_iPhone)
  - [3.5PS Vita](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#PS_Vita_2)
  - [3.6Nintendo Switch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Nintendo_Switch_2)
- [4Troubleshooting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Troubleshooting)
  - [4.1Save disappeared or doesn't load](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Save_disappeared_or_doesn.27t_load)
  - [4.2Undo the last save](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Undo_the_last_save)
  - [4.3Restore a backup by SMAPI](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Restore_a_backup_by_SMAPI)
- [5Advanced](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Advanced)
  - [5.1Edit a save](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Edit_a_save)
  - [5.2Duplicate a save](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Duplicate_a_save)
  - [5.3Change farm type](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Change_farm_type)
  - [5.4Remove an NPC](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Remove_an_NPC)

## Save format

The saves are stored as XML files on your computer or mobile device. They're stored separately from your game, so you can safely reinstall or update the game without losing them. On PC, they're shared between different copies of the game ( _e.g.,_ if you buy it from both GOG and Steam).

Each save has a folder like `JonSnow_123456789`, with two main files inside it: `JonSnow_123456789` and `SaveGameInfo`. Both files are needed to load the save.

## Find your save files

Note: in multiplayer, the save is only on the main player's computer.

### Windows

1. Press Windows \+ R to show a 'run' dialogue box.
2. Paste this exact text:

```
%appdata%\StardewValley\Saves
```

3. Click 'OK' to open the folder.

### Linux

The root directory for save files is specified by the XDG\_CONFIG\_HOME environment variable, which defaults to `~/.config/`

1. From _Files_, click _Go » Enter Location_.
2. Enter this exact text:

```
~/.config/StardewValley/Saves
```

3. Submit to open the folder.

If you're using flatpak, it might be at

```
~/.var/app/com.valvesoftware.Steam/.config/StardewValley/Saves
```

    instead.

### Mac

1. From _Finder_, click _Go » Go to Folder_.
2. Enter this exact text:

```
~/.config/StardewValley/Saves
```

3. Submit to open the folder.

### Mobile (Android)

1. Open your device's file explorer app. If your device does not come with a file explorer, you will need one that allows navigation of the internal storage, not just searching for a specific file.
2. Select the `Android/data/com.chucklefish.stardewvalley/files/saves` (version 1.5 or later) or `StardewValley` (before 1.5) folder.
3. Each subfolder inside with a name in the format of `JonSnow_123456789` is a save slot.

### Mobile (iOS)

1. Open the Files app.
2. On iPhone, tap the _Browse_ button on the bottom-right side of the screen. On iPad, tap the top-left button if needed to show the left sidebar menu.
3. Under the Locations section, tap _On My iPhone/iPad_.
4. Select the _Stardew Valley_ folder.
5. Each subfolder inside with a name like `JonSnow_123456789` is a save slot.

On iOS 12 or earlier:

Devices still on iOS 12 or earlier will need to be connected to a Mac or Windows computer to access your save files.

1. On Mac, Open the Finder. On Windows, [download iTunes](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210384) and open it. (If your device is on macOS 10.14 or earlier, open iTunes instead of the Finder.)
2. Attach your iOS device via USB.
3. In the Finder/iTunes, click on the device icon in the top toolbar. (If the icon isn't shown, try disconnecting and reconnecting the USB cable.) The device's page should appear.
4. Click _File Sharing_ in the menu on the left.
5. Click _Stardew Valley_ in the app list that appears.
6. The _Stardew Valley Documents_ panel shows which save files are already on your iOS device. (They appear as folders, but you can't navigate into the folders directly.)

### PS Vita

Note: Access to the Vita filesystem requires custom firmware (CFW)

1. Navigate to `ux0:/user/00/savedata/` in Vita Shell.
2. Highlight the PCSE01235 folder and press triangle.
3. Select "Open decrypted" at the top of the list.

### Nintendo Switch

Note: Access to a Switch's saves requires custom firmware (CFW)

1. Download and install [JKSV](https://github.com/J-D-K/JKSV/releases)
2. Open JKSV and navigate to Stardew Valley.
3. Select New, and call it whatever you want.
4. In either the Hekate SD card access tool or an FTP server, copy over `sd:/JKSV/Stardew Valley/NameOfTheSaveYouSaved.zip`.

## Transfer a save

### Back up or transfer between two PCs

1. [Find your save files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).
2. Zip the entire folder that looks like `JonSnow_123456789`.
3. Share or back up that zip file.

### Android

Android to PC

1. [Connect the device to your PC](https://support.google.com/android/answer/9064445).
2. Browse to the save folder in the Android internal shared storage.

- Version 1.5 or later: `Android/data/com.chucklefish.stardewvalley/files/Saves`
- Before version 1.5: `StardewValley`.

1. Copy the entire save folder (the one that looks like `JonSnow_123456789`) into [your computer's saves folder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).
2. Remove the `.bin` file extension from all of the files in the transferred folder.

PC to Android

1. If you use mods, remove any custom content before transferring to mobile.
2. [Find the save folder on your computer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).
3. [Connect the device to your PC](https://support.google.com/android/answer/9064445).
4. Browse to the save folder in the Android internal shared storage.

- Version 1.5 or later: `Android/data/com.chucklefish.stardewvalley/files/Saves`
- Before version 1.5: `StardewValley`.

- The folder won't appear if you haven't created a save on Android yet.
2. Copy the entire save folder (the one that looks like `JonSnow_123456789`) into the saves folder on your device.
3. If you use adb to push a save file to your phone, be sure to set read/write permissions so the game doesn't crash when you try to save at the end of the day.

### iOS

Note: On macOS 10.15 and later this iTunes feature has been moved to the Finder.

iOS to PC

1. [Find the saves in iTunes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#find-ios-saves).
2. Choose the save folder in iTunes and click the 'save' button.
3. That will save a folder containing two files (both required for the save to work).
4. Copy the whole folder to [your computer's save location](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).

PC to iOS

1. If you use mods, remove any custom content before transferring to mobile.
2. [Find the save folder on your computer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).
3. [Find the iOS saves in iTunes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#find-ios-saves).
4. Copy the entire save folder (the one that looks like `JonSnow_123456789`) into the 'Stardew Valley Documents' panel in iTunes.

_Note: there's one folder for each save. You need to drag each of these folders into iTunes, so that the individual save folders are all in the 'root' of the 'Stardew Valley Documents' panel. You can't drag the folder containing all your save games into iTunes._
5. Click the 'sync' button in iTunes to synchronize your iOS device with your computer. The save should now appear in the game's Load Game menu on your device.

### Chromebook to iPhone

You will need Dropbox and Files apps on iOS and File Manager+ on Chromebook

1. Open File Manager+ and go to Cloud, then add a location and choose Dropbox and sign in
2. Go back to Home on File Manager+ and go to Main Storage -> Android -> data -> com.chucklefish.stardewvalley -> files -> Saves. Your save should have the format JonSnow\_123456789
3. Right click the folder and click Move, go back to home and go to Cloud and then your Dropbox, put your folder there.
4. Sign into Dropbox on your phone then choose connect and follow the instructions on the app.
5. Once you connect you will see the files in your Dropbox, tap the … (ellipse) and tap save to device then select Save to Files put it in an empty folder, save all the files into the folder
6. Go to the files app and go to the folder you put all the files in, hold down in it and tap Move, then go to Browse -> On my iPhone -> Stardew Valley, put the file there
7. You should be able to go into Stardew Valley and see the save

### PS Vita

Note: Development on the Vita release of the game [has been abandoned](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Console_Version_History#PS_Vita "Console Version History"), leaving the final Vita version as equivalent to [PC version 1.2.33 (2017)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.2.33 "Version History"). As such, a Vita save may be transferred to PC/mobile, but a modern PC/mobile save file is incompatible with Vita.

Vita to PC/Android

1. Navigate to [your Vita's save folder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files)
2. Press triangle on your save folder (the one that looks like `JonSnow_123456789`) and select Copy.
3. Navigate to `ux0:/data/`.
4. Press triangle and select Paste.
5. Transfer the save folder to [your PC/Android device save folder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files) via FTP or USB with Vita Shell.

PC/Android to Vita

1. If you use mods, remove any custom content before transferring to Vita.
2. Find the save folder [on your PC/Android device](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files) (the one that looks like `JonSnow_123456789`).
3. Transfer your save folder to `ux0:/data/` via FTP or USB with Vita Shell.

   - **Android**: Remove the `.bin` file extension from all of the files in the transferred folder by pressing triangle and selecting Rename.
4. Press triangle on your save folder and select Copy.
5. Navigate to [your Vita's save folder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files)
6. Press triangle and select Paste.

### Nintendo Switch

Note: Access to a Switch's saves requires custom firmware (CFW)

Switch to PC/Android

1. Open [JKSV](https://github.com/J-D-K/JKSV) and navigate to Stardew Valley.
2. Select New, and call it whatever you want.
3. In either Hekate SD card access tool or an FTP server, copy over `sd:/JKSV/Stardew Valley/NameOfTheSaveYouSaved.zip`.

PC/Android to Switch

1. Place the PC/Android saves folder in a zip in `sd:/JKSV/Stardew Valley/`.
2. Open [JKSV](https://github.com/J-D-K/JKSV) and navigate to Stardew Valley.
3. It is advised to create a backup (above) before the next step.
4. Press Y on the save you just copied over and hold A.

## Troubleshooting

### Save disappeared or doesn't load

Here's how to recover your save in most cases. (Note that save issues are almost always caused by the game itself, not mods.)

1. [Find your save files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).
2. Recover the files:
   - If the files are still there, here are some common fixes (try one at a time):
     1. If some of the files have `_STARDEWVALLEYSAVETMP` in the name, remove that from their name and reload the game. You may need to first disable Steam cloud saves for SDV, as it can keep automatically renaming them every time you reload. To do that, go to Stardew Valley in your Steam library, click the gear icon and go to Properties, and uncheck the option to sync cloud saves.
     2. If you recently renamed or created the folder ( _e.g.,_ to restore a backup), make sure the folder name **exactly** matches the file that looks like `FarmName_0123456789`.
     3. Try [undoing the last save](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Undo_the_last_save).
     4. If you are on PC, ensure that the game files do not have an extension like `.bin`. If you are on Android, you may need to add the file extension `.bin`.
     5. Modded saves may not be able to load in the vanilla game, depending on the mods that were used. If you previously played with mods but are trying to launch the game in vanilla, try reinstalling SMAPI and playing a day. SMAPI will automatically clean up any custom content from your save. Note that if you still have custom items in your inventory, they will turn into blank error items and may cause issues.
   - If the files are missing but you have SMAPI installed, see [_restore a backup by SMAPI_](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Restore_a_backup_by_SMAPI).
   - If the files are there but newer game progress is missing, it's possible Steam Cloud Sync / GOG Galaxy / mobile equivalent automatically replaced your save with the version it had stored. To solve:
     1. Launch the game. (Don't load a save yet.)
     2. While the game is still running, delete your save folder and put your backup back in.
     3. Load the save.
     4. The cloud backup service will detect that the save changed while the game was running, so it'll treat that as the new version to save.
3. If the above fixes didn't help, [see this guide](https://www.stardewvalley.net/missing-corrupt-save-file-troubleshooting-guide/) or [ask for help](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Modding:Player_Guide/Troubleshooting#Ask_for_help "Modding:Player Guide/Troubleshooting"); we might be able to recover the save for you.

Note: don't keep backup folders in the saves folder, since the game will try to load them. Either move those into a different folder, or delete them.

### Undo the last save

If something went wrong, you can undo the last save.

For a save from Linux/Mac/Windows/Android:

1. [Find your save files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).

You should see two files with an `_old` suffix in the name; if not, ask for help instead!
2. Back up your save folder just in case.
3. Delete `SaveGameInfo` and the file that looks like `FarmName_123456789`.
4. Remove the `_old` suffix from `SaveGameInfo_old` and the file that looks like `FarmName_123456789_old`.

For a save from iOS:

1. [Find your save files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).

You should see a file with an `_SVBAK` suffix in the name; if not, ask for help instead!
2. Back up your save folder just in case.
3. Delete the files that look like `YourName_123456789` and `YourName_123456789_SVEMERG`.
4. Remove the `_SVBAK` suffix from the file that looks like `YourName_123456789_SVBAK`.

### Restore a backup by SMAPI

If you use the [SMAPI](https://smapi.io/) modding API, the bundled `SaveBackup` mod keeps up to 10 daily backups of your saves. Even if the original save was completely deleted or corrupted, you can probably recover it from SMAPI's backup.

To restore a save backup:

1. Find your [game folder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Modding:Player_Guide/Getting_Started#Find_your_game_folder "Modding:Player Guide/Getting Started").
2. Open the `save-backups` subfolder.
3. Unzip (or 'extract') the latest backup which has your save.
4. Copy the save folder back into [your `Saves` folder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).

## Advanced

### Edit a save

[![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/3/38/Editing_a_save_in_Sublime_Text.png/600px-Editing_a_save_in_Sublime_Text.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Editing_a_save_in_Sublime_Text.png)

[Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Editing_a_save_in_Sublime_Text.png "Enlarge")

A save file open in Sublime Text with formatted XML.

You can edit your save to fix some common issues or change your choices. **This can permanently break your save if you make a mistake; don't forget to [create a backup first](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Back_up_or_transfer_between_two_PCs).** You should also avoid automatic save editor tools, since they often break the save.

1. Install [Sublime Text](https://www.sublimetext.com/) for Linux, Mac, or Windows. (If you already have another text editor which supports XML formatting, feel free to use that instead.)
2. Install the [Package Control extension for Sublime Text](https://packagecontrol.io/installation).
3. Use the Package Control extension to install the _Indent XML_ and _XPath_ plugins (see [how to add plugins](https://packagecontrol.io/docs/usage)).
4. Make a backup of [your save file](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files) just in case something goes wrong.
5. Open [your save file](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files) (the file that looks like `Name_0123456789`) in Sublime Text.
6. Click Selection > Format > Indent XML.
7. Make any changes you want and save. (See the sections below, [this guide for changing the host of a co-op save](https://www.reddit.com/r/StardewValley/comments/8i5z1j/guide_how_to_change_hosts_of_a_multiplayer_save/), and [this guide for other changes](http://community.playstarbound.com/threads/save-file-editing-guide-for-solving-some-common-issues.110762/).)

**Tips:**

- Click an element, and press `CTRL` \+ `SHIFT` \+ `[` to collapse the whole section which contains it. This is useful when you want to ignore a large field. For example, given this text in the save file:\
\
\
\
```\
<ArrayOfInt>\
      <int>1981</int>\
      <int>0</int>\
      <int>0</int>\
      <int>0</int>\
      <int>0</int>\
      <int>0</int>\
</ArrayOfInt>\
\
```\
\
\
\
Click on one of the `<int>` fields and press those keys, and it will collapse into this:\
\
\
\
\
```\
<ArrayOfInt> […]\
</ArrayOfInt>\
\
```\
\
- Click any element, and look in the status bar to see the path to where you are in the save format (like `/SaveGame/player/friendships/item[32]`).\
\
### Duplicate a save\
\
You can duplicate a save for testing purposes, or to explore different options without starting over.\
\
1. [Find your save files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Find_your_save_files).\
2. Create the new save folder:\
1. Duplicate the target save folder.\
2. Rename the new folder:\
      - change the name so you can recognize it in-game;\
      - change the number at the end to any number that's not used by another save.\
3. Open the new folder for the next steps.\
3. Prepare the new files:\
1. Delete (or apply the following steps to, if you want the backup as well) any file whose name ends with `_old` or `.back.*`.\
2. Rename the file that looks like `Name_0123456789` to match your new folder name.\
4. Edit the save metadata:\
1. Open the `SaveGameInfo` file in a text editor like Notepad.\
2. Look for `<name>` on the first line. Your farmer's name should be right after that. Change it to your new name.\
3. Search for the 2nd mention of your name (ctrl+f to 'find') and change it to your new name.\
5. Edit the save file:\
1. Open the file that looks like `Name_0123456789` in a text editor like Notepad.\
2. Look for `<name>` on the first line. Your farmer's name should be right after that. Change it to your new name.\
3. Search for the 2nd mention of your name (ctrl+f to 'find') and change it to your new name.\
4. Search for the old save ID ( `<uniqueIDForThisGame>`, the number from the old filename). Change it to your new number.\
\
That's it! Launch the game and check the load menu; you'll see both saves now.\
\
### Change farm type\
\
If you use [SMAPI](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Modding:Player_Guide/Getting_Started "Modding:Player Guide/Getting Started") (mods):\
\
You can change [farm type](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps "Farm Maps") by loading your save in-game, then entering `set_farm_type FARM_ID_HERE` in the SMAPI console window. (You can enter `set_farm_type list` to see a list of farm type IDs.)\
\
That will change the farm map, but everything placed on the farm will stay where it is. You may have things in an invalid position, like trees in a lake. You can either install [Noclip Mode](https://www.nexusmods.com/stardewvalley/mods/3900) to reach things that are out of bounds, or run one of these console commands:\
\
| command | effect |\
| --- | --- |\
| `world_clear farm debris` | remove stones, branches, weeds, and dead crops. |\
| `world_clear farm trees` | remove non-fruit trees. |\
| `world_clear farm fruit-trees` | remove fruit trees. |\
| `world_clear farm grass` | remove tall grass. |\
| `world_clear farm everything` | remove _everything_, including placed objects. |\
\
If you play without mods:You can change [farm type](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps "Farm Maps") by editing your save file:\
\
1. [Open your save file for editing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Edit_a_save).\
2. Search for `<whichFarm>`. The number after that open tag is the farm type.\
3. Change the number to the one you want:\
\
\
\
| Code | Farm Type |\
| --- | --- |\
| 0 | Standard Farm |\
| 1 | Riverland Farm |\
| 2 | Forest Farm |\
| 3 | Hilltop Farm |\
| 4 | Wilderness Farm |\
| 5 | Four Corners Farm |\
| 6 | Beach Farm |\
| 7 | Meadowlands Farm |\
\
\
That will change the farm map, but everything placed on the farm will stay where it is. You may have things in an invalid position, like trees in a lake. You can take note of what's out of bounds, then switch back to the old farm type and move them.\
\
### Remove an NPC\
\
You can remove an NPC from your save file ( _e.g.,_ to fix an NPC permanently stuck in an invalid place). If it still exists in the game data, the NPC will respawn when you reload the save file. This should be a last resort, and usually isn't needed when using SMAPI since it'll remove invalid NPCs automatically.\
\
1. [Open your save file for editing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves#Edit_a_save). Make sure you format the file for readability per those instructions.\
2. Remove the NPC:\
1. Search for the NPC's default name between 'name' tags ( _e.g.,_ to remove Penny: `<name>Penny</name>`).\
2. Remove the entire 'NPC' section containing the line you found, starting from the previous `<NPC>` line up to and including the next `</NPC>` line.\
3. _(optional)_ Remove the NPC friendship data:\
\
1. Search for the NPC's default name between 'string' tags ( _e.g.,_ to remove Penny: `<string>Penny</string>`).\
2. Remove the entire 'item' section containing the line you found, starting from the previous `<item>` line up to the next `</item>` line.\
\
Retrieved from " [https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Saves&oldid=178056](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Saves&oldid=178056)"\
\
[Category](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Special:Categories "Special:Categories"):\
\
- [Gameplay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:Gameplay "Category:Gameplay")\
\
## Navigation menu\
\
### Search\
\
[Visit the main page](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stardew_Valley_Wiki "Visit the main page")

metadata.title: Saves - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The game saves progress when the in-game day ends, i.e., when the farmer goes to bed, collapses from exhaustion, or collapses at 2am. All progress during a day is lost if the player quits the game without ending the day. In multiplayer, the game saves after all players click through the prompts at end of day and wake up in the morning.

# The Queen of Sauce

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Queen_of_Sauce#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Queen_of_Sauce#searchInput)

[![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/af/Queen_of_Sauce.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Queen_of_Sauce.png)

[Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Queen_of_Sauce.png "Enlarge")

The Queen of Sauce

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| “ | “Greetings! It is I, the queen of sauce... here to teach you a new mouth-watering recipe from my secret cookbook. This week's dish...” |

**The Queen of Sauce** is a [television](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Television "Television") channel which teaches the player [cooking](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cooking "Cooking") recipes. Beginning on Spring 7, a new recipe airs each Sunday for the first 2 years of the game. On Wednesdays a random recipe that aired on a previous Sunday airs as a "Re-run". During reruns, recipes which at least one player doesn't know are prioritized. Simply watching the channel will teach the player the recipe if it's not yet known. The rotation of Sunday recipes repeats on a 2-year schedule with 32 recipes in total.

The player may also read the [Queen Of Sauce Cookbook](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Queen_Of_Sauce_Cookbook "Queen Of Sauce Cookbook") instead of watching the channel to learn all 32 recipes immediately.

## Recipes

| Image | Recipe | Description | Original Air Date | Other Sources |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [![Stir Fry.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ed/Stir_Fry.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Stir_Fry.png) | [Stir Fry](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stir_Fry "Stir Fry") | Stir Fry! It's a perfect way to get some healthy greens on your plate. Sautee the greens in a little sesame oil and make sure to add plenty of fresh ginger and garlic. Now breathe deeply... Oh, that's good. | 7 Spring, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Coleslaw.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e1/Coleslaw.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Coleslaw.png) | [Coleslaw](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coleslaw "Coleslaw") | Coleslaw! Envisioning bland mounds of limp cabbage? You're not alone. But a great coleslaw can be so much more. Make sure you have [juicy fresh cabbage](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Red_Cabbage "Red Cabbage") for this one. Toss with a little [vinegar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Vinegar "Vinegar") and [mayonnaise](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise "Mayonnaise") and you're all set. Ah, that's crisp. | 14 Spring, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Radish Salad.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b9/Radish_Salad.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Radish_Salad.png) | [Radish Salad](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Radish_Salad "Radish Salad") | Radish Salad! There's nothing like a fresh, peppery [radish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Radish "Radish"). It reminds me of the late spring... my mother would slice up our fresh radishes and serve them on grainy bread with a little salt and pepper. Ah, those were the days... but I digress. Now, watch closely... | 21 Spring, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Omelet.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/12/Omelet.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Omelet.png) | [Omelet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omelet "Omelet") | Omelet! This is such a simple dish, but so often done incorrectly! A perfect omelet is a thing of beauty. It's a pure golden angel of gleaming [egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg"), and I'm going to show you my secret method... | 28 Spring, Year 1 | [Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon#Menu "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g |
| [![Baked Fish.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Baked_Fish.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Baked_Fish.png) | [Baked Fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Baked_Fish "Baked Fish") | Baked Fish! Whenever I make this one at home, my two cats go bananas. I need a second chef around just to keep them from hopping on the counter for a bite! Just make sure the fish is fresh, preferably caught with your own rod! Now watch as I place the fish on a bed of spring greens... | 7 Summer, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Pancakes.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6b/Pancakes.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pancakes.png) | [Pancakes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pancakes "Pancakes") | Pancakes! Sometimes I get carried away with fancy, complicated dishes... but there's something comforting about a simple pancake. You'll want plenty of butter and maple syrup to slather over these warm stacks... mmmm.... | 14 Summer, Year 1 | [Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon#Menu "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g |
| [![Maki Roll.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b6/Maki_Roll.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Maki_Roll.png) | [Maki Roll](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maki_Roll "Maki Roll") | Maki Roll! The delicate flavor of the ocean, sealed within a pillowy cloud of [rice](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice "Rice"). Maybe a bit of wasabi for the adventurous. My mouth is watering as we speak. Oh, how I love sushi... | 21 Summer, Year 1 | [Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon#Menu "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="300">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)300g |
| [![Bread.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e1/Bread.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Bread.png) | [Bread](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bread "Bread") | Bread! Breadmaking can be a very complex form of art, but I'll make it simple for you. The most important ingredient is [flour](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wheat_Flour "Wheat Flour"), of course. But before we create the dough we'll need to activate our yeast. They prefer warm water and a little something to feed on. I use plain sugar, but honey or maple syrup will do! | 28 Summer, Year 1 | [Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon#Menu "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g |
| [![Tortilla.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d7/Tortilla.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Tortilla.png) | [Tortilla](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tortilla "Tortilla") | Tortillas! How many of you are gnawing on a microwaved convenience-burrito while watching this program? Shame on you! You might as well wrap your beans in an old wash rag. Now, listen up. Once you've tried my fresh, rustic [corn](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Corn "Corn") tortillas you'll never go back... | 7 Fall, Year 1 | [Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon#Menu "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g |
| [![Trout Soup.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/48/Trout_Soup.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Trout_Soup.png) | [Trout Soup](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trout_Soup "Trout Soup") | Trout Soup! There's something about [fresh-caught trout](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rainbow_Trout "Rainbow Trout") that just gets me buzzing. Maybe it's the subtle taste of the river. At any rate, I've got a wonderful trout soup recipe to share with you today... | 14 Fall, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Glazed Yams.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/30/Glazed_Yams.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Glazed_Yams.png) | [Glazed Yams](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Glazed_Yams "Glazed Yams") | Glazed Yams! It's yam season, and what better way to enjoy these delightful tubers than by slathering them in a sweet, sticky glaze? You'll need a nice, ripe [yam](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Yam "Yam") and a whole bunch of [sugar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sugar "Sugar"). Now, here's how you do it... | 21 Fall, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Artichoke Dip.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/77/Artichoke_Dip.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Artichoke_Dip.png) | [Artichoke Dip](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artichoke_Dip "Artichoke Dip") | Artichoke Dip! This is a delightful way to get more [artichokes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artichoke "Artichoke") into your body. Personally, I don't even dip anything in there. I just guzzle the sauce down like it's a milkshake. Delicious. | 28 Fall, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Plum Pudding.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a0/Plum_Pudding.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Plum_Pudding.png) | [Plum Pudding](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Plum_Pudding "Plum Pudding") | Plum Pudding! Little Jack Horner is chomping at the bit for this ooey-gooey delight. And who can blame him? The [plums](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wild_Plum "Wild Plum") are floral and sweet, with just the right amount of tartness to fully activate every last one of your eager taste buds. You'll just have to try it and see for yourself... | 7 Winter, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Chocolate Cake.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/87/Chocolate_Cake.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Chocolate_Cake.png) | [Chocolate Cake](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chocolate_Cake "Chocolate Cake") | Chocolate Cake! What better way to spend these cold winter nights than digging your way through a rich chocolate mountain? With my help, you'll be well on your way to creating the finest cake you've ever laid eyes on. Now, you're going to need a lot of [sugar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sugar "Sugar")... | 14 Winter, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Pumpkin Pie.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/7d/Pumpkin_Pie.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pumpkin_Pie.png) | [Pumpkin Pie](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pumpkin_Pie "Pumpkin Pie") | Pumpkin Pie! In my house, it's a tradition to eat pumpkin pie during the [Feast of the Winter Star](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Feast_of_the_Winter_Star "Feast of the Winter Star"). The season just isn't complete without that wonderful flavor you can only achieve with the finest farm-fresh [pumpkins](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pumpkin "Pumpkin"). A little nutmeg, cinnamon, and clove will sweep you off to a land of crimson and gold... | 21 Winter, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Cranberry Candy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/9d/Cranberry_Candy.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Cranberry_Candy.png) | [Cranberry Candy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cranberry_Candy "Cranberry Candy") | Cranberry Candy! Here's a fun one to help you celebrate the new year. [Cranberries](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cranberries "Cranberries") are quite bitter on their own, but submerge them in an ocean of [sugar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sugar "Sugar") they'll taste like angel's tears. Here's how you do it... | 28 Winter, Year 1 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Pizza.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f4/Pizza.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pizza.png) | [Pizza](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pizza "Pizza") | Pizza! There's a reason pizza is a timeless culinary classic. You've got an artisan golden-brown crust, you've got a tangy, garlic-infused marinara sauce, and you're topping it all with a mouth-watering three-cheese blend. And we're just getting started! Let's throw some fresh pepper and [tomato](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tomato "Tomato") on the top. Oh, my! | 7 Spring, Year 2 | [Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon#Menu "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="150">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)150g |
| [![Hashbrowns.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8f/Hashbrowns.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Hashbrowns.png) | [Hashbrowns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hashbrowns "Hashbrowns") | Hashbrowns! This one's simple, but that's a good thing! You'll just want to shred some [potatoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Potato "Potato"), add a liberal amount of salt, and fry to perfection in your favorite high-heat [oil](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oil "Oil"). Sounds easy, right? Well, I've got some pointers that'll make your job a lot easier... | 14 Spring, Year 2 | [Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon#Menu "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="50">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)50g |
| [![Complete Breakfast.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/3d/Complete_Breakfast.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Complete_Breakfast.png) | [Complete Breakfast](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Complete_Breakfast "Complete Breakfast") | Complete Breakfast! Last week I taught you how to make [hashbrowns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hashbrowns "Hashbrowns"). This week I'll show you how to combine them with other ingredients to create a hearty complete breakfast. This meal will really fill you up and give you the energy you need to get in a hard day's work. | 21 Spring, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Lucky Lunch.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Lucky_Lunch.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Lucky_Lunch.png) | [Lucky Lunch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lucky_Lunch "Lucky Lunch") | Lucky Lunch! An old legend has it that this meal is irresistible to spirits of [luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck") and fortune. After consuming it, you're likely to attract a good spirit into your belly, where it will bless you with good fortune until the meal is digested! Sounds weird, huh? I can't say I believe it, but the meal is delicious nonetheless! | 28 Spring, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Carp Surprise.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/cc/Carp_Surprise.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Carp_Surprise.png) | [Carp Surprise](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carp_Surprise "Carp Surprise") | Hey, ever have a bunch of [carp](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carp "Carp") laying around and no idea what to do with them? Yeah, me too. Well, I've devised a great solution to this all-too-common problem. I call it... Carp surprise. It's quite easy to make, but you'll need a lot of carp... | 7 Summer, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Maple Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/18/Maple_Bar.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Maple_Bar.png) | [Maple Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Bar "Maple Bar") | Maple Bars! Ever notice how the maple bars are always first to disappear from the doughnut box? Perplexing, because your average maple bar tastes like a sweet hockey puck. Agree? Well, just wait until you try my recipe. You can really taste the forest in these bars. Okay, you're going to need real, quality [maple syrup](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Syrup "Maple Syrup")... | 14 Summer, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Pink Cake.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/32/Pink_Cake.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pink_Cake.png) | [Pink Cake](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pink_Cake "Pink Cake") | A viewer from [Pelican Town](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pelican_Town "Pelican Town") wrote to me recently... let's see... Her name's [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley"). She wrote, 'I tried your pink cake last time I was in Zuzu City and I fell in love with it. Could you share the recipe on your next episode?'. Well, why not? It's a marvelous cake. And you'll never guess the secret ingredient... [melon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Melon "Melon")! | 21 Summer, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Roasted Hazelnuts.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/18/Roasted_Hazelnuts.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Roasted_Hazelnuts.png) | [Roasted Hazelnuts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roasted_Hazelnuts "Roasted Hazelnuts") | Roasted Hazelnuts! I've got a nice old [hazelnut](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hazelnut "Hazelnut") tree behind my house, and every year I invite the family over for a nut roasting party! Once we start roasting, it's inevitable that the neighbors will show up. That rich, nutty smell is irresistible. Now, here's the family recipe... | 28 Summer, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Fruit Salad.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/9e/Fruit_Salad.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Fruit_Salad.png) | [Fruit Salad](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fruit_Salad "Fruit Salad") | Fruit Salad! Here's a healthy and delicious treat to brighten up your day. The most important thing to remember is that you need ripe fruit. Forget the bland stuff they sell at the supermarket... I'm talking fresh-picked, juicy, bursting-with-flavor fruit. Okay, now watch closely... | 7 Fall, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Blackberry Cobbler.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Blackberry_Cobbler.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Blackberry_Cobbler.png) | [Blackberry Cobbler](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blackberry_Cobbler "Blackberry Cobbler") | Blackberry Cobbler! This one always reminds me of Stardew Valley. There's a few days in fall where the valley is overflowing with the most delicious [blackberries](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blackberry "Blackberry") I've ever tasted. If you can get your hands on some, I'd highly recommend them for this simple cobbler. | 14 Fall, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Crab Cakes.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Crab_Cakes.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Crab_Cakes.png) | [Crab Cakes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab_Cakes "Crab Cakes") | Crab Cakes! [Crab](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab "Crab") meat is very flimsy on its own, but mixing it with bread crumbs and egg is a great way to give them some body. That's why these cakes are my favorite way to eat crab! But before you go cracking any shells, stay tuned for my essential seasoning mixture... | 21 Fall, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Fiddlehead Risotto.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/2d/Fiddlehead_Risotto.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Fiddlehead_Risotto.png) | [Fiddlehead Risotto](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiddlehead_Risotto "Fiddlehead Risotto") | Fiddlehead Risotto! [Fiddlehead ferns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiddlehead_Fern "Fiddlehead Fern") are beautiful, but actually quite bland on their own. That's why you have to pay careful attention to the spices you add. I'll be honest, it's not very easy to make a good fiddlehead risotto. But with my help, you'll have the best chance at achieving it. | 28 Fall, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Poppyseed Muffin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8e/Poppyseed_Muffin.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Poppyseed_Muffin.png) | [Poppyseed Muffin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Poppyseed_Muffin "Poppyseed Muffin") | Poppyseed Muffin! [Poppies](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Poppy "Poppy") make beautiful ornamental flowers... but why not make full use of the plant with these delightful muffins? I'm a huge fan of poppy seeds. They're subtle, but they add a nice flavor and a great texture to bready desserts. And they're healthy! | 7 Winter, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Lobster Bisque.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/0a/Lobster_Bisque.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Lobster_Bisque.png) | [Lobster Bisque](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lobster_Bisque "Lobster Bisque") | Lobster Bisque! You could serve this one to the [governor](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Governor "Governor") himself. It's rich, creamy and delicious, with just the right amount of oceanic flavor. The hardest part is finding some [lobster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lobster "Lobster"), but I'm sure you can do it. Heck, if you're feeling crafty you could catch one yourself with a [crab pot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab_Pot "Crab Pot")! | 14 Winter, Year 2 | ![Willy Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/73/Willy_Icon.png)[Willy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Willy "Willy") (Mail - 9+ ![HeartIconLarge.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/04/HeartIconLarge.png/32px-HeartIconLarge.png)) |
| [![Bruschetta.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/ca/Bruschetta.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Bruschetta.png) | [Bruschetta](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bruschetta "Bruschetta") | Bruschetta! It's a wonderfully simple appetizer that really showcases the quality of the ingredients. You'll need [bread](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bread "Bread"), [tomato](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tomato "Tomato"), and [oil](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oil "Oil"). First, you'll need to grill the bread. Slice the tomato and place onto the grilled bread. Then drizzle with oil and serve. I told you it was simple! | 21 Winter, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |
| [![Shrimp Cocktail.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8e/Shrimp_Cocktail.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shrimp_Cocktail.png) | [Shrimp Cocktail](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shrimp_Cocktail "Shrimp Cocktail") | Shrimp Cocktail! Here's another good appetizer for you and your dinner guests. My cocktail sauce is extra zesty, and I'm sure you'll love it. Now, the first step... | 28 Winter, Year 2 | Exclusive to The Queen of Sauce |

## History

- [1.3.27](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.3.27 "Version History"): Fixed bug that caused a new recipe to air as a rerun on a Wednesday instead of the following Sunday.
- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Improved rerun system so that it prioritizes unknown recipes from the pool of previously aired recipes instead of previously aired recipes from even/odd years.
- [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Corrected spelling and grammar to descriptions.

Retrieved from " [https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=The\_Queen\_of\_Sauce&oldid=178615](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=The_Queen_of_Sauce&oldid=178615)"

[Category](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Special:Categories "Special:Categories"):

- [Television](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:Television "Category:Television")

## Navigation menu

### Search

[Visit the main page](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stardew_Valley_Wiki "Visit the main page")

metadata.title: The Queen of Sauce - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The Queen of Sauce is a television channel which teaches the player cooking recipes. Beginning on Spring 7, a new recipe airs each Sunday for the first 2 years of the game. On Wednesdays a random recipe that aired on a previous Sunday airs as a "Re-run". During reruns, recipes which at least one player doesn't know are prioritized. Simply watching the channel will teach the player the recipe if it's not yet known. The rotation of Sunday recipes repeats on a 2-year schedule with 32 recipes in total.

It may also be caught on the [Riverlands Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps "Farm Maps"), [Forest Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps "Farm Maps"), or [Hill-top Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps "Farm Maps"). It can also be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") cat with max [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"). It may also randomly be found at the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart") for data-sort-value="30"![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100–1,000g or in [Garbage Cans](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garbage_Can "Garbage Can") during [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") and [Summer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer"). The Sunfish replaces any ineligible fish or non-fish items for the [tutorial catch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish#Tutorial_Catch "Fish"). This can happen regardless of time, weather, season, or location. One Sunfish is contained in the [Community Center Fish Tank](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Fish_Tank "Bundles") right after it is repaired. Sunfish can be caught regardless of weather, time, or season using [Magic Bait](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magic_Bait "Magic Bait"). ## Contents - [1Map](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sunfish#Map) Mix into tilled soil. | ![Sap.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/73/Sap.png)[Sap](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sap "Sap") (4)![Fish.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/fb/Fish.png) Any [Fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish") (1) | N/A | ![Farming Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/8/82/Farming_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Farming_Skill_Icon.png)[Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") Level 9 | data-sort-value="10">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)10g | | [![Sashimi.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/41/Sashimi.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Sashimi.png) | [Sashimi](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sashimi "Sashimi") | Raw fish sliced into thin pieces. | ![Fish.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/fb/Fish.png) Any [Fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish") (1) | ![Energy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a9/Energy.png) 75
![Health.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Health.png) 33 | ![Linus Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/db/Linus_Icon.png)[Linus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Linus "Linus") (Mail - 3+ ![HeartIconLarge.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/04/HeartIconLarge.png/32px-HeartIconLarge.png)) | data-sort-value="75">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)75g | ## Tailoring Sunfish can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the dyeable [Fish Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). [![Shirt158.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Shirt158.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt158.png) It can be used in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"), serving as an orange dye at the dye pots, located in [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane"). ## Fish Pond Sunfish can be placed in a [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"), where they will reproduce every day. The initial pond capacity is 3 fish, but the capacity can be increased to 10 by completing two quests. The primary output is orange Sunfish [Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe"), but [Solar Essence](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Solar_Essence "Solar Essence") is also possible at population 10. **[Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond")** | Pond Capacity | Quest Item | Fishing XP Granted | | --- | --- | --- | | Before Quest | After Quest | | 3 | 5 | 2 [Acorns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Acorn "Acorn") or 2 [Geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Geode "Geode") | 25 | | 5 | 10 | 1 [Amethyst](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Amethyst "Amethyst") or 3 [Mixed Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mixed_Seeds "Mixed Seeds") | 25 | **[Produce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Produce "Fish Pond")** | Item(s) Produced | Fishing XP Granted | Population | % of Items | Overall Daily Chance | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | ![Orange Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c0/Orange_Roe.png)[Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") (1) | 11 | 1-9 | 90% | 21-78% | | 10 | 83% | 79% | | ![Solar Essence.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f4/Solar_Essence.png)[Solar Essence](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Solar_Essence "Solar Essence") (1) | 11 | 10 | 8% | 8% | | _Nothing_ | | 1-9 | 10% | 79-22% | | 10 | 9% | 14% | ## Quests - **Item Delivery:** One Sunfish may be randomly requested in [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") or [Summer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer") at the ["Help Wanted" board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Help_Wanted_Quests "Quests") outside [Pierre's General Store](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store") for a reward of data-sort-value="90">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)90g and 150 [Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") points. - **Fishing:** [Demetrius](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Demetrius "Demetrius") or [Willy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Willy "Willy") may randomly request 1-5 sunfish during [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") or [Summer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer") at the ["Help Wanted" board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Help_Wanted_Quests "Quests") outside [Pierre's General Store](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store") for a reward of data-sort-value="30">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)30g per fish. (You get to keep the fish). - **Aquatic Overpopulation:** [Demetrius](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Demetrius "Demetrius") may request 10 Sunfish to be caught in [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") at the [Special Orders board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#List_of_Special_Orders "Quests") outside the [Mayor's Manor](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayor%27s_Manor "Mayor's Manor") for a reward of gold equivalent to selling the fish and the [Farm Computer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Computer "Farm Computer") recipe. ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Added iridium quality. Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Special Order quest added. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): One is contained in the [Community Center Fish Tank](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Fish_Tank "Bundles") right after it is repaired. Can now be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") cat with max [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"). | metadata.title: Sunfish - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The Sunfish is a fish that can be caught in the river (in Pelican Town or Cindersap Forest) during Spring and Summer during sunny weather. It may also be caught on the Riverlands Farm, Forest Farm, or Hill-top Farm. It can also be gifted by a pet cat with max friendship. It may also randomly be found at the Traveling Cart for data-sort-value="30"100–1,000g or in Garbage Cans during Spring and Summer.
metadata.keywords: Stardew Valley Wiki, Stardew Valley, Sunfish, gift

# Rice From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#searchInput) | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Rice | | [![Rice.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Rice.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rice.png) | | A basic grain often served under vegetables. | | Information | | Source | [Mill](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mill "Mill") • [Pierre's](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store") • [JojaMart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart "JojaMart") | | [Energy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Energy "Energy") / [Health](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Health "Health") | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | ![Energy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/a/a9/Energy.png/40px-Energy.png) | 13 | ![Health.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/9/94/Health.png/40px-Health.png) | 5 | | | Sell Price | data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g | | Crafting | | Equipment | ![Mill.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/9/90/Mill.png/48px-Mill.png)[Mill](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mill "Mill") | | Processing Time | ![Time Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Time_Icon.png) Ready the next morning | | Ingredients | ![Unmilled Rice.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/fe/Unmilled_Rice.png)[Unmilled Rice](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Unmilled_Rice "Unmilled Rice") (1) | _This article is about the cooking ingredient. For the harvested crop, see [Unmilled Rice](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Unmilled_Rice "Unmilled Rice"). For the seed, see [Rice Shoot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice_Shoot "Rice Shoot")._ **Rice** is a cooking ingredient that can be used in a variety of recipes. It can be purchased for data-sort-value="200">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)200g at [Pierre's General Store](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store") and for data-sort-value="250">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)250g at [JojaMart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart "JojaMart"). Players have the ability to craft Rice from [Unmilled Rice](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Unmilled_Rice "Unmilled Rice") by using a [Mill](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mill "Mill"). Once placed in the mill, one Unmilled Rice will make one Rice. Unmilled Rice placed inside will appear as Rice in the box beside the Mill the next morning. The building can process an unlimited amount of rice per day. **Note**: Rice made using the mill is profitable; it has a higher sell price than Unmilled Rice. Using [Preserves Jars](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar "Preserves Jar") would be slightly more profitable per unit of Unmilled Rice if there is sufficient capacity, as the resulting pickles would sell for 110g. However, Rice can be further processed into [Vinegar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Vinegar "Vinegar") with a [Keg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Keg "Keg"), producing two Vinegar per Rice. As Vinegar sells for 100g each, this ultimately results in more profit than using Preserves Jars. ## Contents - [1Recipes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#Recipes) - [1.1Cooking](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#Cooking) - [1.2Other](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#Other) - [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#Gifting) - [3Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#Tailoring) - [4Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#Quests) - [5History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice#History) ## Recipes ### Cooking | Image | Name | Description | Ingredients | Energy / Health | Buff(s) | Buff Duration | Recipe Source(s) | Sell Price | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Maki Roll.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b6/Maki_Roll.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Maki_Roll.png) | [Maki Roll](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maki_Roll "Maki Roll") | Fish and rice wrapped in seaweed. | ![Fish.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/fb/Fish.png) Any [Fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish") (1)![Seaweed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/13/Seaweed.png)[Seaweed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Seaweed "Seaweed") (1)![Rice.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Rice.png)Rice (1) | ![Energy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a9/Energy.png) 100
