# Chicken From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | Chicken | | ![White Chicken.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/22/White_Chicken.png)![Brown Chicken.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/fd/Brown_Chicken.png)![Blue Chicken.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/61/Blue_Chicken.png) | | Well cared-for adult chickens lay eggs every day. Lives in the coop. | | Information | | Building | ![Coop.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/4/48/Coop.png/48px-Coop.png)[Coop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop") | | Purchase Price | data-sort-value="800 ">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)800g | | Produce | ![Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/26/Egg.png)[Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg")![Brown Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/01/Brown_Egg.png)[Brown Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg")![Large Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Large_Egg.png)[Large Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Egg "Large Egg")![Large Brown Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/91/Large_Brown_Egg.png)[Large Brown Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Egg "Large Egg") | _See also: [Golden Chicken](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Chicken "Golden Chicken"), [Void Chicken](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Void_Chicken "Void Chicken")_ The **Chicken** is a farm [animal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals "Animals") that lives in a [Coop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop"). Chickens can be purchased at [Marnie's Ranch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie%27s_Ranch "Marnie's Ranch") for data-sort-value="800">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)800g or hatched by placing an [Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg") into an [Incubator](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Incubator "Incubator"), taking ![Time Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Time_Icon.png) 9,000m (5d 16h 40m) to incubate, or ![Time Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Time_Icon.png) 4,500m (2d 21h 40m) with the [Coopmaster Profession](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming"). Additionally, two chickens are present on the farm by default on the Meadowlands [Farm Map](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Map "Farm Map"). ## Contents - [1Color](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#Color) - [2Produce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#Produce) - [3Blue Chickens](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#Blue_Chickens) - [4Selling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#Selling) - [5Trivia](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#Trivia) - [6References](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#References) - [7History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#History) ## Color Chickens are colored White, Brown, or Blue. The Blue variety can be obtained only after seeing [Shane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shane "Shane")'s 8-heart event. The color of the chicken is assigned randomly by the game when a chicken is purchased. While selecting a coop for a Chicken purchased from Marnie's Ranch, a message is shown stating "Choose a Coop for your new White/Brown/Blue Chicken". Cancelling the purchase returns the player to the purchase window, where they can try again for the desired color. An [Incubator](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Incubator "Incubator") will hatch a brown chicken from a [Brown Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg") and a white chicken from a regular Egg (or the corresponding Large variants). This means blue chickens cannot be obtained using an Incubator.[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#cite_note-1) White and blue chickens produce white eggs, and brown chickens produce brown eggs, so it makes a difference in completing the [Community Center](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Community_Center "Community Center") [Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles "Bundles"), especially if [Remixed Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Options#Advanced_Options "Options") is not chosen at start of game. ## Produce _Main article: [Animals#Produce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Produce "Animals")_ Chickens who eat every day mature after 3 nights have passed. A mature and fed chicken produces a white or brown [Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg") every day, which can be placed in an [Incubator](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Incubator "Incubator") to hatch another chicken, or sold for data-sort-value="50">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)50g. Once sufficient [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals") and happiness is reached, it has a chance to produce a [Large Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Egg "Large Egg") or [Large Brown Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Egg "Large Egg") which sells for data-sort-value="95">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)95g. An Egg can be placed in the [Mayonnaise Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise_Machine "Mayonnaise Machine") to produce [Mayonnaise](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise "Mayonnaise"), which sells for data-sort-value="190">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)190g or data-sort-value="285">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)285g depending on quality. | Image | Name | Description | Sell Price | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/26/Egg.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Egg.png)[![Brown Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/01/Brown_Egg.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Brown_Egg.png) | [Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg")
[Brown Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg") | A regular white chicken egg.
A regular brown chicken egg. | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/26/Egg.png) | 50g | | ![Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/26/Egg.png)
![Silver Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8a/Silver_Quality_Icon.png) | 62g | | ![Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/26/Egg.png)
![Gold Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/47/Gold_Quality_Icon.png) | 75g | | ![Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/26/Egg.png)
![Iridium Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e4/Iridium_Quality_Icon.png) | 100g | | | [![Large Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Large_Egg.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Large_Egg.png)[![Large Brown Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/91/Large_Brown_Egg.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Large_Brown_Egg.png) | [Large Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Egg "Large Egg")
[Large Brown Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Egg "Large Egg") | It's an uncommonly large white egg!
It's an uncommonly large brown egg! | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Large Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Large_Egg.png) | 95g | | ![Large Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Large_Egg.png)
![Silver Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8a/Silver_Quality_Icon.png) | 118g | | ![Large Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Large_Egg.png)
![Gold Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/47/Gold_Quality_Icon.png) | 142g | | ![Large Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Large_Egg.png)
![Iridium Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e4/Iridium_Quality_Icon.png) | 190g | | ## Blue Chickens [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/3/36/BlueChick.png/150px-BlueChick.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:BlueChick.png) [Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:BlueChick.png "Enlarge") A blue chick After seeing [Shane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shane "Shane")'s 8-heart event, each chicken you purchase from [Marnie](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie "Marnie") has a 25% chance of being blue. Aside from appearance, blue chickens are identical to regular white and brown chickens. One subtle benefit to this alternative color is that blue chickens are much easier to spot in a field of grass. Blue chickens are hatched as blue chicks. ## Selling It is possible to sell Chickens. The amount of [gold](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold "Gold") obtained for doing so is dependent on how many hearts the animal has. The more hearts; the higher amount of gold fetched for selling it. The amount of gold obtained for selling a maximum-heart Chicken is data-sort-value="1040">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)1,040g. To sell a coop or barn animal, right-click the animal after petting. The friendship/mood interface appears. Move the cursor over the gold coin button at the right to see how much you can sell the animal for. Click that button and the confirmation that follows to complete the sale. ## Trivia - A blue chicken egg was added to the game [Terraria](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terraria "wikipedia:Terraria") with ConcernedApe's permission in October 2022. ## References 1. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chicken#cite_ref-1 "Jump up")See `Data/FarmAnimals.xnb` in the game files, specifically `EggItemIds`, which are the valid egg items for each animal type. ## History - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Eggs now always give the corresponding color of chicken in the Incubator. Blue chickens can now only be obtained from Marnie's Ranch. | [Animals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals "Animals") and Produce | | --- | | [Coop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop") | # Sea Urchin From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#searchInput) | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | Sea Urchin | | [![Sea Urchin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Sea_Urchin.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Sea_Urchin.png) | | A slow-moving, spiny creature that some consider a delicacy. | | Information | | Source | [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") • [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") • [Turtle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") | | Location | [The Beach](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Beach "The Beach") • [Dangerous Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines#Shrine_of_Challenge "The Mines") | | Season | ![All Seasons Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/55/All_Seasons_Icon.png)[All](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Seasons "Seasons") | | Energy | _Inedible_ | | Sell Price | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Sea Urchin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Sea_Urchin.png) | 160g | | ![Sea Urchin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Sea_Urchin.png)
![Silver Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8a/Silver_Quality_Icon.png) | 200g | | ![Sea Urchin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Sea_Urchin.png)
![Gold Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/47/Gold_Quality_Icon.png) | 240g | | ![Sea Urchin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Sea_Urchin.png)
![Iridium Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e4/Iridium_Quality_Icon.png) | 320g | | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | Artisan Sell Prices | | Roe | Aged Roe | ![Artisan.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/46/Artisan.png) Aged Roe _(+40%)_ | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Dark Purple Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/58/Dark_Purple_Roe.png) | 110g | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Dark Purple Aged Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a5/Dark_Purple_Aged_Roe.png) | 220g | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Dark Purple Aged Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a5/Dark_Purple_Aged_Roe.png) | 308g | | | The **Sea Urchin** is a [forageable](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") item found year-round in the [Tide Pool](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Beach#Tide_Pools "The Beach") section of [the Beach](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Beach "The Beach"), _i.e.,_ to the east of the wooden footbridge[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#cite_note-location-1). During [Summer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer") 12-14 extra Sea Urchins appear anywhere on the beach (including possibly the western section). It may also be found foraging on levels 1-29 of [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") while the [Shrine of Challenge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines#Shrine_of_Challenge "The Mines") is enabled, or the [Danger in The Deep](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Danger_In_The_Deep "Quests") quest is active. The average spawn rate for Sea Urchin in the tide pool section of the beach is 0.23/day. An additional 0.8 (on average) Sea Urchins per day will spawn during Summer 12-14. These spawn rates are not affected by the presence of other forageable items on the beach; in particular, Sea Urchins are not part of the standard six item per map limit on forageable items. 7 [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") XP are granted for every Sea Urchin picked up, and all Foraging bonuses apply to Sea Urchins. [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily") may occasionally send you a Sea Urchin in the mail as a gift. She also sells five Sea Urchins at her [shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival#Villager_Shops "Desert Festival") at the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival") for data-sort-value="5">![Calico Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Calico_Egg.png) 5 [Calico Eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Calico_Egg "Calico Egg") each. All saltwater [Crab Pot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab_Pot "Crab Pot") [fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish") may also produce a Sea Urchin in a [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"), when the population of the pond reaches 5. It can also be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") turtle with max [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"). ## Contents - [1Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#Gifting) - [2Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#Bundles) - [3Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#Crafting) - [4Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#Tailoring) - [5Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#Fish_Pond) - [6Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#Quests) - [7Secrets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#Secrets) - [8References](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#References) - [9History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#History) ## Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/0b/Vincent_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Vincent "Vincent")[Vincent](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Vincent "Vincent") • [![Willy Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/73/Willy_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Willy "Willy")[Willy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Willy "Willy") • [![Wizard Urchin is used in the ![Bundle Teal.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/ce/Bundle_Teal.png)[Dye Bundle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Dye_Bundle "Bundles") on the [Bulletin Board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Bulletin_Board "Bundles"). ## Crafting | Image | Name | Description | Ingredients | Recipe Source | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Bait Maker.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c0/Bait_Maker.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Bait_Maker.png) | [Bait Maker](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bait_Maker "Bait Maker") | Place a fish inside to create targeted bait. | ![Iron Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6c/Iron_Bar.png)[Iron Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Bar "Iron Bar") (3)![Coral.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b1/Coral.png)[Coral](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coral "Coral") (3)![Sea Urchin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Sea_Urchin.png)Sea Urchin (1) | ![Fishing Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/e/e7/Fishing_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Fishing_Skill_Icon.png)[Fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing#Fishing_Skill "Fishing") Level 6 | ## Tailoring Sea Urchin can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the dyeable [![Shirt139.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Shirt139.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt139.png)[Strapped Top](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). It can be used in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"), serving as a purple dye at the dye pots, located in [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane"). ## Fish Pond Although Sea Urchins are not otherwise considered to be fish, they can be placed in a [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"), where they will reproduce every 4 days. The initial pond capacity is 10 Sea Urchins; no quests are necessary to increase the pond capacity. The only possible output is purple Sea Urchin [Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe"). **[Produce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Produce "Fish Pond")** | Item(s) Produced | Fishing XP Granted | Population | % of Items | Overall Daily Chance | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | ![Purple Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Purple_Roe.png)[Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") (1) | 14 | 1-4 | 10% | 2.3-5% | | 5-8 | 28% | 15-22% | | 9-10 | 51% | 44-48% | | ![Purple Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Purple_Roe.png)[Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") (5) | 14 | 9-10 | 2% | 1.7-1.9% | | _Nothing_ | | 1-4 | 90% | 98-95% | | 5-8 | 72% | 85-78% | | 9-10 | 47% | 54-50% | ## Quests - One or two Sea Urchins may be requested by various saltwater fish in [Fish Pond quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond"). - Two Sea Urchins may be requested by the Raccoon at the [Giant Stump](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Giant_Stump "Giant Stump") as part of his fifth request, or as part of any request starting with the sixth. ## Secrets - [Hats can be placed on sea urchins in a fish tank](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secrets#Hats "Secrets"). ## References 1. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Urchin#cite_ref-location_1-0 "Jump up")See `Beach::DayUpdate` in the game code. The spawn position starts at point (65,11) on the beach map. ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). Can be requested in [Fish Pond quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond"). Can be produced by Fish Ponds. Can be added to Fish Ponds. - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Can now be added to [Fish Tanks](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Tank "Fish Tank"). - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Now used to craft [Bait Maker](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bait_Maker "Bait Maker"). Elliott is now neutral towards Sea Urchin. Can now be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") turtle with max [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"). Can now be purchased from [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily") at the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival"). Now liked by [Evelyn](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Evelyn "Evelyn"). ![Iridium Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e4/Iridium_Quality_Icon.png) | 600g | | | The **Duck Feather** is an [animal product](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:Animal_Products "Category:Animal Products") obtained from a [Duck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Duck "Duck") with sufficient [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"), [mood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Mood "Animals"), and [daily luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck"). It can also occasionally be purchased from the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart") for data-sort-value="250"![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)750–1,250g. Additionally, if the player is married to [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily"), she will occasionally gift one to the player. The [Statue Of Endless Fortune](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Statue_Of_Endless_Fortune "Statue Of Endless Fortune") produces one Duck Feather on [Leo](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Leo "Leo")'s birthday, [Summer 26](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer"). It can also be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") cat with max [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"). [Luck buffs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck#Luck_Buffs "Luck") do not influence the chances of getting a duck feather. ## Contents - [1Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Duck_Feather#Gifting) - [2Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Duck_Feather#Bundles) - [3Recipes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Duck_Feather#Recipes) - [4Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Duck_Feather#Tailoring) - [Bulletin Board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Bulletin_Board "Bundles"). ## Recipes Duck Feather is not used in any recipes. ## Tailoring Duck Feather is used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") with [Cloth](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cloth "Cloth") in the feed to create a ![Shirt012.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/72/Shirt012.png)[Lime Green Striped Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). It is a green dye when used in the spool of the Sewing Machine with a dyeable clothing item in the feed. It can be placed in the green dye pot at Emily's and Haley's house for use in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"). ## Quests Duck Feather is not used in any [quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests "Quests"). ## History - [1.0](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.0 "Version History"): Introduced. - metadata.title: Duck Feather - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The Duck Feather is an animal product obtained from a Duck with sufficient friendship, mood, and daily luck. It can also occasionally be purchased from the Traveling Cart for data-sort-value="250"750–1,250g. Additionally, if the player is married to Emily, she will occasionally gift one to the player. The Statue Of Endless Fortune produces one Duck Feather on Leo's birthday, Summer 26. It can also be gifted by a pet cat with max friendship.

# Battery Pack

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#searchInput)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Battery Pack |
| [![Battery Pack.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/25/Battery_Pack.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Battery_Pack.png) |
| It's fully charged with precious energy. |
| Information |
| Source | [Lightning Rod](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lightning_Rod "Lightning Rod") • [Solar Panel](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Solar_Panel "Solar Panel") • ![Iridium Bat.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d5/Iridium_Bat.png)[Iridium Bat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bats "Bats") (5%) • [Stingray](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stingray "Stingray") [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") |
| Sell Price | data-sort-value="500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)500g |

The **Battery Pack** is created in the [Lightning Rod](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lightning_Rod "Lightning Rod") during [thunderstorms](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weather "Weather") or the [Solar Panel](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Solar_Panel "Solar Panel") after 7 sunny days.

To acquire a Battery Pack from a Lightning Rod, during a thunderstorm a particular sound will be heard, which means that one of the rods is now charged, pulsating with energy. There is no guarantee that a specific lightning rod will be struck by lightning during a thunderstorm. On the day after the storm, a Battery Pack can be acquired from it.

Battery Packs can sometimes be purchased from the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart") for data-sort-value="500"![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)1,500–2,500g and can be sold to Robin at the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop"). Very rarely, a Battery Pack can be dropped by breaking boxes or crates in the [Skull Cavern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern "Skull Cavern"). They may also be dropped by [Iridium Bats](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bats "Bats") (5% chance). Three Battery Packs are the reward for completing the ![Bundle Green.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b3/Bundle_Green.png)[Children's Bundle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Children.27s_Bundle "Remixed Bundles") on the [Bulletin Board (Remixed)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Bulletin_Board "Remixed Bundles"). [Kent](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Kent "Kent") and [Pam](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pam "Pam") may also send the player a Battery Pack in the mail. They can also be acquired from a [Stingray](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stingray "Stingray") [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") with a population of at least 9.

## Contents

- [1Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#Crafting)
- [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#Gifting)
- [3Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#Bundles)
- [4Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#Tailoring)
- [5Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#Quests)
- [6Gallery](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#Gallery)
- [7History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Battery_Pack#History)

## Bundles

Battery Pack is used in the ![Bundle Purple.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a1/Bundle_Purple.png)[Engineer's Bundle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Engineer.27s_Bundle "Remixed Bundles") in the [Boiler Room (Remixed)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Boiler_Room "Remixed Bundles").

## Tailoring

Battery Pack is used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") with [Cloth](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cloth "Cloth") in the feed to create a ![Shirt106.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/44/Shirt106.png)[Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). It is a cyan dye when used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sewing_Machine "Sewing Machine") with a dyeable clothing item in the feed. It can be placed in the blue dye pot at [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house for use in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing").

## Quests

- A Battery Pack is needed for ["The Mysterious Qi" quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#The_Mysterious_Qi "Quests").
- [Pam](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pam "Pam") requests a Battery Pack by mail on the 19th of [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall") (year 2) in the ["Pam Needs Juice" quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Pam_Needs_Juice "Quests"). The reward is data-sort-value="400">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)400g and 1 [Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") heart.
- [Willy's Boat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Shop#Willy.27s_Boat "Fish Shop") needs 5 Battery Packs to repair the ticket stand.

## Gallery

- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c9/Rod_normal_vs_charged.gif)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rod_normal_vs_charged.gif)







Uncharged vs Charged [Lightning Rod](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lightning_Rod "Lightning Rod")

- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/3/33/Rod_lightning.gif/106px-Rod_lightning.gif)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rod_lightning.gif)







Lightning striking a Lightning Rod


## History

- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). Used as an ingredient to the Mini-Jukebox recipe.
- [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Is now used in a remixed bundle. Used as an ingredient to the Farm Computer recipe. Five are now required to repair [Willy's Boat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Shop#Willy.27s_Boat "Fish Shop"). Can now be obtained from Stingray [Fish Ponds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") and [Solar Panels](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Solar_Panel "Solar Panel").

“A true angler has respect for the water... don't you forget that.” | | — Willy | **Willy** is a [villager](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Villagers "Villagers") who grew up traveling among the [Fern Islands](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Setting#Fern_Islands "Setting") and now lives south of [Pelican Town](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pelican_Town "Pelican Town") on [The Beach](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Beach "The Beach"). He sells [bait](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bait "Bait") and [fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing "Fishing") supplies in his [shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Shop "Fish Shop"). His shop is open every day but will be closed on Saturday if the weather is nice enough for him to go fishing. ## Schedule Most days Willy fishes at [the beach](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Beach "The Beach") for a few hours before operating his [fish shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Shop "Fish Shop") between 9am and 5pm. During winter he'll go to [the saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon") after work. Willy's shop is closed on Saturday while he's out fishing unless it's raining. Willy never visits the [Beach Resort](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island#Beach_Resort "Ginger Island") on Ginger Island, though he ferries other villagers to and from the Island. Shown below are Willy's schedules prioritized highest to lowest. He's often seen at [the saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon") in the evenings, especially during the [winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter"), when he sits with [Clint](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clint "Clint"). He lives close to [Elliott](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Elliott "Elliott"); the two of them are the only residents of [the beach](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Beach "The Beach"). He is also friends with [Elliott](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Elliott "Elliott"). ## Gifts _Main article: [Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship#Gifts "Friendship")__See also: [List of All Gifts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/List_of_All_Gifts "List of All Gifts")_ You can give Willy up to two gifts per week (plus one on his birthday), which will raise or lower his [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") with you. Gifts on his birthday (![Summer.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/85/Summer.png) 24 [Summer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer")) will have 8× effect and show a unique dialogue. For loved or liked gifts, Willy responds | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “A birthday gift? That's very kind of you! I love it.” | | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “You remembered my birthday! Thank you. He says he needs your help and asks you to come inside. Once inside, you see [Crabs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab "Crab") run amok, covering the Fish Shop floor. Before you can do anything to help, [Gus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gus "Gus") enters the Fish Shop and offers to purchase all the crabs, minus a discount for the labor involved. Willy agrees, and Gus gathers the crabs. Afterward, Gus turns to you and says he's going to run a special on [Crab Cakes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab_Cakes "Crab Cakes") for the next few days (but not to tell Willy). The cutscene ends with Willy saying goodbye to his "sweet ladies" as they are taken away to be killed and cooked.
Gus will sell an unlimited amount of Crab Cakes at [the Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon") for data-sort-value="550">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)550g each starting on the day of the cutscene and for 3 days after. Ready for some ice fishing?” | **Yes. I'll do my best!**_(No effect on [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship").)__"That's the spirit!"_**Yes, and I'm going to beat you!**_(No effect on [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship").)__"We'll see."_**To be honest, no. I'm bad at fishing.**_(No effect on [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship").)__"Well, then think of it as good practice!"_ **[SquidFest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/SquidFest "SquidFest")** _Winter 12_ | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “Don't give up just yet! There's more squid in these waters...” | _Winter 13_ | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “It warms me ol' winter heart to see all these anglers gathered here, all for the love o' fishing...” | **[Night Market](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Night_Market "Night Market")** _Winter 15 (at [the Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon"))_ | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “I can't get me a good night's sleep with that night market going on... eh, but that's okay. I'm flexible.” | _Winter 16 (at [the Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon"))_ | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “Have you been on the deep-sea submarine? The captain's an old friend.” | _Winter 17 (at [the Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon"))_ | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “Ah, nothin' like a hot beverage to wind down after a cold, dark day...” | **[Feast of the Winter Star](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Feast_of_the_Winter_Star "Feast of the Winter Star")** | | | | --- | --- | | “ | “Do you want to hear the Legend of the Winter Star?” | **Yes**_(No effect on [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship").)__"In the night sky of winter, there is a bright star only visible from this valley. No one knows why this is... but in times of old people would come from far and wide to see it.\*They believed that anyone who laid eyes on the Winter Star would be blessed with good fortune. Some even claim that the mysterious fruit known as [Stardrop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stardrop "Stardrop") is connected to the Winter Star in some way."_**No thanks**_(No effect on [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship").)__"Suit yourself."_ | ## Quests - ["To The Beach"](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#To_The_Beach "Quests"): Willy will send you a letter on the 2nd of [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") asking you to meet him on the beach south of town. The reward is a [Bamboo Pole](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bamboo_Pole "Bamboo Pole"). - ["Catch a Squid"](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Catch_a_Squid "Quests"): Willy will send you a letter on the 2nd of [Winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter") asking you to catch and bring him a [Squid](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Squid "Squid"). The reward is data-sort-value="800">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)800g and 1 [Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") heart. - ["Catch a Lingcod"](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Catch_a_Lingcod "Quests"): Willy will send you a letter on the 13th of [Winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter"), year 2, asking you to catch and bring him a [Lingcod](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lingcod "Lingcod"). The reward is data-sort-value="550">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)550g and 1 [Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") heart. - **Fishing**: Willy may randomly request that you catch a certain number of a specific fish from the current season at the ["Help Wanted" board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Help_Wanted_Quests "Quests") outside [Pierre's General Store](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store"). The reward is 3x the fish's base value (per fish). (You get to keep the fish). - **Item Delivery**: Willy may request that you bring him a random item at the ["Help Wanted" board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Help_Wanted_Quests "Quests") outside [Pierre's General Store](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store"). The reward is 3x the item's base value and 150 [Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") points. - Willy is to be gifted the [Wriggling Worm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Wriggling_Worm "Quests") in [The Pirate's Wife](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#The_Pirate.27s_Wife "Quests") quest. - ["Juicy Bugs Wanted!"](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Juicy_Bugs_Wanted "Quests"): On the Special Orders board in front of the [Mayor's Manor](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayor%27s_Manor "Mayor's Manor"), Willy may randomly request that the player collect 100 [Bug Meat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bug_Meat "Bug Meat") and place it in the bin next to the [Fish Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Shop "Fish Shop"). The reward is data-sort-value="3000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)3,000g and the [Quality Bobber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quality_Bobber "Quality Bobber") recipe. - ["Tropical Fish"](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Tropical_Fish "Quests"): On the Special Orders board in front of the [Mayor's Manor](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayor%27s_Manor "Mayor's Manor"), Willy may randomly request that the player catch 5 [Stingray](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stingray "Stingray"), 5 [Blue Discus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blue_Discus "Blue Discus"), and 5 [Lionfish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lionfish "Lionfish"). The reward is data-sort-value="2500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)2,500g and a [Deluxe Fish Tank](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Deluxe_Fish_Tank "Deluxe Fish Tank"). Completing this special order also unlocks the Deluxe Fish Tank for sale at the [Fish Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Shop "Fish Shop"). This special order requires [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island") to be unlocked and the Island Resort to be built. - Willy offers a different [fishing quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival#Willy.27s_Fishing_Quests "Desert Festival") for each day of the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival"): - Spring 15: He challenges the player to catch 3 [Sandfish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sandfish "Sandfish"). The reward is data-sort-value="25">![Calico Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Calico_Egg.png) 25. - Spring 16: He challenges the player to catch 1 [Scorpion Carp](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scorpion_Carp "Scorpion Carp"). The reward is data-sort-value="50">![Calico Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Calico_Egg.png) 50. - Spring 17: He asks the player to return his [Golden Bobber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Bobber "Golden Bobber"). The reward is data-sort-value="30">![Calico Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Calico_Egg.png) 30. ## Portraits - [![Willy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/82/Willy.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy.png) - [![Willy Happy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Willy_Happy.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy_Happy.png) - [![Willy Concerned.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c6/Willy_Concerned.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy_Concerned.png) - [![Willy Smoking.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/0c/Willy_Smoking.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy_Smoking.png) - [![Willy Winter 00.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/24/Willy_Winter_00.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy_Winter_00.png) - [![Willy Winter 01.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/1e/Willy_Winter_01.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy_Winter_01.png) - [![Willy Winter 02.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a7/Willy_Winter_02.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy_Winter_02.png) - [![Willy Winter 03.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b8/Willy_Winter_03.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Willy_Winter_03.png) ## Trivia - At one point before the game was released, Willy was named "Dick". - It is implied that Willy catches fish for a living. However, the only time the player sees Willy catch a fish is at the [Festival of Ice](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Festival_of_Ice "Festival of Ice"). - One [Pearl](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pearl "Pearl") may be obtained from Willy after filling a Fish Pond with 10 [Crabs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab "Crab"). - Willy's shirt can be tailored with 1 [Cloth](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cloth "Cloth") and 1 [Dish O' The Sea](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dish_O%27_The_Sea "Dish O' The Sea"), creating the [Shirt O' The Sea](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Shirts "Tailoring"). ## History - [1.3.27](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.3.27 "Version History"): Added 6-heart event. - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Fixed bug where all recipes would be sent at 3 friendship hearts. Willy now is neutral towards Dish O' The Sea, Maki Roll, and Sashimi. Fixed bug where skipping intro cutscene would not count towards introductions quest. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Added custom gift reactions. Added dialogue. Added winter portraits. Added 3 new fishing quests for the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival"). Willy now loves [Gold Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Bar "Gold Bar") and likes [Escargot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Escargot "Escargot"). | metadata.title: Willy - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Willy is a villager who grew up traveling among the Fern Islands and now lives south of Pelican Town on The Beach. He sells bait and fishing supplies in his shop.  His shop is open every day but will be closed on Saturday if the weather is nice enough for him to go fishing.
metadata.keywords: Stardew Valley Wiki, Stardew Valley, Willy, gift

# Explosive Ammo From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Explosive_Ammo#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Explosive_Ammo#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | Explosive Ammo | | [![Explosive Ammo.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f3/Explosive_Ammo.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Explosive_Ammo.png) | | Fire this with the slingshot. | | Information | | Source | - [Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting "Crafting")
- [Adventurer's Guild](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Adventurer%27s_Guild "Adventurer's Guild") | | Sell Price | data-sort-value="20">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)20g | | Crafting | | Recipe Source | ![Combat Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/c/cf/Combat_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Combat_Skill_Icon.png)[Combat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Combat "Combat") Level 8 | | Ingredients | ![Iron Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6c/Iron_Bar.png)[Iron Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Bar "Iron Bar") (1)![Coal.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a7/Coal.png)[Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") (2) | | Produces | 5 Explosive Ammo per craft | **Explosive Ammo** is a one-time use item that damages anything within its explosion radius. Unlike other [explosive items](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Bombs "Crafting"), it must be used with a [slingshot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weapons#Slingshot "Weapons"). The Explosive Ammo crafting recipe is unlocked at [Combat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Combat "Combat") Level 8. For each time it's crafted, the player will get 5 pieces of Explosive Ammo. After the recipe is unlocked, it can be purchased from the [Adventurer's Guild](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Adventurer%27s_Guild "Adventurer's Guild") for data-sort-value="300">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)300g each. To equip a slingshot with explosive ammo, select the ammo, then Right-Click on the slingshot. Ammo will detonate when it hits an enemy, the wall of a cave, a ladder, or water. Otherwise, it will pass straight through other objects, such as rocks or plants. ## Contents - [1Radius](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Explosive_Ammo#Radius) - [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Explosive_Ammo#Gifting) - [3Dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Explosive_Ammo#Dyeing) - [4History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Explosive_Ammo#History) ## Radius Explosive Ammo has a radius of 2 tiles. [![Explosive Ammo range.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/24/Explosive_Ammo_range.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Explosive_Ammo_range.png) ## Gifting | Villager Reactions # Children

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#searchInput)

You can have **children** only if you are [married](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marriage "Marriage") and have upgraded the [Farmhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farmhouse "Farmhouse") for the second time which adds a nursery and an extra room. After you go to bed for the night, your spouse might ask (1/20 chance) if you want to have/adopt a child. You can answer "yes" or "not now." Same-gender couples will adopt children, and opposite-gender couples will have biological children. If you [remove the crib via a house renovation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop#House_Renovations "Carpenter's Shop"), you cannot have new children (whether adoptive or biological) unless the crib is replaced.

You can have only two children; one male and one female. The gender of the first child is random, and the gender of the second child is the opposite of the first child. Children never grow up past the Toddler stage (Stage 4). You will have the option to acquire a second child only after the first child has grown to the Toddler stage.

Your spouse will also take your children when they're at least in the toddler stage to events such as the [Stardew Valley Fair](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stardew_Valley_Fair "Stardew Valley Fair") where they can be found walking around your spouse. There is also a glitch causing them to appear on the same tile and overlap.

## Contents

- [1Biological children](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Biological_children)
- [2Adopted children](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Adopted_children)
- [3Stages](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Stages)
  - [3.1Stage 1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Stage_1)
  - [3.2Stage 2](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Stage_2)
  - [3.3Stage 3](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Stage_3)
  - [3.4Stage 4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Stage_4)
- [4Dismissing Children](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Dismissing_Children)
- [5Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Friendship)
- [6Multiplayer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Multiplayer)
- [7Secrets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#Secrets)
- [8History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Children#History)

## Biological children

If you maintain a 10-heart relationship with your spouse, already have the [nursery](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farmhouse "Farmhouse"), have not [removed the crib](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop#House_Renovations "Carpenter's Shop"), and have been married for at least 7 days, there is a ≈5% chance that you will be asked if you want to have a child. If you agree, the baby will be born after 14 days and appear in the crib in the nursery. If you say "not now", there will be a ≈5% chance that your spouse will ask again, each night that you are married (and maintain 10 hearts).

For the first 14 days in the nursery, the baby will stay sleeping. After this, they will begin to stand in the crib (except when sleeping) for another 14 days, but you can play with them. Once this stage has passed, they will be allowed out of their crib for another 28 days to crawl around in your house during the day.

Finally, the baby will enter the toddler stage for the rest of their life. They will start sleeping in one of the beds in the nursery, freeing the crib for another child (if you do not already have two children).

## Adopted children

The adoption process is very similar to having a child biologically. If you maintain a 10-heart relationship with your spouse, already have the nursery, have not [removed the crib](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop#House_Renovations "Carpenter's Shop"), and have been married for at least 7 days, there is a ≈5% chance that you will be asked if you want to adopt a child.

If you agree, the adoption will occur after 14 days. While you are waiting for your child, your spouse will tell you that the adoption paperwork has been filed.

Your child will appear in the middle of the night, with a note saying that the adoption agency has dropped off your new baby.

## Stages

### Stage 1

_14 days long. The first stage of a child. Interacting with the child during this stage will give the player a prompt reading: "\[child's name\] is sleeping."._

[![Child Stage 1.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f0/Child_Stage_1.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Child_Stage_1.png)

### Stage 2

_14 days long. When interacting with the child, the player will toss them into the air, which raises the relationship level. After 7pm, the child will sleep and can no longer be interacted with._

[![Child Stage 2.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Child_Stage_2.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Child_Stage_2.png)

### Stage 3

_28 days long. The child will start crawling around the house and playing with toys. Sometimes, they might be buggy and get stuck in furniture. At 7pm they will return to the crib and can no longer be interacted with._

[![Child Stage 3.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d4/Child_Stage_3.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Child_Stage_3.png)

### Stage 4

_The child will dash around the house. Interacting with the child will increase the relationship level._

[![ToddlerComposite.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/0c/ToddlerComposite.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:ToddlerComposite.png)

## Dismissing Children

Children can be dismissed late game by interacting with the [Dark Shrine of Selfishness](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dark_Shrine_of_Selfishness "Dark Shrine of Selfishness") inside the [Witch's Hut](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Witch%27s_Hut "Witch's Hut"). By offering the shrine a [Prismatic Shard](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Prismatic_Shard "Prismatic Shard") it will allow players to turn children into doves, making them leave the farm forever. Once dismissed, children are gone for good and cannot be returned. Note, however, that this will open up the possibility of your spouse asking if you want to have children again, unless the crib has been removed. If a child is wearing a hat when they are dismissed, the hat will show up in the [Lost and Found](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayor%27s_Manor#Lost_and_Found "Mayor's Manor") the next morning. See [Secrets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secrets "Secrets") for the easter eggs that this unlocks.

## Friendship

[Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") with children works similarly to friendship with non-marriageable villagers. Some specific details:

- You may not increase friendship with a child in stage 1. Friendship stays at 0 points.
- When the child first reaches stage 2, their friendship is set to 250 points (1 heart).
- In stage 2-4, you may interact with the child (heart balloon appears above their head) to increase friendship by 20 points, once per day.
- You cannot give gifts to children.
- Friendship with children is subject to [Decay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship#Decay "Friendship") just like with normal villagers; specifically, each day you don't interact with a child, friendship decays by 2 points. When a child reaches 10 hearts, decay stops.
- The [Bulletin Board Bundle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Bulletin_Board "Bundles") and the soup tasting at the [Luau](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luau "Luau"), despite affecting friendship points with most villagers, do not affect friendship with children.

## Multiplayer

If you are married to a farmhand in co-op mode, the main player will randomly be asked if they want children overnight. If the main-player says yes, the question is asked to the farmhand. Once both players say yes, a child will be born, following the above rules.

## Secrets

- Hats can be [placed on children](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secrets#Hats "Secrets").
- Dismissing children unlocks several related [Easter eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secrets#Dove_Children "Secrets").

## History

- [1.0](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.0 "Version History"): Introduced.
- [1.1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.1 "Version History"): Dying or passing out the day before will no longer skip the birth event. Added ability to dismiss children via a shrine at the [Witch's Hut](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Witch%27s_Hut "Witch's Hut").
- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Added ability to put hats on children, secret event after dismissing children, removed bug where child would never be born/delivered if triggered the same day a bundle/joja reward was completed, removed ability to interact with Stage 2 children when they are sleeping.
- [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Children now attend festivals. "Remove Crib" house renovation introduced.

Retrieved from " [https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Children&oldid=183603](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Children&oldid=183603)"

[Category](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Special:Categories "Special:Categories"):

- [NPCs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:NPCs "Category:NPCs")

## Navigation menu

### Search

[Visit the main page](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stardew_Valley_Wiki "Visit the main page")

# Skills From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#searchInput) | | | | | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [Getting\
\
Started](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Getting_Started "Getting Started") | [The\
\
Player](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Player "The Player") | [Options](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Options "Options") | [Controls](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Controls "Controls") | [Mobile\
\
Controls](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mobile_Controls "Mobile Controls") | [Health](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Health "Health") | [Energy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Energy "Energy") | Skills | [Day\
\
Cycle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Day_Cycle "Day Cycle") | ## Contents - [1Proficiency](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Proficiency) - [1.1Affected Tools](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Affected_Tools) - [1.2Unaffected Tools](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Unaffected_Tools) - [2Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Farming) - [3Mining](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Mining) - [4Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Foraging) - [4.1Experience Points](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Experience_Points) - [5Fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Fishing) - [6Combat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Combat) - [7Changing Professions](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Changing_Professions) - [8Skill-Based Title](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Skill-Based_Title) - [9Mastery](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Mastery) - [10History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#History) **Skills** are player attributes which are leveled up through the use of specific tools or actions, or by reading [Books](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Books "Books"). Each skill has ten levels. A skill level increase is awarded immediately upon earning enough experience points (XP) for a new level, and is immediately displayed on the skills tab of the inventory. The first time the player levels up a skill on each day, they are notified with "You've got some new ideas to sleep on." The new skill level immediately increases the proficiency of the tool(s) associated with that skill. Overnight, after the player goes to bed on the day a skill level increases, a popup announces the increase, and additionally awards knowledge of any applicable crafting or cooking recipes. At level 5 and level 10, players also select which one of two available Professions to specialize in. Each profession has its own set of benefits, such as sell price bonuses for related items. It should be noted that awards of recipe knowledge or profession benefits do not take place until seen in the popup overnight, and are not available until the first thing the following morning. In particular, items sold or shipped the day of the skill level increase do not receive the new price bonuses. Like recipes, profession benefits are only available beginning the following day. All skills need the following experience points to increase skill level: | | Lvl | Experience | Total Experience | | --- | --- | --- | | 1 | 100 | 100 | | 2 | +280 | 380 | | 3 | +390 | 770 | | 4 | +530 | 1300 | | 5 | +850 | 2150 | | | Lvl | Experience | Total Experience | | --- | --- | --- | | 6 | +1150 | 3300 | | 7 | +1500 | 4800 | | 8 | +2100 | 6900 | | 9 | +3100 | 10000 | | 10 | +5000 | 15000 | | A variety of skills can be temporarily improved by eating specific [foods](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cooking "Cooking"). These skills will appear as a [buff](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Buffs "Buffs") icon next to the player clock in the user interface. Skills can be viewed in the player skill tab in the game pause menu. | | | | --- | --- | | ![Farming Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/8/82/Farming_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Farming_Skill_Icon.png)[Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Farming "Skills") | Levels are gained by harvesting [crops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crops "Crops") and caring for animals. Each level grants +1 hoe and watering can proficiency (see [tools](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools "Tools")). | | ![Mining Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/2/2f/Mining_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Mining_Skill_Icon.png)[Mining](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Mining "Skills") | Mining skill is increased by breaking rocks (normally done with a [Pickaxe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes "Pickaxes")). Each level grants +1 pickaxe proficiency. | | ![Foraging Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/f/f1/Foraging_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Foraging_Skill_Icon.png)[Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Foraging "Skills") | Foraging skill includes both gathered [foraged](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") goods, and wood from trees chopped with an axe [tool](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools "Tools"). Each level grants +1 axe proficiency. | | ![Fishing Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/e/e7/Fishing_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Fishing_Skill_Icon.png)[Fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Fishing "Skills") | Fishing is associated with successfully completing the [fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing "Fishing") mini-game or catching [fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish") in a [Crab Pot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab_Pot "Crab Pot"), increasing the fishing skill. Each level grants +1 fishing rod proficiency. | | ![Combat Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/c/cf/Combat_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Combat_Skill_Icon.png)[Combat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Combat "Skills") | Combat is a skill tied to the player's ability to fight against [monsters](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Monsters "Monsters"). | ## Proficiency Proficiency refers to the amount of [energy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Energy "Energy") required to use a specific tool. At skill level 0, each successful use of a [Pickaxe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes "Pickaxes"), [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes"), or [Hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes") costs 2 energy. Unsuccessful uses ( _e.g.,_ attempting to chop a [Large Log](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Log "Large Log") with the starter axe) cost 1 energy. Each cast of the [Fishing Pole](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools#Fishing_Poles "Tools") costs 8 energy, even if the cast fails ( _e.g.,_ the fishing line does not land in water). The starter [Watering Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Watering_Cans "Watering Cans") uses 2 [energy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Energy "Energy"). Each increase in skill decreases energy requirements by 0.1 points for specific tools (listed [below](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Affected_Tools)). Skill increases past level 10 (only possible temporarily via [Buffs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Buffs "Buffs")) continue to decrease the energy requirements. So, for example, using a Pickaxe at Mining level 13 costs only 0.7 points per swing. (The game keeps track of fractional amounts of energy, but in the user interface they are rounded to the nearest integer.) Powering up an upgraded Watering Can increases its energy cost by 2 points per power-up; each increase in skill decreases the energy requirement by 0.1 points (regardless of power level). At Farming Level 0, the starter can uses 2 energy to water one tile; the iridium can at maximum power uses 10 energy to water eighteen tiles. At Farming Level 10, the starter can uses 1 energy; the iridium at maximum power uses 9 energy (10 minus 0.1 per skill level). Using an upgraded can to water fewer tiles than it is able costs the same energy as the first watering can upgrade that is able to water that many tiles (single tile always the same as starter can, 5 tiles always the same as steel can). Attempting to use an empty watering can doesn't use energy. Filling a watering can never uses energy. Upgrading an Axe, Pickaxe, or Hoe does not alter the amount of energy required to use it. The increased power of the Axe and Pickaxe and increased area-of-effect of the Hoe will result in less overall energy used for the same task than a lower-level tool. Note that all Hoes use the same energy (2 points at Farming Level 0, and 1 point at Farming Level 10), whether powered-up or used to till one tile of soil. All fishing poles use the same energy: 8 points at Fishing Level 0, and 7 points at Fishing Level 10. | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | ### Affected Tools
**Farming**
- [Hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes")
- [Watering Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Watering_Cans "Watering Cans")
**Foraging**
- [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes")
**Fishing**
- [Fishing Rod](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools#Fishing_Poles "Tools")
**Mining**
- [Pickaxe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes "Pickaxes") | | ### Unaffected Tools

- [Iridium Scythe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Scythe "Iridium Scythe")

- [Shears](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shears "Shears") | Neither loading a [Crab Pot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab_Pot "Crab Pot") with [Bait](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bait "Bait") nor harvesting it uses any energy, at any skill level. ## [![Farming Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/82/Farming_Skill_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Farming_Skill_Icon.png) Farming _Main article: [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming")_ [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") skill is gained by harvesting [crops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crops "Crops"). harvesting | ![Rain Totem.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f7/Rain_Totem.png)[Rain Totem](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rain_Totem "Rain Totem") | ![Lumberjack.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/cc/Lumberjack.png)**Lumberjack** All trees have a chance to drop [hardwood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hardwood "Hardwood"). | ![Botanist.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/86/Botanist.png)**Botanist** Foraged items are always highest quality. | | ![Tapper Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a4/Tapper_Icon.png)**Tapper** [Syrups](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper#Products "Tapper") worth 25% more. | ![Tracker.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c5/Tracker.png)**Tracker** Location of forageable items revealed. | ### Experience Points Experience points (XP) are granted as follows: - **14 XP** for chopping down a [tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees "Trees") with an axe (granted all at once for the last chop that causes the tree to fall). - **2 XP** for removing the tree stump after chopping down a tree. - **1 XP** for each [Twig](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Farm#Debris "The Farm") chopped down. - **1 XP** for each piece of [Moss](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Moss "Moss") harvested from trees. - **1 XP** per berry for shaking [Blackberries](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blackberry "Blackberry") and [Salmonberries](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Salmonberry "Salmonberry") off bushes in their respective seasons. - **25 XP** for removing [Large Stumps](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Stump "Large Stump") and [Large Logs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Log "Large Log"). - **7 XP** for each foraged item picked up from the ground. - If the Gatherer profession doubles the foraged item, another **7 XP** is granted for the extra item. - **7 XP** for each [Ginger](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger "Ginger") harvested. - **3 XP** for each [Spring Onion](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring_Onion "Spring Onion") harvested from [Cindersap Forest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cindersap_Forest "Cindersap Forest") in [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring"). - **2 XP** for items grown from [Wild Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Seeds "Crafting") (also 3 [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") XP). - If the Gatherer profession doubles the foraged item, another **2 XP** is granted for the extra item. - **7 XP** for each item panned from [panning](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pans "Pans"). For instance, if the player obtained 3 items from panning, they will receive 21 XP. - **5 XP** for each mushroom collected from [the Farm Cave](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Cave "The Cave") if the mushroom option was selected, and from [Mushroom Logs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mushroom_Log "Mushroom Log"). - **7 XP** for each fruit collected from [the Farm Cave](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Cave "The Cave") if the fruit bats option was selected. - **15 XP** for digging up a [Seed Spot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Seed_Spot "Seed Spot") or [Artifact Spot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Spot "Artifact Spot"). - **15 XP** for destroying a large [Green Rain](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weather#Green_Rain "Weather") [weed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weeds "Weeds"). - **250 XP** for reading a copy of the [Woodcutter's Weekly](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodcutter%27s_Weekly "Woodcutter's Weekly") or [Book Of Stars](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Book_Of_Stars "Book Of Stars"). The 7 XP for foraging items applies solely to those items visible sitting on the ground that are picked up only if the player clicks on them; it does not apply to items lying on the ground ( _e.g.,_ dropped by shaking) that are automatically added to the player inventory by [magnetism](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magnetism "Magnetism"). Specific items that do grant 7 XP include: - Standard randomly-spawned foraged items throughout Stardew Valley and Calico Desert. - All items foraged from [the Beach](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Beach "The Beach") and [the west side of Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island#Island_West "Ginger Island"). - All fruit collected from [the Farm Cave](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Cave "The Cave"), if the fruit bat option was selected. - All mushrooms collected from the [Ginger Island Mushroom Cave](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island#Dig_Site "Ginger Island"). - [Truffles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Truffle "Truffle"). - Forage items spawned on the ground in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") and [Skull Cavern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern "Skull Cavern"), namely [Red Mushrooms](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Red_Mushroom "Red Mushroom"), [Purple Mushrooms](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Purple_Mushroom "Purple Mushroom"), and [Fiddlehead Ferns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiddlehead_Fern "Fiddlehead Fern"). **The following Items do NOT grant any foraging experience:** - Trees or [twigs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Farm#Debris "The Farm") felled by [Bombs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Bombs "Crafting") (however, weakening a tree with bombs before felling it with an axe will still give full XP). - [Grapes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grape "Grape") grown from [Grape Starters](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grape_Starter "Grape Starter") (grants [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") XP instead). - Items grown in [Garden Pots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garden_Pot "Garden Pot"). - Items dug up by tilling soil in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") or [Skull Cavern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern "Skull Cavern") ( _e.g.,_ [Cave Carrot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cave_Carrot "Cave Carrot")) - Mushrooms obtained from chopping or tapping a [Mushroom Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mushroom_Tree "Mushroom Tree"). - Non-forage items spawned on the ground in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") and [Skull Cavern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern "Skull Cavern"), namely [Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quartz "Quartz"), [Earth Crystals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Earth_Crystal "Earth Crystal"), [Frozen Tears](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Tear "Frozen Tear"), [Fire Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fire_Quartz "Fire Quartz"), and [Dinosaur Eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dinosaur_Egg "Dinosaur Egg") \-\- except that a [bug](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Bug) causes any duplicates created by the Gatherer profession to give 7 XP. - Forageables obtained from killing [Monsters](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Monsters "Monsters"). ## [![Fishing Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Fishing_Skill_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Fishing_Skill_Icon.png) Fishing _Main article: [Fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing "Fishing")_ Fishing Skill is increased by catching [Fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish"), [Trash](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trash "Trash"), [Seaweed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Seaweed "Seaweed"), [Green Algae](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Algae "Green Algae"), or [White Algae](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae "White Algae") with a Fishing Rod/Pole or by harvesting [Crab Pots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crab_Pot "Crab Pot"). Reading [Bait And Bobber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bait_And_Bobber "Bait And Bobber") or the [Book Of Stars](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Book_Of_Stars "Book Of Stars") also gives Fishing experience. Each level grants +1 Fishing Rod [Proficiency](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Proficiency), increases the minimum fish size (in/cm) and bobber bar height, and decreases the max amount of time before fish bite. (2x Critical strike damage) | ## Changing Professions [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/4/43/Statue_Of_Uncertainty.png/300px-Statue_Of_Uncertainty.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Statue_Of_Uncertainty.png) [Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Statue_Of_Uncertainty.png "Enlarge") The Statue Of Uncertainty The [Statue Of Uncertainty](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Sewers#Statue_Of_Uncertainty "The Sewers") in [The Sewers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Sewers "The Sewers") allows the player to change professions. After donating data-sort-value="10000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)10,000g, the statue requires the player to choose one skill to change. That night after the player goes to bed, the Level 5 "Choose a profession" screen will appear, followed by the corresponding Level 10 "Choose a profession" screen for the skill selected at the statue. Only skills for which professions have already been chosen will appear on the Statue's menu. As soon as the player chooses a profession to change, the bonuses for existing professions disappear. Skills that give bonuses to sell prices will not apply to items placed in the [shipping bin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shipping "Shipping") the day the profession is changed. Just like levelling up a skill at the end of the day causes the player to wake up with full [energy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Energy "Energy") the next day no matter what, using this statue on any given day will cause the player to wake up with full energy the next day as well. ## Skill-Based Title Based on the total Skill level a certain Title is given under the player's name in the Skills tab of the Player Menu. Their level and title are also visible when hovering over their picture on the Inventory Tab of the Player Menu. The level is calculated as follows: `(farmingLevel + fishingLevel + foragingLevel + combatLevel + miningLevel + luckLevel) / 2` If the resulting number ends in 0.5, the decimal value is truncated, and only the integer portion is considered. Here are the possible Titles: - level ≥ 30: Farm King - level > 28: Cropmaster - level > 26: Agriculturist - level > 24: Farmer - level > 22: Rancher - level > 20: Planter - level > 18: Granger - level > 16: Farmgirl/Farmboy - level > 14: Sodbuster - level > 12: Smallholder - level > 10: Tiller - level > 8: Farmhand - level > 6: Cowpoke - level > 4: Bumpkin - level > 2: Greenhorn - level ≤ 2: Newcomer Luck level 10, in addition to level 10 in all Skills, would be needed to get the highest title, Farm King. However, luck level (a value separate from daily [Luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck")) is not implemented in the game. In the game code, Luck appears to have been intended as a 6th skill that could be leveled up, like the other skills. This means the highest level possible is 25, making "Farmer" the best obtainable title. ## Mastery _Main article: [Mastery Cave](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mastery_Cave "Mastery Cave")_ Once the player has reached max level in all skills, they can open a door in [Cindersap Forest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cindersap_Forest "Cindersap Forest") to enter the [Mastery Cave](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mastery_Cave "Mastery Cave"). Here, players can use extra experience to level up their mastery level. Farming experience points only contribute to mastery points at a 50% rate, while experience points for the rest of the skills contribute to mastery points at a 100% rate. | Level | Mastery Points Required for This Level | Total Mastery Points Required Through This Level | | --- | --- | --- | | 1 | 10,000 | 10,000 | | 2 | 15,000 | 25,000 | | 3 | 20,000 | 45,000 | | 4 | 25,000 | 70,000 | | 5 | 30,000 | 100,000 | The mastery levels can be used to master the five skills, unlocking different perks. Masteries achieved are shown on the [Special Items & Powers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Special_Items_%26_Powers "Special Items & Powers") tab of the player's inventory. | Name | Rewards | | --- | --- | | ![Farming Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/82/Farming_Skill_Icon.png)

metadata.title: Skills - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Skills are player attributes which are leveled up through the use of specific tools or actions, or by reading Books. Each skill has ten levels. A skill level increase is awarded immediately upon earning enough experience points (XP) for a new level, and is immediately displayed on the skills tab of the inventory. The first time the player levels up a skill on each day, they are notified with "You've got some new ideas to sleep on." The new skill level immediately increases the proficiency of the tool(s) associated with that skill.

# Beet Seeds

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Beet_Seeds#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Beet_Seeds#searchInput)
