| Plant these in the fall. Takes 6 days to mature. |
| Information |
| Crop: | ![Beet.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a4/Beet.png)[Beet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Beet "Beet") |

| Season: | ![Fall.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5d/Fall.png)[Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall") |

| ![Morris Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/3c/Morris_Icon.png)[JojaMart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart "JojaMart"): | Not Sold |
| ![Sandy Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/7d/Sandy_Icon.png)[Oasis](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oasis "Oasis"): | data-sort-value="20">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)20g |
| ![Traveling Cart Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a6/Traveling_Cart_Icon.png)[Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart"): | data-sort-value="10"![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100–1,000g |

**Beet Seeds** are a type of seed. Mature plants yield [Beets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Beet "Beet").

They can be purchased at the [Oasis](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oasis "Oasis") and occasionally from the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart"). They can also be obtained by using the [Seed Maker](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Seed_Maker "Seed Maker"). Five to twenty Beet Seeds may occasionally be found in [treasure rooms](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern#Treasure_Rooms "Skull Cavern") in the Skull Cavern.

## Stages

| Stage 1 | Stage 2 | Stage 3 | Stage 4 | Harvest |

| 1 Day | 1 Day | 2 Days | 2 Days | Total: 6 Days |

![Gold Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/47/Gold_Quality_Icon.png) | 525g | | | | Recipe | | Recipe Source(s) | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Cooking Channel.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/d/d6/Cooking_Channel.png/44px-Cooking_Channel.png) | [The Queen of Sauce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Queen_of_Sauce "The Queen of Sauce") | | 21 Spring, Year 2 | | | Ingredients | ![Fried Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/18/Fried_Egg.png)[Fried Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fried_Egg "Fried Egg") (1)![Milk.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/92/Milk.png)[Milk](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Milk "Milk") (1)![Hashbrowns.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8f/Hashbrowns.png)[Hashbrowns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hashbrowns "Hashbrowns") (1)![Pancakes.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6b/Pancakes.png)[Pancakes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pancakes "Pancakes") (1) | **Complete Breakfast** is a [cooked dish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cooking "Cooking"). It is prepared using either the kitchen inside an upgraded [farmhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farmhouse "Farmhouse") or a [Cookout Kit](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cookout_Kit "Cookout Kit"). Complete Breakfast may randomly appear in [Krobus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Krobus "Krobus")' shop on [Saturdays](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Saturday "Days of the Week"), in the [Garbage Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garbage_Can "Garbage Can") outside the saloon, or in [the Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon")'s rotating stock. The [Statue Of Endless Fortune](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Statue_Of_Endless_Fortune "Statue Of Endless Fortune") produces one Complete Breakfast per year on [Alex](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Alex "Alex")'s birthday, [Summer 13](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer"). Five Complete Breakfasts are the reward for completing the ![Bundle Yellow.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/2b/Bundle_Yellow.png)[Home Cook's Bundle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Home_Cook.27s_Bundle "Remixed Bundles") on the [Bulletin Board (Remixed)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Bulletin_Board "Remixed Bundles"). One Complete Breakfast may be received from opening a [Mystery Box](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mystery_Box "Mystery Box"). In total ingredients, cooking a Complete Breakfast from scratch requires 2 [Eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg"), 1 [Oil](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oil "Oil"), 1 [Wheat Flour](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wheat_Flour "Wheat Flour"), 1 [Potato](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Potato "Potato"), and 1 [Milk](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Milk "Milk"). ## Contents - | ## Bundles Complete Breakfast is not used in any [bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles "Bundles"). ## Recipes Complete Breakfast is not used in any recipes. ## Tailoring Complete Breakfast is used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") with [Cloth](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cloth "Cloth") in the feed to create a ![Shirt000.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/db/Shirt000.png)[Classic Overalls](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). It is a yellow dye when used in the spool of the Sewing Machine with a dyeable clothing item in the feed. It can be placed in the yellow dye pot at [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane"), for use in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"). ## Quests Complete Breakfast is not used in any [quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests "Quests"). ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Can now be prepared using a [Cookout Kit](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cookout_Kit "Cookout Kit"). ![Iridium Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e4/Iridium_Quality_Icon.png) | 225g | | | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | Artisan Sell Prices | | Roe | Aged Roe | ![Artisan.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/46/Artisan.png) Aged Roe _(+40%)_ | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Orange Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c0/Orange_Roe.png) | 67g | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Orange Aged Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ec/Orange_Aged_Roe.png) | 134g | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Orange Aged Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ec/Orange_Aged_Roe.png) | 187g | | | The **Woodskip** is a [fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish") that can be caught in the pond in the [Secret Woods](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secret_Woods "Secret Woods") during any season. It is most prevalent there on non-rainy days, with each cast having a 15% to 27% chance to hook a Woodskip depending on [fishing skill](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Fishing "Skills"). The Woodskip is more likely to hook at higher Fishing Zones.[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#cite_note-spawnrate-1) It can also be caught on the [Forest Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Forest "Farm Maps"), with each cast having a 0% to 17.5% chance to hook a Woodskip depending on daily [luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck").[\[2\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#cite_note-fish-2) It can also randomly be found at the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart") for data-sort-value="75"![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)225–1,000g. ## Contents - [1Map](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#Map) - [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#Gifting) - [3Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#Bundles) - [4Recipes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#Recipes) - [5Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#Tailoring) - [6Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#Fish_Pond) - [7Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#Quests) - [8References](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#References) - [9History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#History) ## Map The Woodskip can be found in the Secret Woods and the Forest Farm. ![Health.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Health.png) 33 | ![Linus Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/db/Linus_Icon.png)[Linus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Linus "Linus") (Mail - 3+ ![HeartIconLarge.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/04/HeartIconLarge.png/32px-HeartIconLarge.png)) | data-sort-value="75">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)75g | ## Tailoring The Woodskip can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the [Fishing Vest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). [![Shirt157.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/0e/Shirt157.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt157.png) It can be used in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"), serving as an orange dye at the dye pots, located in [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane"). ## Fish Pond Woodskips can be placed in a [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"), where they will reproduce every 2 days. The initial pond capacity is 1 fish, but the capacity can be increased to 10 by completing four quests. Typical output includes orange Woodskip [Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") and [wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood"), but other tree-related products are possible starting at 12% | 80-51% | | 6-7 | 10% | 44-36% | | 8 | 10% | 29% | | 9-10 | 8% | 20-13% | ## Quests - Two Woodskip may be requested by [Dorado](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dorado "Dorado"), [Lingcod](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lingcod "Lingcod"), or [Pike](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pike "Pike") in a [Fish Pond quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond") to increase the capacity of the pond from 7 to 10. ## References 1. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#cite_ref-spawnrate_1-0 "Jump up")See "Spawn rate" on the [Modding fish data](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Modding:Fish_data#Spawn_rate "Modding:Fish data") page. 2. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woodskip#cite_ref-fish_2-0 "Jump up")See `Farm::getFish` in the game code. The exact chance is equal to `0.05 + Daily Luck` meaning there is no chance of hooking a Woodskip if daily luck is at or below -0.05. Maximum chance occurs with a natural daily luck of 0.1 and having the [Special Charm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Special_Charm "Special Charm"). ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Added iridium quality. Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). Can be requested in [Fish Pond quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond"). - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Fixed bug allowing the Woodskip to be hooked with the [Training Rod](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Training_Rod "Training Rod") on the [Forest farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Forest "Farm Maps"). | metadata.title: Woodskip - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The Woodskip is a fish that can be caught in the pond in the Secret Woods during any season. It is most prevalent there on non-rainy days, with each cast having a 15% to 27% chance to hook a Woodskip depending on fishing skill. The Woodskip is more likely to hook at higher Fishing Zones.[1] It can also be caught on the Forest Farm, with each cast having a 0% to 17.5% chance to hook a Woodskip depending on daily luck.[2] It can also randomly be found at the Traveling Cart for data-sort-value="75"225–1,000g.
metadata.keywords: Stardew Valley Wiki, Stardew Valley, Woodskip, gift

# Pickaxes From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes#searchInput) The **Pickaxe** is a [tool](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools "Tools") obtained at the beginning of the game. It is used mainly for breaking [stones](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stone "Stone"), particularly when [Mining](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining "Mining"), although it has other uses and can also remove certain objects. For example, the pickaxe can be used to pick up placed items, such as floor tiles, [sprinklers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Sprinklers "Crafting"), or [artisan equipment](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Artisan_Equipment "Crafting"), much like an [axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes"). In a similar way, the pickaxe can also strike small plants like [weeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weeds "Weeds") or other [crops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crops "Crops") on the farm to remove them. Only the pickaxe can un-till soil that has previously been tilled ( _i.e.,_ it can remove strikes from a [Hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes")). This process is overall done in two stages; striking once will remove any crops on top, leaving the underlying tilled soil intact (including any [fertilizer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fertilizer "Fertilizer") present). Striking a second time tilled soil will revert the tile to an un-tilled state, removing any applied [fertilizer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fertilizer "Fertilizer"). The pickaxe also applies this two-stage removal process to for items placed on top of floor tiles, while the axe will remove both the object and the floor at once. Also, using the pickaxe on a [Monster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Monsters "Monsters") will deal a small portion of damage, similar to other [weapons](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weapons "Weapons"). However, another unique use case is hitting a [Crab](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rock_Crab "Rock Crab") 5 times with a pickaxe which will knock off its shell, and cause the crab to flee rather than attack the player. ## Grades of Pickaxe The Pickaxe may be upgraded at the [Blacksmith](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith "Blacksmith"). The cost and resource requirements for each upgrade are shown in the table below. As a summary of the upgrade effects, with each upgrade level the number of hits required to break a stone or [node](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Mining_Nodes "Mining") is reduced, and it becomes possible to break harder types of rocks. | Image | Name | Cost | Ingredients | Improvements | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Pickaxe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b7/Pickaxe.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pickaxe.png) | Pickaxe | Starter Tool | N/A | Can break small rocks anywhere.
In [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines"), can break tougher rocks on floors 1-39 in 2 hits and can break large [boulders](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Boulder "Boulder") with multiple hits. Can break [Copper Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Copper_Node "Mining") in 3 hits.
Note: Cannot break boulders on [the Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Farm "The Farm"). | | [![Copper Pickaxe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d7/Copper_Pickaxe.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Copper_Pickaxe.png) | Copper Pickaxe | data-sort-value="2000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)2,000g | ![Copper Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f1/Copper_Bar.png)[Copper Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Copper_Bar "Copper Bar") (5) | In the Mines, can break all rocks on floors 1-39 in 1 hit and 40-79 in 2 hits. Can break Copper Nodes in 2 hits. | | [![Steel Pickaxe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d1/Steel_Pickaxe.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Steel_Pickaxe.png) | Steel Pickaxe | data-sort-value="5000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)5,000g | ![Iron Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6c/Iron_Bar.png)[Iron Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Bar "Iron Bar") (5) | Needed to break boulders on the Farm.
In the Mines, can break rocks on floors 40-79 in 1 hit, and [Quarry Mine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quarry_Mine "Quarry Mine") rocks in 2 hits.
Breaks Copper Nodes in 1 hit, [Iron Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Iron_Node "Mining") in 2 hits, [Gold Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Gold_Node "Mining") in 3 hits, and [Iridium Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Iridium_Node "Mining") in 6 hits. Can break boulders in 4 hits.
Can break the barrier inside the Mines that blocks the player from talking with the [Dwarf](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf "Dwarf"). | | [![Gold Pickaxe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d3/Gold_Pickaxe.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Gold_Pickaxe.png) | Gold Pickaxe | data-sort-value="10000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)10,000g | ![Gold Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/4e/Gold_Bar.png)[Gold Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Bar "Gold Bar") (5) | Can break a [meteorite](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Random_Events#Meteorite "Random Events").
In the Mines, can break rocks on floors 80-120 in 1 hit. Breaks Copper and Iron Nodes in 1 hit, Gold Nodes in 2 hits, and Iridium Nodes in 4 hits. Can break boulders in the Quarry Mine in 4 hits. | | [![Iridium Pickaxe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/ca/Iridium_Pickaxe.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Iridium_Pickaxe.png) | Iridium Pickaxe | data-sort-value="25000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25,000g | ![Iridium Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c4/Iridium_Bar.png)[Iridium Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Bar "Iridium Bar") (5) | Can break rocks in the [Quarry Mine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quarry_Mine "Quarry Mine") and [Skull Cavern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern "Skull Cavern") in 1 hit. Breaks [Diamond Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Diamond_Node "Mining") in 2 hits and all other gem nodes in 1 hit. Can break boulders in the Quarry Mine in 3 hits. | ## Energy Cost _See [Proficiency](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Proficiency "Skills")_ | [Tools](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools "Tools") | | --- | | Basic | [Axes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes") • [Golden Scythe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Scythe "Golden Scythe") • [Iridium Scythe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Scythe "Iridium Scythe") • [Hoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes") • [Pans](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pans "Pans") • Pickaxes • ![Iridium Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e4/Iridium_Quality_Icon.png) | 180g | | | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | | Artisan Sell Prices | | Roe | Aged Roe | ![Artisan.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/46/Artisan.png) Aged Roe _(+40%)_ | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Green Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e2/Green_Roe.png) | 60g | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Green Aged Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Green_Aged_Roe.png) | 120g | | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Green Aged Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Green_Aged_Roe.png) | 168g | | | The **Shad** is a [fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish "Fish") that can be caught in the river (in [Pelican Town](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pelican_Town "Pelican Town") or [Cindersap Forest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cindersap_Forest "Cindersap Forest")) and the [Riverlands Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Riverland "Farm Maps"), [Forest Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Forest "Farm Maps"), or [Hill-Top Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Hill-Top "Farm Maps") during [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring"), [Summer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer"), and [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall") while [raining](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weather "Weather"). It can also be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") cat with max [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"). It may also randomly appear in [Krobus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Krobus "Krobus")' shop on [Wednesdays](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Wednesday "Days of the Week") for data-sort-value="200">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)200g, or at the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart") for data-sort-value="60"![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)180–1,000g. Shad can be caught regardless of weather, time, or season using [Magic Bait](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magic_Bait "Magic Bait"). ## Contents - [1Map](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#Map) - [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#Gifting) - [3Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#Bundles) - [4Recipes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#Recipes) - [5Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#Tailoring) - [6Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#Fish_Pond) - [7Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#Quests) - [8History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shad#History) ## Map Shad can be found in the river. ![Health.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Health.png) 33 | ![Linus Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/db/Linus_Icon.png)[Linus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Linus "Linus") (Mail - 3+ ![HeartIconLarge.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/04/HeartIconLarge.png/32px-HeartIconLarge.png)) | data-sort-value="75">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)75g | ## Tailoring Shad can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the dyeable [Fish Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). [![Shirt158.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e7/Shirt158.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt158.png) It can be used in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"), serving as a green dye at the dye pots, located in [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane"). ## Fish Pond Shad can be placed in a [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"), where they will reproduce every 2 days. The initial pond capacity is 3 fish, but the capacity can be increased to 10 by completing three quests. The only possible output is green Shad [Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe"). **[Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond")** | Pond Capacity | Quest Item | Fishing XP Granted | | --- | --- | --- | | Before Quest | After Quest | | 3 | 5 | 3 [Acorns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Acorn "Acorn"), 10 [Bug Meat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bug_Meat "Bug Meat"), 3 [Maple Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Seed "Maple Seed"), or 3 [Pine Cones](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pine_Cone "Pine Cone") | 30 | | 5 | 7 | 3 [Gold Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Ore "Gold Ore"), 1 [Maple Syrup](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Syrup "Maple Syrup"), or 5 [Mixed Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mixed_Seeds "Mixed Seeds") | 30 | | 7 | 10 | 1 [Crayfish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crayfish "Crayfish"), 1 [Honey](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Honey "Honey"), 2 [Jade](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Jade "Jade"), or 1 [Periwinkle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Periwinkle "Periwinkle") | 30 | **[Produce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Produce "Fish Pond")** | Item(s) Produced | Fishing XP Granted | Population | % of Items | Overall Daily Chance | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | ![Green Roe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e2/Green_Roe.png)[Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") (1) | 12 | 1-10 | 90% | 21-86% | | _Nothing_ | | 1-10 | 10% | 79-14% | ## Quests Shad is not used in any [quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests "Quests"). ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Added iridium quality. Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Is now used in a remixed bundle. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Can now be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") cat with max metadata.title: Shad - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The Shad is a fish that can be caught in the river (in Pelican Town or Cindersap Forest) and the Riverlands Farm, Forest Farm, or Hill-Top Farm during Spring, Summer, and Fall while raining. It can also be gifted by a pet cat with max friendship. It may also randomly appear in Krobus' shop on Wednesdays for data-sort-value="200">200g, or at the Traveling Cart for data-sort-value="60"180–1,000g.
metadata.keywords: Stardew Valley Wiki, Stardew Valley, Shad, gift

# Blacksmith From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | Blacksmith | | [![Blacksmith.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/be/Blacksmith.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Blacksmith.png) | | ![Maplocation.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/5/5c/Maplocation.png/40px-Maplocation.png)
![Map.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/43/Map.png) | | Open Hours: | 9:00am to 4:00pm | | Closed: | [Friday](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Friday "Days of the Week"), after [Community Center](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Community_Center "Community Center") restored and at 10:30 AM Winter 16 | | Address: | Across the town's river, to the bottom right | | Occupants: | ![Clint Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/74/Clint_Icon.png)[Clint](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clint "Clint") | _This article is about the store and building. For the profession, see [Mining#Mining Skill](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Mining_Skill "Mining")._ Clint's **Blacksmith** shop provides multiple services primarily related to [resources](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:Resources "Category:Resources") found in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines"). It chiefly serves as a location for upgrading [tools](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools "Tools"), and breaking open [geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Geodes "Minerals"), although he also trades in [Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") and ores ( [copper](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Copper_Ore "Copper Ore"), [iron](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Ore "Iron Ore"), & [gold](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Ore "Gold Ore")). Finally, the building is also [Clint](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clint "Clint")'s home, and his bedroom is out the back of the shop floor. ## Contents - [1Stock](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#Stock) - [1.1Selling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#Selling) - [2Upgrade Tools](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#Upgrade_Tools) - [3Process Geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#Process_Geodes) - [4Tips](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#Tips) - [5External Links](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#External_Links) - [6Gallery](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#Gallery) - [7History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith#History) ## Stock The purchase prices of ore and coal increase in Years 2+. The player will receive a letter in the mail on [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") 1 of Year 2 saying "Notice: The price of raw materials at [Robin's shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop") and Clint's shop has increased." The gold obtained by selling items to Clint (or through the [shipping bin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shipping "Shipping")) does not increase. | Item | Name | Description | Year 1
Price | Year 2+

data-sort-value="750">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)750g | ### Selling Similar to how it is possible to sell crops directly to [Pierre](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store"), it is also possible to sell [gems](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Gems "Minerals"), [minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals "Minerals"), ore, and bars directly to Clint. Note that Clint will not directly buy any kind of [geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Geodes "Minerals") (although it is possible to sell any ores they contain back to him). ## Upgrade Tools [Clint](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clint "Clint") can upgrade the four main [tools](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools "Tools") and the [Trash Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trash_Cans "Trash Cans") in the inventory menu incrementally. That is to say, the previous quality of the tool is required to upgrade it to the next level. It takes 2 days to upgrade a tool. Other Blacksmith services are still available while Clint is upgrading a tool. A notification will pop up on the left side of the screen on the morning a tool upgrade is ready. Note that even when Blacksmith's shopfront itself is closed on festival days (although the door will not be shut for the [Dance of the Moonlight Jellies](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dance_of_the_Moonlight_Jellies "Dance of the Moonlight Jellies") in the Summer, and the [Spirit's Eve](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spirit%27s_Eve "Spirit's Eve") festival in the Fall), Clint will still work on tools. If a player drops off a tool the day before a festival, it will be ready the day after the festival as normal. However, if a player drops off a tool 2 days before a festival and the Blacksmith's shop is closed due to the festival, the player will be unable to pick up the tool and must wait an additional day. All [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes") and [Pickaxe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes "Pickaxes") upgrades reduce the number of hits necessary to remove trees and rocks. In addition, higher level tools can break larger objects of their respective type (logs and stumps for Axes, boulders and meteorites for Pickaxes). Upgraded versions of the [Watering Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Watering_Cans "Watering Cans") and [Hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes") allow the player to water and till multiple squares of land in a single use (using click-and-hold). Upgrading the Watering Can also refills it. The trash can upgrades increase the autosell value of any objects placed into them up to 60%. | Image | Name | Ingredient | Cost | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Copper [geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Geodes "Minerals") for data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g. [Gems](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Gems "Minerals") and [Minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Geode_Minerals "Minerals") can be found within, as well as common resources like [Stone](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stone "Stone"), [Clay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clay "Clay"), and [Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal"). If the sell price of the item inside the geode is data-sort-value="75">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)75g or less, a "clink" sound will be heard when it is broken open. Otherwise a short melody will be heard and the item will sparkle. [Artifact Troves](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Trove "Artifact Trove") can be purchased from the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for 5 [Omni Geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode "Omni Geode"). Clint will break these open like a geode, but instead of [minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals "Minerals"), [artifacts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifacts "Artifacts") or treasures can be found inside. | Image | Name | Description | Cost to Process | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/43/Geode.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Geode.png) | [Geode](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Geode "Geode") | A blacksmith can break this open for you. | data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g | | [![Frozen Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/bf/Frozen_Geode.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Frozen_Geode.png) | [Frozen Geode](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Geode "Frozen Geode") | A blacksmith can break this open for you. | data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g | | [![Magma Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/89/Magma_Geode.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Magma_Geode.png) | [Magma Geode](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magma_Geode "Magma Geode") | A blacksmith can break this open for you. | data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g | | [![Omni Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/09/Omni_Geode.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Omni_Geode.png) | [Omni Geode](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode "Omni Geode") | A blacksmith can break this open for you. Who knows what might be inside? | data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g | ## Tips - To avoid missing a day of watering, water crops, then upgrade the Watering Can when the weather report indicates rain the next day. Crops will be watered the day the can is taken to the Blacksmith, the following day by the rain, and the Watering Can can be picked up the day after that. It can also be a good idea to upgrade the watering can near the end of a season if there is nothing in the ground that will bear fruit until then. - Regarding coal prices, during year 1, it's cheaper to buy wood from the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop") and use a [Charcoal Kiln](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Charcoal_Kiln "Charcoal Kiln") to make [coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") than it is to buy coal from the Blacksmith's. Conversely, starting in year 2, the price of [wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") increases from data-sort-value="10">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)10g to data-sort-value="50">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)50g, so it is cheaper to purchase coal. - At [Mining Skill](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Mining "Skills") 7, it is cheaper to purchase [Iron Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Ore "Iron Ore"), smelt [Iron Bars](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Bar "Iron Bar"), and use the Transmute (Au) recipe to create [Gold Bars](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Bar "Gold Bar") than it is to purchase [Gold Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Ore "Gold Ore") and smelt it into Gold Bars. - Although the door to the Blacksmith locks at 4pm, as long as the player is inside the building they can still interact with the counter after 4pm to make purchases, upgrade tools etc., even after Clint walks away from the counter at 5pm. ## External Links Users with access to their [saved game files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves "Saves") may find the "Stardew Predictor" utility helpful for predicting which items will be produced from breaking open geodes. The utility is located at: [https://mouseypounds.github.io/stardew-predictor/](https://mouseypounds.github.io/stardew-predictor/) ## Gallery - [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/17/Blacksmith_Interior.png/180px-Blacksmith_Interior.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Blacksmith_Interior.png) Interior ## History - metadata.title: Blacksmith - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Clint's Blacksmith shop provides multiple services primarily related to resources found in the Mines. It chiefly serves as a location for upgrading tools, and breaking open geodes, although he also trades in Coal and ores (copper, iron, & gold). Finally, the building is also Clint's home, and his bedroom is out the back of the shop floor.

# Animals

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#searchInput)

## Contents

- [1Pets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets)
  - [1.1New Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#New_Farm)
  - [1.2Additional Pets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Additional_Pets)
  - [1.3Cat or Dog](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Cat_or_Dog)
  - [1.4Turtle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Turtle)
  - [1.5Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship)
    - [1.5.1Pet Gifts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pet_Gifts)
- [2Horse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Horse)
- [3Animal Care](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Animal_Care)
  - [3.1Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship_2)
  - [3.2Mood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Mood)
  - [3.3Produce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Produce)
    - [3.3.1Deluxe and Large Products](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Deluxe_and_Large_Products)
      - [3.3.1.1Duck Feathers and Rabbit Feet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Duck_Feathers_and_Rabbit_Feet)
      - [3.3.1.2Large Eggs and Milk](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Large_Eggs_and_Milk)
    - [3.3.2Quality](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Quality)
    - [3.3.3Golden Animal Crackers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Golden_Animal_Crackers)
  - [3.4Housing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Housing)
  - [3.5Food](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Food)
  - [3.6Animals Trapped Outside](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Animals_Trapped_Outside)
  - [3.7Wild Animal Attacks](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Wild_Animal_Attacks)
  - [3.8Animal Births](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Animal_Births)
- [4Selling Animals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Selling_Animals)
- [5Coop Animals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Coop_Animals)
  - [5.1Chickens](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Chickens)
  - [5.2Ducks](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Ducks)
  - [5.3Rabbits](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Rabbits)
  - [5.4Dinosaurs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Dinosaurs)
- [6Barn Animals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Barn_Animals)
  - [6.1Cows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Cows)
  - [6.2Goats](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Goats)
  - [6.3Sheep](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Sheep)
  - [6.4Pigs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pigs)
  - [6.5Ostriches](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Ostriches)
- [7Slime Hutch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Slime_Hutch)
- [8Other Animals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Other_Animals)
  - [8.1Butterflies](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Butterflies)
  - [8.2Crows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Crows)
  - [8.3Fireflies](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Fireflies)
  - [8.4Frogs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Frogs)
  - [8.5Owls](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Owls)
  - [8.6Parrots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Parrots)
  - [8.7Seagulls](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Seagulls)
- [9Bugs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Bugs)
- [10References](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#References)
- [11History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#History)

**Animals** fulfill several roles on the farm. Some are wildlife, which cannot be interacted with. A pet (cat, dog, or turtle) can be earned which the player can form a friendship with. A horse can be purchased to ride. And "farm animals" can be purchased which serve as a source of various kinds of produce, providing resources and profit.

Farm animals require a building to house them. These may be obtained from [Robin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Robin "Robin") at the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop"), and usually require three days each to build. Baby farm animals (and related equipment needed for harvesting produce) can then be purchased from [Marnie's Ranch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie%27s_Ranch "Marnie's Ranch"). Animals may also be hatched from an [Incubator](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Incubator "Incubator"). As soon as an animal is acquired, it must be assigned to an existing farm building of the right type, which is designated as its home. Each building has a limit to the number of animals it can house. Animals can be assigned to a different building by first petting it and then interacting with it a second time. A pop-up box appears that allows the reassignment to be made.

Baby farm animals must first mature into adults before they are able to produce animal products. Each morning, adult animals that live in coops (chickens, ducks, rabbits and dinosaurs) have a chance of producing products that can be gathered from the floor of their building. Using the [Milk Pail](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Milk_Pail "Milk Pail"), cows can usually be milked daily, and goats can usually be milked once every two days. Sheep can be shorn with the [Shears](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shears "Shears") when their wool grows in, and pigs can be let outside to dig up [Truffles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Truffle "Truffle") that can then be picked up from the barnyard. Ostrichs leave their eggs on barns floor, like coop animals.

## Pets

### New Farm

The player is allowed to adopt either a cat or a dog, depending on which was chosen on the character creation screen. There are several different styles of cat and dog.

A cutscene will trigger where [Marnie](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie "Marnie") will be waiting outside the farm's door with a dog or cat on the first sunny Wednesday or Friday morning in [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") after earning data-sort-value="1000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)1,000g. The [Farmhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farmhouse "Farmhouse") must be exited between 6am and 9:30am to trigger this event. By the 20th of Spring the event will trigger, regardless of if the player made enough money. Adopting the pet is optional. Any name can be chosen for the pet the moment it is adopted, though its name cannot be changed after adopting it. If the player has not yet met Marnie before this cutscene, the meeting will count as an introduction.

### Additional Pets

After reaching maximum friendship with the initial pet or reaching Year 2 without a pet, the player can purchase pet licenses from [Marnie's Ranch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie%27s_Ranch "Marnie's Ranch") to adopt additional pets.[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-adoptpet-1) Cats and dogs cost data-sort-value="40000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)40,000g each. There are also two varieties of turtles, one for data-sort-value="60000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)60,000g and the other for data-sort-value="500000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)500,000g. The player should construct one additional outdoor [Pet Bowl](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pet_Bowl "Pet Bowl") for each new pet using the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop"), to avoid losing friendship with that pet. Any pets that are no longer wanted can be removed from the farm by using [Butterfly Powder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Butterfly_Powder "Butterfly Powder") on them.

### Cat or Dog

[Hats can be placed on cats and dogs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secrets#Hats "Secrets").

- [![Cat 1.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/1e/Cat_1.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Cat_1.png)

- [![Cat 2.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/83/Cat_2.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Cat_2.png)

- [![Cat 3.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ec/Cat_3.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Cat_3.png)

- [![Cat 4.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a3/Cat_4.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Cat_4.png)

- [![Cat 5.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/1b/Cat_5.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Cat_5.png)

- [![Dog 1.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a4/Dog_1.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dog_1.png)

- [![Dog 2.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/bb/Dog_2.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dog_2.png)

- [![Dog 3.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/fc/Dog_3.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dog_3.png)

- [![Dog 4.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f7/Dog_4.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dog_4.png)

- [![Dog 5.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a3/Dog_5.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dog_5.png)


- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/63/Pet_Bowl_empty.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pet_Bowl_empty.png)







Empty pet bowl

- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/af/Pet_Bowl_full.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pet_Bowl_full.png)







Full pet bowl

- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/99/Dog.gif)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dog.gif)







From [Dev Blog #29](https://www.stardewvalley.net/dev-update-29/)

- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/29/Cat.gif)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Cat.gif)







From [Dev Blog #29](https://www.stardewvalley.net/dev-update-29/)


### Turtle

Hats cannot be placed on turtles.

- [![Turtle.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e9/Turtle.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Turtle.png)

- [![Iridium Turtle.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/87/Iridium_Turtle.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Iridium_Turtle.png)


### Friendship

Click on the pet once each day to pet it, and they express love [![DialogueBubbleLove.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/63/DialogueBubbleLove.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:DialogueBubbleLove.png) for you.

The pet has a maximum friendship of 1000, increasing by 12 every time it is petted. Every 200 points is equal to 1 level, and having 999 friendship points will make the player eligible for 1 point in [Grandpa](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grandpa "Grandpa")'s Evaluation.

After reaching 1000 friendship points with the pet, the following message pops up: " <Animal Name> loves you ♡"   You can check friendship with the pet in the Animals menu when paused.

There is a [Pet Bowl](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pet_Bowl "Pet Bowl") on some wooden tiles on the farm. It is in the top left area next to the house on the standard, forest, wilderness, hilltop, and riverland farms. It is on the intersection of the different sections on the four corners farm, right above the right shore on the [beach farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps "Farm Maps"), and at the top right area next to the house on the [Meadowlands farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps "Farm Maps"). The bowl can be filled with water for the pet, using a [Watering Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Watering_Cans "Watering Cans"). It cannot be filled by a [sprinkler](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Sprinklers "Crafting"). Watering the pet's bowl will increase the pet's friendship by 6 points by the next morning. Note that this will not trigger if it is raining the next morning. On rainy days, the pet's bowl will automatically be full. If it rains before adopting a pet, the bowl will remain full until adopting a pet.

Unlike with human NPCs, ignoring a pet or using a [slingshot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weapons#Slingshot "Weapons") on it will not decrease friendship. Each night a pet does not have its own Pet Bowl, it will lose 10 friendship points the next morning.[\[2\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-petnobowl-2)

#### Pet Gifts

Upon reaching maximum friendship, each pet may drop items on the ground as a gift for the player when being petted for the first time each day. There is a 20% chance for a pet to drop a gift each day.[\[3\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-petgifts-3) Like gifts sent in the [mail](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Letters "Letters") from villagers, the gift that the pet drops is randomized each time the same day is reloaded. Chances listed below reflect how likely a gift is to be chosen, after passing the 20% chance for any gift to be dropped.

| ExpandPet Gifts |
| --- |
| | Cat Gifts |
| --- |
| Gift | Chance |
| --- | --- |
| Any currently catchable [Mountain fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mountain#Fishing "The Mountain")\\* (1), excluding the [Legend](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Legend "Legend") and [Legend II](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Legend_II "Legend II") | 34.4% |

## Horse

[![Horse.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c3/Horse.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Horse.png)

The horse is an in-game mount that boosts movement speed by 30% (increased by drinking [coffee](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coffee "Coffee")), and doesn't slow down while riding through crops on the farm. It's automatically obtained after purchasing the [Stable](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stable "Stable") from the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop"). The horse can be named once the player tries riding it for the first time, however, the chosen name cannot be changed.

Leaving the horse somewhere will result in it waiting for the player and on their return one of these messages will be shown: "<Horse name> is wondering where you've been" or "Your loyal horse waits patiently for your return". Going to bed after leaving the horse outside [the farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Farm "The Farm") will result in the horse automatically finding its way home and in the stable the next morning.

The horse can't travel through small gaps (except gates) when traveling vertically.

These can be interacted with while mounted on the horse:

- [Gate](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gate "Gate"): can be opened and closed.
- [Coop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop") and [Barn](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn "Barn"): animal doors can be opened and closed.
- [Shipping](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shipping "Shipping") Bin: items can be placed inside.
- [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"): can collect items, add fish, add quest items, change appearance and empty pond.
- [Villagers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Villagers "Villagers"): can speak to villagers.
- [Pets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets): can be petted.

The [Horse Flute](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Horse_Flute "Horse Flute") can be used to warp the horse to the player. It only works outdoors (including [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island") and [the Desert](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Desert "The Desert")).

The Horse can be fed a [carrot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carrot "Carrot") to increase its ![Speed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Speed.png)[Speed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Speed "Speed") (+0.4) for the rest of the day. Reading [Horse: The Book](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Horse:_The_Book "Horse: The Book") will permanently increase the horse's ![Speed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Speed.png)[Speed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Speed "Speed") (+0.5).

[Hats can be placed on horses](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secrets#Hats "Secrets").

## Animal Care

### Friendship

[![DialogueBubbleLove.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/63/DialogueBubbleLove.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:DialogueBubbleLove.png)

Animals that live in barns and coops have a friendship rating that can be seen by right-clicking the animal after petting (while holding [hay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hay "Hay"), this window cannot be opened). The Animals tab in the player menu allows the player to see their friendship rating with all their animals, as well as whether they have petted them that day. The rating is out of 5 hearts, is shown in half-heart increments, and is taken into account when deciding how likely that animal is to produce higher-quality products if that animal is capable of producing them in the first place.

Each half-heart is equivalent to 100 points of friendship, making the maximum value of Friendship 1000.

Actions that affect friendship are as follows:

- Petting (+15, or +30 if player has [Shepherd](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming") or [Coopmaster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming") and animal is of relevant type)
- Milking or Shearing (+5, No penalty for not being milked or sheared)
- Eating [Grass](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grass "Grass") Outside (+8, or +16 if eating [Blue Grass](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grass#Blue_Grass "Grass"))

- Not Fed (-20 _Calculated day-end_)
- Trapped outside overnight (-20 _Calculated day-end_)
- Not Pet/Talked to (-5 to -10, _Calculated day-end by the formula:_ `(10 - (Friendship / 200))`). This means they will lose less friendship if they are already at high friendship.

### Mood

Like friendship, an animal's current mood can be checked by right-clicking after petting the animal.

Mood is a very important factor when determining animal product quality and type. It is only taken into account when the game rolls animal produce at the beginning of the day, and has no effect otherwise.

Mood is a value from 0 to 255. Its current value can be estimated from the message in the animals right click dialogue:

- _<Animal Name> looks really happy today!_ indicates Mood is at least 200 and at most 255.
- _<Animal Name> looks fine._ indicates Mood is at least 30 and less than 200.
- _<Animal Name> looks sad._ indicates Mood is at least 0 and less than 30.

**Actions that affect Mood are as follows** ( _every 10 minutes refers to ingame minutes_):

Increases mood:

- Eating Grass Outside ( **Sets Mood to 255**)
- Petting ( **+32 to +36** dependent on animal type, **double** amount if player has chosen the [Shepherd](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming") or [Coopmaster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming") Profession and the animal is of the relevant type)
- The Season is Winter and the animal is in an area with a [Heater](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Heater "Heater"), and has mood 150 or higher ( **+4 to +8 every 10 minutes** past 6pm the Player stays awake, up to 255. Only one heater required. _overrides all other "every 10 minutes" effects_)
- Animal was fed ( **+4 to +16**, dependent on animal type, Calculated when the Player sleeps, checks whether the animal ate either [hay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hay "Hay") or [grass](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grass "Grass"))
- Animal outside after 6pm, but before 7pm, and has less than 150 Mood ( **+4 to +8 every 10 minutes**, _does not stack with any other "every 10 minutes" effect_)
- The door of the animal's barn or coop was closed behind them at night

Decreases mood:

- Animal outside in the rain or Winter ( **-4 to -8 every 10 minutes**, _does not stack with any other "every 10 minutes" effect_)
- Animal outside past 7pm ( **-4 to -8 every 10 minutes**, _does not stack with any other "every 10 minutes" effect_)
- Animal slept outside ( **-Half of current Mood**, Calculated when the Player sleeps)
- Animal was not petted ( **-20 to -40**, dependent on animal type, Calculated when the Player sleeps)
- Animal was not fed ( **-100**, Calculated when the Player sleeps)

### Produce

New animals must grow to adulthood before they start producing anything. Each animal type has a different amount of days required before they will be able to make a product. For example, cows and chickens can produce milk and eggs every day, and goats generally produce milk every other day. Animals who can produce a Deluxe/Large product will sometimes produce more frequently, however (see "Special case" below.)

If the animal has met the required amount of days to create their product, some additional checks will be made to determine if they will actually produce.

- If the animal was not fed, it will not produce.
- If the animal has less than 70 Mood, there is a chance it will not produce. The lower the mood, the less likely it will produce. The percent chance it will still produce is equal to `Mood / 70`.

Whether an animal produces a Deluxe or Large product, and the quality of the products, is determined at the very beginning of the day by some randomness as well as a combination of Mood and Friendship.[\[4\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-dayupdate-4)

- If an animal has 150 Mood or above, it will gain the ability to produce Quality and Large or Deluxe products. ( **Note, this is just the ability, the actual chance for these items is covered in the sections below, Quality and Large/Deluxe products are not guaranteed**)
- If an animal is below 150 Mood, it still has a chance to have the ability to produce Quality and Large or Deluxe products. The lower the mood, the less likely. The percent chance to gain the ability is equal to `Mood / 150`.

**Special case**: If an animal meets the requirement to produce something, but does not gain the ability to create a Quality or Large/Deluxe product, the game will not register the fact that it produced an item that day. In this case, animals that normally would take multiple days to produce, will produce again immediately the next day.

#### Deluxe and Large Products

A "Mood Modifier" is calculated when rolling for whether Deluxe produce (Large products, Duck Feathers, and Rabbit feet) will be created in the following ways:

- If Mood is more than 200, it will be multiplied by 1.5
- If Mood is 100 or less, then "Mood Modifier" will be the animal's mood minus 100 (This will always result in a negative or zero modifier)
- Otherwise "Mood Modifier" is Zero (Mood is higher than 100, and up to 200)

This "Mood Modifier" will be used in different ways depending on the animal.

##### Duck Feathers and Rabbit Feet

Ducks and rabbits will take into account the Daily [Luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck") to determine if they will create their Deluxe produce.

For each rabbit, an overall score is created using the following formula: `((Friendship + (Mood × Mood Modifier)) / 5000) + Daily Luck`

For each duck, an overall score is created using the following formula: `((Friendship + (Mood × Mood Modifier)) / 4750) + Daily Luck`

For example, a rabbit with 600 Friendship (3 Hearts), 150 Mood, and 0.10 Daily Luck, would be calculated as:

` = ((600 + (150 × 0)) / 5000) + 0.10
`

`= ((600 + 0) / 5000) + 0.10
`

`= 0.22`

Each time a product is rolled, a random number between 0-1 is rolled against this score. If the overall score is higher than the random number, a Deluxe product will be created. **At max Friendship, Mood, and Luck, there is a 40% chance of getting a [Rabbit's Foot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rabbit%27s_Foot "Rabbit's Foot") and a 42% chance of getting a [Duck Feather](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Duck_Feather "Duck Feather").**

##### Large Eggs and Milk

For animals to produce a Large product, the game will take Mood and Friendship into account.

Only animals with 200 or higher friendship can produce Large products.

Each animal will have an overall score created with the following formula: `(Friendship + (Mood × Mood Modifier)) / 1200`

For example, an animal with 600 Friendship (3 Hearts) and 210 Mood would be calculated as:

` = (600 + (210 × 1.5)) / 1200
`

`= (600 + 315) / 1200
`

`= 0.7625`

Each time a product is rolled, a number between 0-1 is chosen randomly. If the overall score is higher than the random number, a Large product will be created. In our example there is a 76% chance of a large product. **An overall score of at least 1200 will guarantee a Large product.**

#### Quality

If the animal has the ability to produce a Quality item (150 mood or higher), it will roll for quality from normal to iridium.[\[4\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-dayupdate-4)

Each animal will have an overall **score** created with the following formula: `(Friendship / 1000) - (1 - (Mood / 225))`

For example, an animal with 600 Friendship (3 Hearts) and 150 Mood would be calculated thus:

`= (600 / 1000) - (1 - (150 / 225))
`

`= 0.6 - (1 - 0.666...)
`

`= 0.6 - 0.333...
`

`= 0.266...`

If the player has the [Shepherd](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming") or [Coopmaster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming") Profession, 0.333 will be added to the **score** for any barn animals or coop animals respectively.

The game will begin checking what quality to create by first seeing if the **score** value is above 0.95. If it is, the **score** divided by 2 will be compared against a random number between 0-1. If the **score** divided by 2 is greater than the random number, the item will be Iridium quality.

_In our given example, a score of **0.266...** is not above 0.95; the item would not be able to become Iridium._

If an Iridium quality item is not produced, the **score** divided by 2 will be compared against a random number between 0-1. If the **score** divided by 2 is greater than the random number, the item will be Gold quality.

_In our given example, a score of **0.266...** would be divided by 2 to become **0.133...**; the item would have a 13% chance to become Gold quality._

If a Gold quality item is not produced, the **score** will be compared against a random number between 0-1. If it is greater than the random number, the item will be Silver quality.

_In our given example, if the item was not Gold, it would have a 26.6% chance to be Silver quality._

If the item is not Silver quality, it will be Normal quality.

#### Golden Animal Crackers

A [Golden Animal Cracker](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Animal_Cracker "Golden Animal Cracker") can be given to any farm animal (except pigs) to permanently double its produce.

### Housing

Buildings can be purchased from the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop"), and will be completed in 3 days. Once placed, buildings can be moved around at the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop") as well.

[Barns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn "Barn"), [Coops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop") and [Slime Hutches](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slime_Hutch "Slime Hutch") house animals, [Silos](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Silo "Silo") store [hay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hay "Hay"), and the [Stable](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stable "Stable") unlocks the [Horse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Horse).

If 2 or more [Coops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop") or [Barns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn "Barn") are built, animals can be relocated by clicking on the animal and choosing the house icon.

### Food

Farm animals who live in barns and coops need to eat every day, one "portion" per animal. They can eat either fresh [grass](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grass "Grass") (if allowed outside) or [hay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hay "Hay") (if kept inside or are unable to find grass). If eating fresh grass, coop animals need to eat 2 tufts of grass (1 tuft of Blue Grass), and barn animals need to eat 4 (2 tufts of Blue Grass).[\[5\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-food-5)[\[6\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-grass-6) They do not die if not fed, but become [upset](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Mood) and cease production of animal products until feeding resumes. They do not need to be fed on a [festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Festivals "Festivals") day (except the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival"), [Trout Derby](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trout_Derby "Trout Derby"), [SquidFest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/SquidFest "SquidFest") and [Night Market](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Night_Market "Night Market")), though they will eat grass if left outside. No hay will be consumed if they are left inside.

Newly hatched, born, or purchased animals do not need to be fed on the day they arrive on the farm, but baby animals thereafter need to eat one "portion" (the same as adults) each day. If they don't have food, they do not grow on that day.

Farm animals prefer fresh grass over hay, and become "very happy today!" (the best [mood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Mood)) upon eating fresh grass. They will not go out in [winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter"), or when it is rainy, stormy, or snowy. Animals that remain inside or do not find grass to eat will eat hay instead, if it is available. Given that growing animal food is more difficult in Winter (Wheat on the Farm disappears on [Winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter") 1, while grass stops spreading and produces less hay when cut), it is advisable to prepare by harvesting as much Hay as possible in Fall.

Slimes in a [Slime Hutch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slime_Hutch "Slime Hutch") need no food, but their troughs can be filled daily with water from the watering can or automatically with a sprinkler. If watered, they will produce [Slime Balls](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slime_Ball "Slime Ball") the next day.

Horses and pets do not need to eat, but pets will be happier once the water bowl is filled each day.

### Animals Trapped Outside

Animals that do go outside normally return to their buildings by 6pm to sleep. Closing the barn doors again in the evening prevents them from leaving immediately in the morning to eat grass, before the player has time to pet and tend to them the next day. Closing the door before all the animals have returned will result in the ones left out overnight vulnerable to wild animal attacks.

The exact conditions that cause an animal to be trapped outside are not clear. It may be more likely for an animal to be trapped outside if the player does not leave the farm after 5pm (when animals begin to return to the barn/coop) and does not enter the barn/coop after 5pm (Leaving the farm and entering the barn/coop after 5pm both causes animals to transport or spawn to the inside of the barn/coop automatically). It may also be more likely to happen if the player goes to bed before 5pm.

If it rains the next day, and the animal was left out, the animal will stay outside in the rain. This is the only instance in which a farm animal will be outside during the rain. Similarly, if an animal is trapped outside on the night of [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall") 28, the animal will stay outside on [Winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter") 1.

An animal left outside its barn/coop will be grumpy the next day.

### Wild Animal Attacks

[![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/e/e1/AnimalAttackDialogue.png/240px-AnimalAttackDialogue.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:AnimalAttackDialogue.png)

[Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:AnimalAttackDialogue.png "Enlarge")

Animal after attack

If an animal has been trapped outside (see [previous section](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Animals_Trapped_Outside)) with the barn or coop doors closed, there is a chance they will be attacked by a wild animal during the night.[\[7\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-dogs-7)

After the player goes to sleep, any events that will happen during the night (such as Bundle events) are calculated as normal. If no events are due to occur, there will be a 50% chance that the game will attempt to start a wild animal attack event. If this event proceeds, the game will go through all buildings to find a barn or coop that has their doors **closed** and has animals left outside.

For each building, the game takes a random number between 0 and 1 and compares it to 1/(the number of total farm buildings). If the random number is larger, the building is ignored. In other words, the more buildings the player has, the less likely that one will be attacked. For example, if the player has two farm buildings, each building has a 50% chance of being attacked, three buildings would give 33%, four would give 25% chance of being attacked, etc.

Once a building has been chosen, the event takes the first animal stuck outside from that building to be the target of the attack. The animal will be removed from the game and in the morning, all other animals will have a mood message saying " _<animal name>_ looks stressed and paranoid today. It seems like something bad happened last night." Besides this message, the other animals are unaffected.

### Animal Births

Similar to animal attacks, if there are no other events occurring in the night, there will be a 50% chance that the game will attempt an animal birth event. The game searches through all buildings for an upgraded Barn that isn't full. The game then makes another check where the chance of proceeding with the event is the number of animals inside multiplied by 0.55%. For example, an upgraded barn with three animals inside would have a 1.65% chance of passing this check. If the building fails this check, the game will continue going through all buildings until none are left.

If a barn passes all these checks, a random animal inside is chosen. If the animal is not a baby and has pregnancy enabled, that animal will give birth.

## Selling Animals

To sell a coop or barn animal, right-click the animal after petting. The friendship/mood interface appears. Move the cursor over the gold coin button at the right to see how much the animal can be sold for. Click that button and the confirmation that follows to complete the sale.

The sell price of a farm animal is `Price × ((Friendship / 1000) + 0.3)`.[\[8\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-sellprice-8)

" `Price`" is read from the game's data file `Data/FarmAnimals.xnb`.

## Coop Animals

These animals cannot be purchased until a [Coop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop") is built on the farm, and must occupy a spot in a coop. They will leave their products inside the coop each morning.

Aside from appearance, blue chickens are identical to white chickens.

A White, Brown, or Blue (if blue has been unlocked) Chicken can be received from incubating an egg of either type (White or Brown).

A Void Chicken must be hatched from a [Void Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Void_Egg "Void Egg") in an [Incubator](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Incubator "Incubator"). There are three ways to obtain a Void Egg. In a random event after sleeping, [a Witch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Random_Events#The_Witch "Random Events") will fly over one of the Big or Deluxe Chicken [Coops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coop "Coop"), leaving a Void Egg in the morning. [Shane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shane "Shane") may also gift a Void Egg if married to him.

To obtain Golden Eggs and Golden Chickens, [Perfection](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Perfection "Perfection") must be reached. After that, a [Golden Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Egg "Golden Egg") can be purchased from [Marnie's Ranch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie%27s_Ranch "Marnie's Ranch") for data-sort-value="100000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100,000g and [Qi's Walnut Room](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Qi%27s_Walnut_Room "Qi's Walnut Room") for data-sort-value="100">![Qi Gem.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/78/Qi_Gem.png) 100. There is also a possibility of [a Witch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Random_Events#The_Witch "Random Events") leaving a Golden Egg in a Coop, or a fishing treasure chest containing a Golden Egg.

## Barn Animals

These animals cannot be purchased until a [Barn](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn "Barn") is built on the farm, and must occupy a spot in a barn. Out of their produces, Milks and Wools are either gathered with a tool. In the case of pigs, they leave Truffles on the ground outside while grazing. Ostrichs leave their eggs on barns floor, like coop animals.

Barn animals (except Ostrichs) may become pregnant at random if the pregnancy option is enabled on their status menu. This is opened by interacting with the animal after petting it. An icon to the right of the menu can be toggled to allow pregnancy for that animal. If an animal becomes pregnant, during the night a message box will pop up saying an animal gave birth. The game will then prompt the player to choose a name for the new animal. For pregnancy to happen the player needs to have upgraded to at least a Big Barn and have enough room for another animal.
