### Sheep

_Main article: [Sheep](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sheep "Sheep")_

Sheep can be shorn when their coat grows in. [Shears](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shears "Shears") can be purchased at [Marnie's Ranch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie%27s_Ranch "Marnie's Ranch").

A sheep will normally grow in its coat every 3rd day if it has been fed and has at least 70 happiness.

If the player has 900 or more Friendship with the sheep and has pet it at least one time, it will reduce it to every other day.

If the player also has the [Shepherd profession](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Farming "Skills"), it will reduce the time required to regrow by an extra day, making a sheep grow its coat every single day.

| Image | Name | Cost | Requirements | Produces | 5 Heart Selling Price |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [![Sheep.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/cc/Sheep.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Sheep.png) | [Sheep](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sheep "Sheep") | data-sort-value="8000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)8,000g | Deluxe Barn | ![Wool.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/34/Wool.png)[Wool](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wool "Wool") \- data-sort-value="340">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)340g | data-sort-value="10400">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)10,400g |

### Pigs

_Main article: [Pig](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pig "Pig")_

Pigs will find [Truffles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Truffle "Truffle") after being let outdoors. Truffles can be used in the [Oil Maker](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oil_Maker "Oil Maker") to make [Truffle Oil](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Truffle_Oil "Truffle Oil").

Collection will be affected by [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") skill, allowing the player to gather iridium quality Truffles with a chance of double harvest.

During Winter, pigs will not produce Truffles since they don't leave the barn.

| Image | Name | Cost | Requirements | Produces | 5 Heart Selling Price |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [![Pig.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/30/Pig.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Pig.png) | [Pig](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pig "Pig") | data-sort-value="16000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)16,000g | Deluxe Barn | ![Truffle.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f2/Truffle.png)[Truffle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Truffle "Truffle") \- data-sort-value="625">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)625g | data-sort-value="20800">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)20,800g |

### Ostriches

_Main article: [Ostrich](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich "Ostrich")_

A mature and fed [Ostrich](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich "Ostrich") produces an [Ostrich Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich_Egg "Ostrich Egg") every 7 days.

| Image | Name | Cost | Requirements | Produces | 5 Heart Selling Price |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [![Ostrich.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/ad/Ostrich.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Ostrich.png) | [Ostrich](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich "Ostrich") | N/A | Barn | ![Ostrich Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/c3/Ostrich_Egg.png)[Ostrich Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich_Egg "Ostrich Egg") \- data-sort-value="600">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)600g | data-sort-value="20800">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)20,800g |

## Slime Hutch

_See: [Slime Hutch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slime_Hutch "Slime Hutch")_

## Other Animals

Many animals (or 'critters') can be seen throughout the game, but cannot be interacted with, such as rabbits, squirrels, frogs, crows, woodpeckers, sparrows, butterflies, possums, etc. Squirrels may occasionally cause [Hazelnuts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hazelnut "Hazelnut") or other tree seeds to fall to the ground, and rabbits can knock berries from bushes during [Salmonberry](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Salmonberry "Salmonberry") or [Blackberry](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blackberry "Blackberry") season. On [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island"), crabs, caldera monkeys, parrots, a marsupial and tropical butterflies can be seen. Some "other" animals are described below.

### Butterflies

[![ButterflyAnimated.gif](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6c/ButterflyAnimated.gif)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:ButterflyAnimated.gif)

Butterflies are abundant, and come in many colors, though they can only be seen outdoors in warm weather. To see butterflies, shake or chop trees, or place a [Butterfly Hutch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Butterfly_Hutch "Butterfly Hutch"). On [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island"), unique tropical varieties of butterfly can be seen.

### Crows

Every night, there is a chance that crows will eat [crops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crops "Crops")[\[9\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-addcrows-9) (including [Fiber Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiber_Seeds "Fiber Seeds")) on [The Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Farm "The Farm"). Crows will not eat crops grown from [wild seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Seeds "Crafting"), seeds themselves ( _i.e.,_ crops planted that day), or crops within range of one or more [scarecrows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow "Scarecrow").

For every 16 crops (rounded down), a crow may try to eat a crop. This is maxed at 4 crows.

Each crow has a 30% chance of attempting to eat. A crow attempting to eat a crop will try 10 times to find an eligible crop. A crow chooses a random tile on the farm that is either tilled, contains a tree, contains grass, or has flooring on it. (Note: This is done after overnight un-tilling[\[4\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-dayupdate-4)) If this tile contains a crop that has grown beyond seeds, the crow will stop looking. If the crop is in range of a [scarecrow](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow "Scarecrow"), the crow will be scared off. Otherwise the crow will eat the crop. Note that crows will eat dead crops leftover from previous seasons.

Each crow will only eat one crop, but may continue to hop around and peck at the ground afterwards. This animation is purely cosmetic.

Before scarecrows are unlocked, the only way to ensure no crows appear is to plant at most 15 crops at a time. This implies that the initial 15 [Parsnip Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Parsnip_Seeds "Parsnip Seeds") provided by [Lewis](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Lewis "Lewis") can all be safely planted; harvesting them gives the player enough experience to reach [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") level 1 and unlock scarecrows. However, planting just one additional crop (even wild seeds, or a crop at the seed stage) can trigger crows.

Note that there are no crows on the [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island") farm, so this section does not apply to crops that are planted there.

[![Crow.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/fa/Crow.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Crow.png)

### Fireflies

During the summer, fireflies can be seen everywhere at night, particularly in Cindersap Forest. They create a small glow of light around them.

[![Fireflies.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/13/Fireflies.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Fireflies.png)

### Frogs

When cutting weeds, there is a chance of seeing a green frog appear and run away. A frog appears as part of [Sebastian](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sebastian "Sebastian")'s 14-heart event. If the player equips a [Frog Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frog_Egg "Frog Egg") trinket, they will gain a frog companion, which can come in a wide variety of colors.

### Owls

[![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ea/Owl_Sprite.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Owl_Sprite.png)

[Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Owl_Sprite.png "Enlarge")

Owls as they can only be seen in the data file.

Owls can be seen only at night. In Spring and Summer, they can appear starting at 8pm; in Fall at 7pm, and in Winter at 6pm. There is a 1% chance for an owl to appear every 10 in-game minutes. [\[10\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#cite_note-owlchance-10)

[![Owl.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5c/Owl.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Owl.png)

### Parrots

On [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island"), parrots can sometimes be seen flying overhead, or roosting in the trees in the island's jungle. Parrots on perches can be fed with [Golden Walnuts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Walnut "Golden Walnut") to unlock various rewards. A parrot also appears as part of [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s 4-heart event, and in her house afterwards. If the player equips a [Parrot Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Parrot_Egg "Parrot Egg") trinket, they will gain a parrot companion.

### Seagulls

Seagulls appear at the beach. They can be seen floating in the water, doing nothing, or cleaning themselves with their beak. When on the ground, they may also move slightly in the direction they're facing by hopping.

Should the player get too close, they will fly away.

[![Seagull.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/9a/Seagull.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Seagull.png)

## Bugs

- If the pet is in position to block movement up the path to the [backwoods](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Backwoods "Backwoods") while the player is riding a horse, the pet will not move to allow the player through.
- It is possible to easily glitch through one-tile-wide objects (like [fences](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Fences "Crafting"), [sprinklers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Sprinklers "Crafting"), or [scarecrows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow "Scarecrow")) while riding the horse. Just ride vertically alongside the object, then turn 90° into the object.


- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/15/Riding_1.jpg/600px-Riding_1.jpg)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Riding_1.jpg)



[Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Riding_1.jpg "Enlarge")

Horse riding bug 1

- [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/e/ea/Riding_2.jpg/600px-Riding_2.jpg)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Riding_2.jpg)



[Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Riding_2.jpg "Enlarge")

Horse riding bug 2


- Placing the horse behind the [Ice Cream Stand](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ice_Cream_Stand "Ice Cream Stand") when nobody is there lets the player buy Ice Cream during Summer.

## History

- [1.02](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.02 "Version History"): If you have not received your pet yet, you will get another chance to get it.
- [1.3.27](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.3.27 "Version History"): Fixed bug causing animal happiness to decrease if the player stayed up after 6pm. Added ability to place hats on horses.
- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Added 2 new styles of cat and 2 new styles of dog. Made pet style changeable at Shrine of Illusions. Added ability to remove hats from horses. Removed exploit allowing wallpaper #108 to be used in an incubator in place of a Dinosaur Egg. Rain now fills the pet bowl. Pets now stay inside the farmhouse all day when it's raining. Sales of animals now count towards game's total earnings.
- [1.4.3](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4.3 "Version History"): Fixed a bug where naming a pet the same name as an NPC would cause the pet to appear in place of the NPC on the calendar.
- [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Duck purchase price reduced from 4000g to 1200g. Duck Feather sell price increased from 125g to 250g. Duck feather drop rate increased. Pets no longer block construction of new buildings. Sprinklers can now water troughs in a Slime Hutch. Added [Ostriches](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich "Ostrich") and [Golden Chickens](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Chicken "Golden Chicken"). Added new cosmetic critters on [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island").
- [1.5.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5.4 "Version History"): Duck sell price reduced.
- [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): The player now chooses between 5 different types of cats and 5 different types of dogs, up from 3 each. The player can also purchase additional pets, including turtles. Cats, dogs, and turtles can randomly give the player a gift after reaching maximum friendship and being petted. There is now a way to have pet friendship decrease, by not giving them a [Pet Bowl](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pet_Bowl "Pet Bowl"). Pets can be removed with [Butterfly Powder](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Butterfly_Powder "Butterfly Powder"). Pets can no longer be changed at [The Shrine of Illusions](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Shrine_of_Illusions "The Shrine of Illusions"). Added [Horse: The Book](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Horse:_The_Book "Horse: The Book") and the ability to feed a [carrot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carrot "Carrot") to the horse once per day. Added Animals tab in the menu. Added [Golden Animal Crackers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Animal_Cracker "Golden Animal Cracker") and [Blue Grass](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grass#Blue_Grass "Grass"). Farm animals now gain a little happiness if you close the animal door behind them at night. Added [Frog Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frog_Egg "Frog Egg") and [Parrot Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Parrot_Egg "Parrot Egg"). Added a new rare ambient critter (possum). Bug where horse can be parked behind the [Ice Cream Stand](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ice_Cream_Stand "Ice Cream Stand") to allow Ice Cream purchase now limited to Summer.
- [1.6.3](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6.3 "Version History"): Players can start adopting pets in [Marnie](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie "Marnie")'s shop if they don't have one in year two.
- [1.6.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6.4 "Version History"): Fixed pet adoption catch-all case only working if the player had the [Animal Catalogue](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animal_Catalogue "Animal Catalogue") and only applying specifically in Year 2. Fixed disappearing pets bug.
- [1.6.9](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6.9 "Version History"): Fixed cat gifts being effected by Bait attached to holding Fishing Pole.

# Preserves Jar Productivity

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar_Productivity#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar_Productivity#searchInput)

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| No Profession | ![Tiller.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b2/Tiller.png)[Tiller](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar_Productivity_-_Tiller "Preserves Jar Productivity - Tiller") | ![Artisan.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/46/Artisan.png)[Artisan](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar_Productivity_-_Artisan "Preserves Jar Productivity - Artisan") |

This page lists the productivity of processing [Fruits](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fruits "Fruits"), [Vegetables](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Vegetables "Vegetables"), and [Ginger](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger "Ginger") into [Jellies and Pickles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Jellies_and_Pickles "Jellies and Pickles") and [Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") into [Aged Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Aged_Roe "Aged Roe") or [Caviar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Caviar "Caviar") in a [Preserves Jar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar "Preserves Jar").

The products produced always sell for more than the raw input items (except in the case of gold or iridium [Blackberries](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blackberry "Blackberry") after learning the [Bear's Knowledge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bear%27s_Knowledge "Bear's Knowledge")), so using a Preserves Jar is almost always profitable. Jellies and Pickles are always regular quality, so the profit made from processing items is lowest when using iridium quality and highest when using regular quality items.

This table does not take into account the effects of Tiller or Artisan [professions](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming#Farming_Skill "Farming"), which reduce and increase the profit from a [Preserves Jar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar "Preserves Jar"), respectively. To view the profitability for those professions, use the links at the top of the page.

Note that the processing time for a Preserves Jar is always 4000 minutes, with one exception: [Sturgeon Roe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Roe "Roe") produces [Caviar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Caviar "Caviar") in 6000 minutes rather than 4000.

**Productivity (g/minute)** = `([Processed Sell Price] - [Input Item Sell Price]) / [Processing time]`

**Approximate g/day** = `Productivity (g/minute) * 1600`[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Preserves_Jar_Productivity#Notes)

**Note that you may click on a column header to sort the table by that column, then Shift+Click on a second column to perform a secondary sort.**

## Notes

1. Each day has 1600 minutes of processing time. From 2am to 6am, machines process at 100 minutes per hour. For the rest of the day, machines process at 60 minutes per hour.

So, (4 × 100) + (20 × 60) = 1600 minutes of processing time per day.

Retrieved from " [https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Preserves\_Jar\_Productivity&oldid=160397](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=Preserves_Jar_Productivity&oldid=160397)"

# Scarecrow From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | Scarecrow | | [![Scarecrow.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/75/Scarecrow.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Scarecrow.png) | | Prevents crows from attacking your crops. Has a limited radius (about 8 "tiles"). | | Information | | Source | [Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting "Crafting") | | Season | [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring") • [Summer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Summer "Summer") • [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall") | | Sell Price | _Cannot be sold_ | | Crafting | | Recipe Source | ![Farming Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/8/82/Farming_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Farming_Skill_Icon.png)[Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") Level 1 | | Ingredients | ![Wood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Wood.png)[Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") (50)![Coal.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a7/Coal.png)[Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") (1)![Fiber.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/45/Fiber.png)[Fiber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiber "Fiber") (20) | A **Scarecrow** is a craftable item that prevents [crows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Crows "Animals") from eating [crops](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crops "Crops"). Scarecrows can be crafted at [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") level 1. Scarecrows are not needed to protect crops grown from [Wild Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Seeds "Crafting"), since crows do not attack them. Since there are no crows on [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island"), no scarecrows need to be planted on the farm there. ## Contents - [1Range](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#Range) - [2Rarecrows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#Rarecrows) - [3Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#Quests) - [4Trivia](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#Trivia) - [5Secrets](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#Secrets) - [6History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scarecrow#History) ## Range A Scarecrow will protect the surrounding circular area of 249 spaces; 8 spaces each to the north, east, south, and west, as well as 6 spaces each to the northeast, southeast, southwest, and northwest. In other words, it protects a 17x17 area, excluding 10 spaces in each corner. [![Scarecrow Range.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/f/f9/Scarecrow_Range.png/1000px-Scarecrow_Range.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Scarecrow_Range.png) ## Rarecrows **Rarecrows** work the same way as regular Scarecrows, except for the Alien Scarecrow, which hats can be placed on. Soon after collecting all 8 rarecrows (usually the next day) a letter will arrive with the recipe to craft a [Deluxe Scarecrow](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Deluxe_Scarecrow "Deluxe Scarecrow"). | Number | Image | How to Obtain | | --- | --- | --- | | 1 | [![Rarecrow 1.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/62/Rarecrow_1.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_1.png) | Purchase at the [Stardew Valley Fair](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stardew_Valley_Fair "Stardew Valley Fair") for data-sort-value="800">![Token.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/29/Token.png)800. | | 2 | [![Rarecrow 2.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/28/Rarecrow_2.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_2.png) | Purchase at the [Spirit's Eve](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spirit%27s_Eve "Spirit's Eve") festival for data-sort-value="5000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)5,000g | | 3 | [![Rarecrow 3.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ea/Rarecrow_3.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_3.png) | Purchase at the [Casino](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Casino "Casino") for data-sort-value="10000">![QiCoin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6c/QiCoin.png)10,000. | | 4 | [![Rarecrow 4.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ef/Rarecrow_4.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_4.png) | Purchase at the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart") randomly during fall or winter for data-sort-value="4000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)4,000g,
or purchase at the [Festival of Ice](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Festival_of_Ice "Festival of Ice") for data-sort-value="5000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)5,000g. | | 5 | [![Rarecrow 5.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/9f/Rarecrow_5.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_5.png) | Purchase at the [Flower Dance](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Flower_Dance "Flower Dance") for data-sort-value="2500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)2,500g. | | 6 | [![Rarecrow 6.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/29/Rarecrow_6.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_6.png) | Purchase from the [Dwarf](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf "Dwarf") for data-sort-value="2500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)2,500g. | | 7 | [![Rarecrow 7.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/52/Rarecrow_7.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_7.png) | Donate 20 [Artifacts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifacts "Artifacts") (not counting [Minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals "Minerals")) to the [Museum](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Museum "Museum").
_Can be purchased from the [Night Market](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Night_Market "Night Market") once the first one is earned._ | | 8 | [![Rarecrow 8.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/bb/Rarecrow_8.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Rarecrow_8.png) | Donate 40 items to the [Museum](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Museum "Museum").
_Can be purchased from the [Night Market](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Night_Market "Night Market") once the first one is earned._ | ## Quests - Reach [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") Level 1 and craft a Scarecrow to complete the ["Advancement" Quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Advancement "Quests"). ## Trivia - Rarecrow #1 is a reference to the Turnip Head character in Hayao Miyazaki's _Howl's Moving Castle_. - Interacting with a Scarecrow shows a message indicating how many crows it has scared away. The counter resets when the Scarecrow is picked up. ## Secrets - [Hats can be placed on Rarecrow #3 (Alien)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Secrets#Hats "Secrets"). ## History - [1.4.1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4.1 "Version History"): Can now purchase museum rarecrows from the Night Market. | Equipment | | --- | | metadata.description: A Scarecrow is a craftable item that prevents crows from eating crops. Scarecrows can be crafted at Farming level 1. Scarecrows are not needed to protect crops grown from Wild Seeds, since crows do not attack them.

# Omni Geode

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#searchInput)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Omni Geode |
| [![Omni Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/09/Omni_Geode.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Omni_Geode.png) |
| A blacksmith can break this open for you. These geodes contain a wide variety of minerals. |
| Information |
| Source | [Mining](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining "Mining") • [Carbon Ghost](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carbon_Ghost "Carbon Ghost") • [Panning](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pans "Pans") • [Artifact Spot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Spot "Artifact Spot") on [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island") • [Octopus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Octopus "Octopus") [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") • [Oasis](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oasis "Oasis") • [Krobus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Krobus "Krobus") • [Trout Derby](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trout_Derby "Trout Derby") |
| Sell Price | data-sort-value="0 ">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)0g |

The **Omni Geode** is a [Mineral deposit](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Geodes "Minerals") found primarily by breaking rocks in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines"). It can be broken open at the [Blacksmith](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith "Blacksmith") for data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g or placed in a [Geode Crusher](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Geode_Crusher "Geode Crusher") to obtain the items inside. Omni Geodes can contain [minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals "Minerals"), [artifacts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifacts "Artifacts"), ores, or basic [resources](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:Resources "Category:Resources"). They can also be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for a variety of items.

**Note:** Neither daily [luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck") nor luck [buffs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Buffs "Buffs") affect the contents of an Omni Geode.

## Contents

- [1Locations](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Locations)
- [2Omni Geode Contents](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Omni_Geode_Contents)
  - [2.1Artifacts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Artifacts)
  - [2.2Foraged Minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Foraged_Minerals)
  - [2.3Gems](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Gems)
  - [2.4Geode Minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Geode_Minerals)
  - [2.5Resources](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Resources)
- [3Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Gifting)
- [4Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Bundles)
- [5Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Tailoring)
- [6Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Quests)
- [7Trading](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Trading)
- [8Notes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#Notes)
- [9External Links](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#External_Links)
- [10History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode#History)

## Locations

- Rocks in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") (Floors 21+) or [Skull Cavern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern "Skull Cavern").
- [Omni Geode Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Omni_Geode_Node "Mining") in the [Volcano Dungeon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Volcano_Dungeon "Volcano Dungeon").
- [Crates and barrels](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines#Crates_and_Barrels "The Mines") in the Mines (Floors 80+), Skull Cavern, or Volcano Dungeon.
- [Dirt patches](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines#Dirt_Patches "The Mines") in the Mines or Skull Cavern.
- [Carbon Ghost](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carbon_Ghost "Carbon Ghost") drop (99% chance).
- [Haunted Skull](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haunted_Skull "Haunted Skull") drop (1.3% chance, only if all [Vault Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Vault "Bundles") are not complete).
- [Wilderness Golem](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wilderness_Golem "Wilderness Golem") and [Iridium Golem](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Golem "Iridium Golem") drop (5% chance, after reaching [Combat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Combat "Combat") Level 5).
- [Panning](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pans "Pans") in any area.
- [Artifact Spots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Spot "Artifact Spot") on [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island").
- 1, 3, or 10 Omni Geodes can be produced by an [Octopus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Octopus "Octopus") [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") when the population reaches 9.
- Up to 3 can be purchased from the [Oasis](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oasis "Oasis") on [Wednesdays](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Wednesday "Days of the Week") for data-sort-value="500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)500g each.
- One can be purchased from [Krobus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Krobus "Krobus")' shop on [Tuesdays](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Tuesday "Days of the Week") for data-sort-value="300">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)300g.
- 5 Omni Geodes are the reward for completing the ![Bundle Purple.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a1/Bundle_Purple.png)[Geologist's Bundle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Geologists_Bundle "Bundles") in the [Boiler Room](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles#Boiler_Room "Bundles").
- 3 Omni Geodes are one of the prizes from the [Trout Derby](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trout_Derby "Trout Derby").
- 8 Omni Geodes are the 18th prize from the [Prize Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayor%27s_Manor#Prize_Machine "Mayor's Manor").
- 5 or 10 Omni Geodes can be obtained from Skull Cavern [treasure rooms](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skull_Cavern#Treasure_Rooms "Skull Cavern").
- 2-4 Omni Geodes may occasionally be found in [Supply Crates](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Supply_Crate "Supply Crate") on the [Beach Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Beach "Farm Maps") if the player upgraded the [Farmhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farmhouse "Farmhouse") at least once.
- Crane Game in the [Movie Theater](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Movie_Theater "Movie Theater") lobby, during any season.
- The [Garbage Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garbage_Can "Garbage Can") outside of the [Museum](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Museum "Museum").
- A fallen [meteorite](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Random_Events#Meteorite "Random Events") on [the Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Farm "The Farm") will drop 2 Omni Geodes when mined.

## Omni Geode Contents

### Artifacts

| Image | Name | Description | Sell Price | Probability |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [![Dwarvish Helm.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8b/Dwarvish_Helm.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dwarvish_Helm.png) | [Dwarvish Helm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarvish_Helm "Dwarvish Helm") | It's one of the helmets commonly worn by dwarves. The thick metal plating protects them from falling debris and stalactites. | data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g | 31/2750\* |
| [![Dwarf Gadget.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/58/Dwarf_Gadget.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dwarf_Gadget.png) | [Dwarf Gadget](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget "Dwarf Gadget") | It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarves. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works. | data-sort-value="200">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)200g | 31/2750\* |
| [![Ancient Drum.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/1/1e/Ancient_Drum.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Ancient_Drum.png) | [Ancient Drum](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ancient_Drum "Ancient Drum") | It's a drum made from wood and animal skin. It has a low, reverberating tone. | data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g | 31/2750\* |

| [![Frozen Tear.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ec/Frozen_Tear.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Frozen_Tear.png) | [Frozen Tear](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Tear "Frozen Tear") | A crystal fabled to be the frozen tears of a yeti. | data-sort-value="75">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)75g | 1/48 |
| [![Fire Quartz.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/5b/Fire_Quartz.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Fire_Quartz.png) | [Fire Quartz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fire_Quartz "Fire Quartz") | A glowing red crystal commonly found near hot lava. | data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g | 1/48 |

### Gems

| Image | Name | Description | Sell Price | Probability |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [![Prismatic Shard.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/56/Prismatic_Shard.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Prismatic_Shard.png) | [Prismatic Shard](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Prismatic_Shard "Prismatic Shard") | A very rare and powerful substance with unknown origins. | data-sort-value="2000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)2,000g | 1/250\* |

\*It is impossible for the player to receive a Prismatic Shard before cracking at least 15 geodes. Therefore, the probability of receiving a Prismatic Shard is 0 and receiving any minerals or artifacts is 1/88 if the player has not yet cracked 15 geodes.

### Geode Minerals

An Omni Geode can contain any of the 41 [Geode Minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals#Geode_Minerals "Minerals") in the game.

### Resources

Coal, copper ore, iron ore, and gold ore will be obtained in the following amounts: 30% for 1, 30% for 3, 30% for 5, 9% for 10, and 1% for 20. Stone has a 50% chance to use those values and a 50% chance to give only 1. Iridium Ore has a 30% chance for 1, 30% for 2, 30% for 3, 9% for 6, and 1% for 11. Only 1 clay can be obtained from a single geode.

Omni Geode is not used in any [bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles "Bundles").

## Tailoring

Omni Geode can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the ![Shirt264.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/90/Shirt264.png)[Omni Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Shirts "Tailoring"). It can be used as a gray [dye](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing") when used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sewing_Machine "Sewing Machine") with a dyeable clothing item in the feed.

## Quests

- 2-3 Omni Geodes may be requested by [Octopus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Octopus "Octopus"), [Rainbow Trout](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rainbow_Trout "Rainbow Trout"), [Spook Fish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spook_Fish "Spook Fish"), [Sturgeon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sturgeon "Sturgeon"), or [Super Cucumber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Super_Cucumber "Super Cucumber") in a [Fish Pond quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond") to increase the capacity of the pond from 5 to 7.
- [Marlon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marlon "Marlon") may request the player to obtain 12 Omni Geodes in the ["Treasure Hunt" quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival#Skull_Cavern "Desert Festival") during the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival").

## Trading

- 5 Omni Geodes can be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for 1 [Artifact Trove](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Trove "Artifact Trove").
- 3 Omni Geodes can be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for 1 [Warp Totem: Desert](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Warp_Totem:_Desert "Warp Totem: Desert").
- 50 Omni Geodes can be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for 1 [Green Turban](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Turban "Green Turban").
- 1 Omni Geode can be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for 3 [Hay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hay "Hay") on Mondays.
- 333 Omni Geodes can be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for 1 [Magic Turban](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magic_Turban "Magic Turban") on even-numbered days.
- 333 Omni Geodes can be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for 1 [Magic Cowboy Hat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magic_Cowboy_Hat "Magic Cowboy Hat") on odd-numbered days.

## Notes

- By multiplying the sell price of each item by the chance to obtain it and how many you would receive on average (with ores, [clay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clay "Clay"), and [stone](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stone "Stone")) and adding those products together, you can find the average profit of breaking open a single Omni Geode.

  - The first 15 Omni Geodes that you open have an average value of data-sort-value="114.1">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)114.1g, or data-sort-value="89.1">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)89.1g when the data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g opening cost is factored in.

    - With the [Gemologist Profession](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Mining_Skill "Mining"), Omni Geodes have an average return of data-sort-value="139.5">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)139.5g, or data-sort-value="114.5">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)114.5g when the data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g opening cost is factored in.
  - After that, Omni Geodes have an average value of data-sort-value="121.4">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)121.4g, or data-sort-value="96.4">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)96.4g when the data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g opening cost is factored in.

    - With the [Gemologist Profession](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Mining_Skill "Mining"), Omni Geodes have an average return of data-sort-value="149.0">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)149g, or data-sort-value="124.0">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)124g when the data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g opening cost is factored in.

## External Links

Users with access to their [saved game files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves "Saves") may find the "Stardew Predictor" utility helpful for predicting which items will be produced from breaking open geodes. The utility is located at: [https://mouseypounds.github.io/stardew-predictor/](https://mouseypounds.github.io/stardew-predictor/)

## History

- [1.3.27](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.3.27 "Version History"): Can now find [Earth Crystal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Earth_Crystal "Earth Crystal") and [Frozen Tear](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Tear "Frozen Tear") in Omni Geodes.
- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be obtained from [Crane Game](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Movie_Theater#Crane_Game "Movie Theater") in the [Movie Theater](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Movie_Theater "Movie Theater"). Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). Can be requested in [Fish Pond quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond"). Can be produced by [Fish Ponds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"). Can now be traded to the [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") for items.
- [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Can now be obtained from [Omni Geode Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Omni_Geode_Node "Mining") in the [Volcano Dungeon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Volcano_Dungeon "Volcano Dungeon") and [Artifact Spots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Spot "Artifact Spot") on [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island"). Can now be found in [Supply Crates](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Supply_Crate "Supply Crate") on the [Beach Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Beach "Farm Maps").
- [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Now one of the prizes from the [Trout Derby](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trout_Derby "Trout Derby") festival. Can now be obtained from [Iridium Golems](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Golem "Iridium Golem") and [meteorites](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Random_Events#Meteorite "Random Events"). Added [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival") quest. Can now be obtained from the [Prize Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayor%27s_Manor#Prize_Machine "Mayor's Manor"). Purchase price from the [Oasis](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oasis "Oasis") decreased from data-sort-value="1000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)1,000g to data-sort-value="500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)500g.
- [1.6.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6.4 "Version History"): Ten Omni Geodes are now a potential reward from Skull Cavern treasure chests.

metadata.description: The Omni Geode is a Mineral deposit found primarily by breaking rocks in the Mines. It can be broken open at the Blacksmith for data-sort-value="25">25g or placed in a Geode Crusher to obtain the items inside. Omni Geodes can contain minerals, artifacts, ores, or basic resources. They can also be traded to the Desert Trader for a variety of items.

![Iridium Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e4/Iridium_Quality_Icon.png) | 644g | | | | Artisan Goods | | Equipment | ![Cheese Press.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/79/Cheese_Press.png)[Cheese Press](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese_Press "Cheese Press") | | Processing Time | ![Time Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Time_Icon.png) 200min (3.3h) | | Ingredients | ![Milk.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/92/Milk.png)[Milk](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Milk "Milk") (1) _or_![Large Milk.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/67/Large_Milk.png)[Large Milk](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Milk "Large Milk") (1) | **Cheese** is an [Artisan Good](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artisan_Goods "Artisan Goods") made from the [Cheese Press](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese_Press "Cheese Press"), taking 3.3 hours. Using [Milk](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Milk "Milk") will produce normal quality Cheese, while [Large Milk](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Milk "Large Milk") will produce gold quality Cheese. The [Desert Trader](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Trader "Desert Trader") will trade one [Emerald](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emerald "Emerald") for one Cheese on Fridays. It can also be gifted by a [pet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Pets "Animals") cat with max [friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Friendship "Animals"). ## Contents - [1Aged Values](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese#Aged_Values) - [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese#Gifting) - [3Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese#Bundles) - [4Recipes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese#Recipes) - [5Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese#Tailoring) - [6Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese#Quests) - [7History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cheese#History) ## Aged Values Cheese can be placed inside a [Cask](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cask "Cask") to age from normal quality to silver, gold, and eventually iridium quality. Iridium quality doubles the base sell price of Cheese. Normal, silver, and gold quality Cheese can be prematurely removed from a cask at any time by striking the cask with an [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes"), [Hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes"), or [Pickaxe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes "Pickaxes"). | Normal Quality | Silver Quality
(x 1.25) | Gold Quality
(x 1.5) | Iridium Quality

metadata.title: Cheese - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Cheese is an Artisan Good made from the Cheese Press, taking 3.3 hours. Using Milk will produce normal quality Cheese, while Large Milk will produce gold quality Cheese. The Desert Trader will trade one Emerald for one Cheese on Fridays. It can also be gifted by a pet cat with max friendship.

# Frozen Geode

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Geode#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Geode#searchInput)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Frozen Geode |
| [![Frozen Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/bf/Frozen_Geode.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Frozen_Geode.png) |
| A blacksmith can break this open for you. |
| Information |
| Source | [Mining](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining "Mining") • [Fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing#Treasure_Chests "Fishing") |
| Sell Price | data-sort-value="100 ">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g |

The **Frozen Geode** is a [Mineral](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals "Minerals") deposit that contains [minerals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minerals "Minerals"), [artifacts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifacts "Artifacts"), ores, or basic [resources](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:Resources "Category:Resources"). It can be found on floors 41 to 79 of [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines"), on [the Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Farm "The Farm") in the [Winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter"), or inside a [Fishing Treasure Chest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing#Treasure_Chests "Fishing"). It can also be received as a gift at the [Feast of the Winter Star](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Feast_of_the_Winter_Star "Feast of the Winter Star"). An [Ice Pip](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ice_Pip "Ice Pip") [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") may produce 1 or 5 Frozen Geodes when the population of the pond reaches 9. Frozen Geodes can also be obtained by pickaxing [Frozen Geode Nodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mining#Frozen_Geode_Node "Mining"). These are found in the small quarry on the [Hill-top Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Hilltop "Farm Maps") and [Four Corners Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farm_Maps#Four_Corners "Farm Maps"). [Sebastian](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sebastian "Sebastian") sells Frozen Geodes in his [shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival#Villager_Shops "Desert Festival") at the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival") for data-sort-value="10">![Calico Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Calico_Egg.png) 10 [Calico Eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Calico_Egg "Calico Egg").

The Frozen Geode can be broken open by [Clint](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clint "Clint") in the [Blacksmith shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith "Blacksmith") for data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g or by using a [Geode Crusher](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Geode_Crusher "Geode Crusher").

Neither daily [luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck") nor luck [buffs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Buffs "Buffs") affect the contents of a Frozen Geode.

### Resources

Note that [Gold Ore](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gold_Ore "Gold Ore") is available in the Frozen Geode only after the player has reached floor 76 of [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines"). Before reaching floor 76, Iron Ore is substituted when breaking open a Frozen Geode. Except for clay and stone, the following items will be obtained in the following amounts: 30% for 1, 30% for 3, 30% for 5, 9% for 10, and 1% for 20. Stone has a 50% chance to use those values and a 50% chance to give only 1. Only 1 clay can be obtained from a single geode.

## Tailoring

Frozen Geode is used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") with [Cloth](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cloth "Cloth") in the feed to create a ![Shirt161.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/88/Shirt161.png)[Blue Hoodie](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). It is a cyan dye when used in the spool of the Sewing Machine with a dyeable clothing item in the feed. It can be placed in the blue dye pot at Emily's and Haley's house for use in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing").

## Quests

- Five Frozen Geodes may be requested by [Ice Pip](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ice_Pip "Ice Pip") in a [Fish Pond quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond") to increase the capacity of the pond from 5 to 7.
- One Frozen Geode may be requested by several ocean fish in a [Fish Pond quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond") to increase the capacity of the pond from 3 to 5.
- Five Frozen Geodes may be requested by the Raccoon at the [Giant Stump](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Giant_Stump "Giant Stump") as part of his fifth request, or as part of any request starting with the sixth.

## Trivia

- By multiplying the sell price of each item by the chance to obtain it and how many you would receive on average (with ores, clay, and stone) and adding those products together, you can find the average profit of breaking open a single frozen geode. Frozen geodes have an average return of data-sort-value="101.1">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)101.1g[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Geode#cite_note-opening_profit-1). With the [Gemologist Profession](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Mining "Skills"), frozen geodes have an average return of data-sort-value="125.74">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)125.74g[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Geode#cite_note-opening_profit-1). The frozen geode will sell in the shipping bin for data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g. It is therefore profitable to process frozen geodes through [Geode Crusher](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Geode_Crusher "Geode Crusher") or sell the contents with Gemologist.

| Open method | No Profession | ![Gemologist.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/3c/Gemologist.png)Gemologist |
| --- | --- | --- |

| ![Geode Crusher.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/02/Geode_Crusher.png)[Geode Crusher](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Geode_Crusher "Geode Crusher") | data-sort-value="1.1">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)1.1g | data-sort-value="25.74">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25.74g |

## External Links

Users with access to their [saved game files](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Saves "Saves") may find the "Stardew Predictor" utility helpful for predicting which items will be produced from breaking open geodes. The utility is located at: [https://mouseypounds.github.io/stardew-predictor/](https://mouseypounds.github.io/stardew-predictor/)

1. ↑ [Jump up to: 1.0](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Geode#cite_ref-opening_profit_1-0)[1.1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Frozen_Geode#cite_ref-opening_profit_1-1)See discussion on [talk page](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Talk:Frozen_Geode "Talk:Frozen Geode").

## History

- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). Can be requested in [Fish Pond quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond"). Can be produced by [Fish Ponds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond").
- [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Can now be purchased at [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival"). May now be requested by the Raccoon.

metadata.title: Frozen Geode - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The Frozen Geode is a Mineral deposit that contains minerals, artifacts, ores, or basic resources. It can be found on floors 41 to 79 of the Mines, on the Farm in the Winter, or inside a Fishing Treasure Chest. It can also be received as a gift at the Feast of the Winter Star. An Ice Pip Fish Pond may produce 1 or 5 Frozen Geodes when the population of the pond reaches 9. Frozen Geodes can also be obtained by pickaxing Frozen Geode Nodes. These are found in the small quarry on the Hill-top Farm and Four Corners Farm. Sebastian sells Frozen Geodes in his shop at the Desert Festival for data-sort-value="10"> 10 Calico Eggs.

# White Algae From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#searchInput) | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | White Algae | | [![White Algae.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f7/White_Algae.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:White_Algae.png) | | It's super slimy. | | Information | | Source | - [Fishing Pole](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools#Fishing_Poles "Tools")
- [Monster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Monsters "Monsters") drops
- [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") ( [Ghostfish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ghostfish "Ghostfish")) | | Location | [The Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") • [The Sewers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Sewers "The Sewers") • [Mutant Bug Lair](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mutant_Bug_Lair "Mutant Bug Lair") • [Witch's Swamp](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Witch%27s_Swamp "Witch's Swamp") | | Season | ![All Seasons Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/55/All_Seasons_Icon.png)[All](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Seasons "Seasons") | | XP | - Fishing Pole: 3 [Fishing XP](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing#Experience_Points "Fishing")
- Fish Pond: 20 [Fishing XP](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing#Experience_Points "Fishing") | | [Energy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Energy "Energy") / [Health](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Health "Health") | | | | | | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | ![Energy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/a/a9/Energy.png/40px-Energy.png) | 20 | ![Health.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/9/94/Health.png/40px-Health.png) | 9 | | | Sell Price | data-sort-value="25">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)25g | **White Algae** is an item which can be caught with a [Fishing Pole](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tools#Fishing_Poles "Tools") during all seasons at any underground location ( [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines"), [the Sewers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Sewers "The Sewers"), the [Mutant Bug Lair](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mutant_Bug_Lair "Mutant Bug Lair"), or the [Witch's Swamp](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Witch%27s_Swamp "Witch's Swamp")). White Algae can also be dropped by several [Monsters](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Monsters "Monsters"): [Grubs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grub "Grub"), [Mutant Grubs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mutant_Grub "Mutant Grub"), [Flies](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cave_Fly "Cave Fly"), [Mutant Flies](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mutant_Fly "Mutant Fly"), [Bugs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bug "Bug"), and Red, Purple, Copper, and Iron [Slimes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slimes "Slimes"). A [Ghostfish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ghostfish "Ghostfish") [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond") may produce 5 White Algae when the population of the pond reaches 9. White Algae is displayed in the [Fish section](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Collections#Fish "Collections") of the [collection](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Collections "Collections") tab, and counts towards the four fishing [Achievements](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing#Achievements "Fishing").[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#cite_note-quasi_fish-1) However, it is otherwise not considered to be a fish, and therefore cannot be sold to [Willy](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Willy "Willy") at the [Fish Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Shop "Fish Shop"), does not benefit from fish price bonuses, cannot be used in place of "Any Fish" in [recipes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cooking#Recipes "Cooking"), and cannot be put in a [Bait Maker](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bait_Maker "Bait Maker"), [Fish Smoker](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Smoker "Fish Smoker"), or [Fish Pond](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond "Fish Pond"). ## Contents - [1Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#Gifting) - [2Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#Bundles) - [3Recipes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#Recipes) - [4Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#Tailoring) - [5Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#Quests) - | A delicate broth with a hint of sulfur. | ![White Algae.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f7/White_Algae.png)White Algae (2) | ![Energy.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a9/Energy.png) 125
![Health.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Health.png) 56 | ![Marnie Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d4/Marnie_Icon.png)[Marnie](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie "Marnie") (Mail - 3+ ![HeartIconLarge.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/04/HeartIconLarge.png/32px-HeartIconLarge.png)) | data-sort-value="150">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)150g | ## Tailoring White Algae can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the dyeable [Collared Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). [![Shirt248.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/ad/Shirt248.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt248.png) ## Quests - Five White Algae are requested by [Ghostfish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ghostfish "Ghostfish") in a [Fish Pond quest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fish_Pond#Quests "Fish Pond") to increase the capacity of the pond from 5 to 7. - Five White Algae may be requested by the Raccoon at the [Giant Stump](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Giant_Stump "Giant Stump") as part of his third request, or as part of any request starting with the sixth. ## References 1. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/White_Algae#cite_ref-quasi_fish_1-0 "Jump up")In the game data ( `Data/Objects.xnb`) the type assigned to White Algae is "Fish", but it is not assigned the Fish category ( `-4`). The label displayed in-game and most uses are controlled by the category. ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). Can be requested in a Fish Pond quest. Can be produced by Fish Ponds. - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Is now an option in the Wild Medicine Bundle. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): May now be requested by the Raccoon. Retrieved from " [https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=White\_Algae&oldid=182531](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/index.php?title=White_Algae&oldid=182531)" [Category](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Special:Categories "Special:Categories"): - [Fishing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Category:Fishing "Category:Fishing") ## Navigation menu ### Search [Visit the main page](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stardew_Valley_Wiki "Visit the main page")

[Marnie](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Marnie "Marnie") may also gift you 12 eggs at the [Feast of the Winter Star](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Feast_of_the_Winter_Star "Feast of the Winter Star"). [Shane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shane "Shane") sells Eggs in his [shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival#Villager_Shops "Desert Festival") at the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival") for data-sort-value="1">![Calico Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Calico_Egg.png) 1 [Calico Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Calico_Egg "Calico Egg"). ![Health.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Health.png) 101 | ![Speed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/94/Speed.png)[Speed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Speed "Speed") (+1)![Defense.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/66/Defense.png)[Defense](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Defense "Defense") (+1) | ![Time Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/70/Time_Icon.png) 16m 47s | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Cooking Channel.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/d/d6/Cooking_Channel.png/44px-Cooking_Channel.png) | [The Queen of Sauce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Queen_of_Sauce "The Queen of Sauce") | | 21 Fall, Year 2 | | data-sort-value="275">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)275g | ## Tailoring Egg can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the dyeable ![Shirt216.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/8d/Shirt216.png)[Plain Overalls](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Shirts "Tailoring"). Both colors of eggs can be used as a white [dye](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing") when used in the spool of the Sewing Machine with a dyeable clothing item in the feed. ## Quests - An Egg may be randomly requested during any season at the ["Help Wanted" board](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Help_Wanted_Quests "Quests") outside [Pierre's General Store](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store") for a reward of data-sort-value="150">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)150g and 150 [Friendship](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship") points. This will only be requested if the player owns a White Chicken, Brown Chicken, or Duck. However, owning a Duck will still result in a chicken egg being requested. - ["Gus' Famous Omelet"](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Gus.27_Famous_Omelet "Quests"): On the Special Orders board in front of the [Mayor's Manor](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayor%27s_Manor "Mayor's Manor"), [Gus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Gus "Gus") may randomly request that the player collect and deliver 24 Eggs (of any type) to the fridge in [the Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon"). The reward is data-sort-value="3000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)3,000g and a [Mini-Fridge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mini-Fridge "Mini-Fridge"). - Five Eggs (any type, excluding Dinosaur) may be requested by the Raccoon at the [Giant Stump](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Giant_Stump "Giant Stump") as part of his third request, or as part of any request starting with the sixth. ## History - [1.0](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.0 "Version History"): Introduced. - [1.1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.1 "Version History"): Increased value from data-sort-value="40">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)40g to data-sort-value="50">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)50g. - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Can be used for a [Special Order](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#List_of_Special_Orders "Quests"). Is now used in the Home Cook's Bundle. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Can now be purchased at [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival"). metadata.title: Egg - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: The Egg and the Brown Egg are animal products  obtained from White, Brown, or Blue Chickens. Marnie may also gift you 12 eggs at the Feast of the Winter Star. Shane sells Eggs in his shop at the Desert Festival for data-sort-value="1"> 1 Calico Egg.

# Dwarf Gadget From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | Dwarf Gadget | | [![Dwarf Gadget.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/58/Dwarf_Gadget.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dwarf_Gadget.png) | | It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarves. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works. | | Information | | Artifact Spots: | N/A | | Monster Drops: | N/A | | Other Sources: | ![Magma Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/89/Magma_Geode.png)[Magma Geode](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magma_Geode "Magma Geode") (3.8%)![Omni Geode.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/09/Omni_Geode.png)[Omni Geode](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode "Omni Geode") (1%)![Hoe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/87/Hoe.png)[Tilling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes") in [The Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") (floor 40-79) (0.1%) ![Artifact Trove.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/82/Artifact_Trove.png)[Artifact Trove](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Trove "Artifact Trove") (3.7%) | | Donation Reward: | !['Burnt Offering'.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/e/e5/%27Burnt_Offering%27.png/48px-%27Burnt_Offering%27.png)['Burnt Offering'](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/%27Burnt_Offering%27 "'Burnt Offering'") | | Sell Price: | data-sort-value="200 ">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)200g | The **Dwarf Gadget** is an [Artifact](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifacts "Artifacts") that can be found by digging up soil in [the Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") (floors 40-79). It can also be found in [Magma Geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magma_Geode "Magma Geode"), [Omni Geodes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Omni_Geode "Omni Geode"), and [Artifact Troves](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifact_Trove "Artifact Trove"). ## Contents - [1Donation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#Donation) - [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#Gifting) - [3Bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#Bundles) - [4Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#Crafting) - [5Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#Tailoring) - [6Quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#Quests) - [7History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Gadget#History) ## Donation Donation of this item contributes to the total count of donations for the [Museum](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Museum "Museum"). To earn the ['Burnt Offering'](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/%27Burnt_Offering%27 "'Burnt Offering'") reward, you must donate a [Rare Disc](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rare_Disc "Rare Disc"), a Dwarf Gadget, and 11+ artifacts. ## Gifting | Villager Reactions | | --- | | Love | [![Maru Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/23/Maru_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maru "Maru")[Maru](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maru "Maru") | | Like | [![Dwarf Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/08/Dwarf_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf "Dwarf")[Dwarf](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf "Dwarf") • [![Penny Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/bc/Penny_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Penny "Penny")[Penny](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Penny "Penny") | | Dislike | [![Abigail Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/63/Abigail_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Abigail "Abigail")[Abigail](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Abigail "Abigail") • [![Alex # Dwarf Scroll IV

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#searchInput)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Dwarf Scroll IV |
| [![Dwarf Scroll IV.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/85/Dwarf_Scroll_IV.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Dwarf_Scroll_IV.png) |
| A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a golden chain. |
| Information |
| Artifact Spots: | N/A |
| Monster Drops: | Any [Monster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Monsters "Monsters") other than [Skeleton](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skeleton "Skeleton"), [Serpent](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Serpent "Serpent"), [Wilderness Golem](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wilderness_Golem "Wilderness Golem"), [Carbon Ghost](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carbon_Ghost "Carbon Ghost"), [Iridium Bat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bats "Bats"), [Iridium Crab](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Crab "Iridium Crab"), or [Haunted Skull](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haunted_Skull "Haunted Skull") (0.1%) |
| Other Sources: | ![Hoe.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/87/Hoe.png)[Tilling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes") in [The Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") (floor 80+) (0.2%)[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#cite_note-hoeChance-1) |
| Donation Reward: | ![Dwarvish Translation Guide.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/9c/Dwarvish_Translation_Guide.png)[Dwarvish Translation Guide](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarvish_Translation_Guide "Dwarvish Translation Guide") |
| Sell Price: | data-sort-value="1 ">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)1g |

The **Dwarf Scroll IV** is an [Artifact](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifacts "Artifacts") that can be found as a drop from any [monster](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Monsters "Monsters") (other than the [Wilderness Golem](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wilderness_Golem "Wilderness Golem"), [Serpent](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Serpent "Serpent"), [Skeleton](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skeleton "Skeleton"), [Carbon Ghost](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carbon_Ghost "Carbon Ghost"), [Iridium Bat](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bats "Bats"), [Iridium Crab](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iridium_Crab "Iridium Crab"), and [Haunted Skull](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haunted_Skull "Haunted Skull")), or by using the [hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes") on dirt in [The Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") (floor 80+).

## Contents

- [1Donation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#Donation)
- [2Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#Gifting)
- [3Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#Tailoring)
- [4Tip](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#Tip)
- [5References](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#References)
- [6History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#History)

## Donation

Donation of this item contributes to the total count of donations for the [Museum](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Museum "Museum").

Donating all 4 Dwarf Scrolls rewards the player with the [Dwarvish Translation Guide](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarvish_Translation_Guide "Dwarvish Translation Guide").

## Tailoring

Dwarf Scroll IV can be used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create the dyeable [Gold Trimmed Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). [![Shirt222.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/ff/Shirt222.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt222.png) It can be used in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"), serving as a yellow dye at the dye pots, located in [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane").

## Tip

- Level 95 in the Mines has tillable soil near the entrance to the floor. The player can repeatedly revisit Floor 95 via the elevator to till the soil and farm for Dwarf Scrolls I and IV.

## References

1. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf_Scroll_IV#cite_ref-hoeChance_1-0 "Jump up")See `MineShaft::checkForBuriedItem` in the game code.

## History

- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring").
- [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): [Artifacts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artifacts "Artifacts") are now liked by the [Dwarf](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dwarf "Dwarf") and [Penny](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Penny "Penny"), disliked by all other NPCs.
