![Gold Quality Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/47/Gold_Quality_Icon.png) | 375g | | | | Recipe | | Recipe Source(s) | | | | | --- | --- | | ![Cooking Channel.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/d/d6/Cooking_Channel.png/44px-Cooking_Channel.png) | [The Queen of Sauce](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Queen_of_Sauce "The Queen of Sauce") | | 28 Spring, Year 2 | | | Ingredients | ![Sea Cucumber.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a9/Sea_Cucumber.png)[Sea Cucumber](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sea_Cucumber "Sea Cucumber") (1)![Tortilla.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d7/Tortilla.png)[Tortilla](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tortilla "Tortilla") (1)![Blue Jazz.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/2f/Blue_Jazz.png)[Blue Jazz](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blue_Jazz "Blue Jazz") (1) | **Lucky Lunch** is a [cooked dish](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cooking "Cooking"). It is prepared using either the kitchen inside an upgraded [farmhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farmhouse "Farmhouse") or a [Cookout Kit](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cookout_Kit "Cookout Kit"). **Note:** This recipe is [profitable](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cooking#Profitable_Recipes "Cooking") \- it will result in profit when using the lowest quality ingredients. Lucky Lunch may randomly appear in [Krobus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Krobus "Krobus")' shop on [Saturdays](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Saturday "Days of the Week"), at the [Traveling Cart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Traveling_Cart "Traveling Cart"), in the [Garbage Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garbage_Can "Garbage Can") outside the saloon, or in [the Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon")'s rotating stock. It is also sold by the [Calico Egg Merchant](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival#Calico_Egg_Merchant "Desert Festival") in the [Desert Festival](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Desert_Festival "Desert Festival") for data-sort-value="10">![Calico Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/da/Calico_Egg.png) 10 [Calico Eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Calico_Egg "Calico Egg"). One or two Lucky Lunches may be received from opening a [Mystery Box](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mystery_Box "Mystery Box"). Two Lucky Lunches may be received from opening a [Golden Mystery Box](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Mystery_Box "Golden Mystery Box"). One Lucky Lunch is the reward for completing the ![Bundle Yellow.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/2b/Bundle_Yellow.png)[Treasure Hunter's Bundle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Treasure_Hunter.27s_Bundle "Remixed Bundles") in the [Boiler Room (Remixed)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Remixed_Bundles#Boiler_Room "Remixed is not used in any [bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles "Bundles"). ## Recipes Lucky Lunch is not used in any recipes. ## Tailoring Lucky Lunch is used in the spool of the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane#Sewing_Machine "2 Willow Lane") to create a [Shirt](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). [![Shirt052.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/88/Shirt052.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt052.png) It can be used in [dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing"), serving as a yellow dye at the dye pots, located in [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily")'s and [Haley](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Haley "Haley")'s house, [2 Willow Lane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane"). ## Quests Lucky Lunch is not used in any [quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests "Quests"). ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Can now be used in [Tailoring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring "Tailoring"). - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Can now be prepared using a [Cookout Kit](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cookout_Kit "Cookout Kit"). Can be obtained as a reward from the Treasure Hunter's Bundle. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Now able to be purchased from the Calico Egg Merchant. Added as possible prize from [Mystery Boxes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mystery_Box "Mystery Box") and [Golden Mystery Boxes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Mystery_Box "Golden Mystery Box"). metadata.title: Lucky Lunch - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Lucky Lunch is a cooked dish. It is prepared using either the kitchen inside an upgraded farmhouse or a Cookout Kit.

# Rings From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rings#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rings#searchInput) **Rings** are equippable [clothing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clothing "Clothing") items that give players passive benefits. Any two rings can be equipped at any one time. They are equipped in the player's [inventory](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Inventory "Inventory"). Some ring effects stack. Rings can also be [combined](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Forge#Combined_Rings "Forge"). | Image | Name | Description | Effect | Where to Find | Ingredients | Purchase Price | Sell Price | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Small Glow Ring.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6c/Small_Glow_Ring.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Small_Glow_Ring.png) | [Small Glow Ring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Small_Glow_Ring "Small Glow Ring") | Emits a small, constant light. | Emits 5 radius circle of light. Light effect stacks with other glow rings. | - Killing [Slimes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slimes "Slimes") in [The Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") before floor 40
- [![Fishing Treasure Chest.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/bb/Fishing_Treasure_Chest.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Fishing_Treasure_Chest.png)[Fishing Treasure Chests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fishing#Treasure_Chests "Fishing") | N/A | N/A | data-sort-value="50">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)50g | | [![Glow Ring.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/01/Glow_Ring.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Glow_Ring.png) | [Glow Ring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Glow_Ring "Glow Ring") | Emits a constant light. | Emits 10 radius circle of light. - Killing [Slimes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slimes "Slimes") in [The Mines](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") floor 40+

metadata.title: Rings - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Rings are equippable clothing items that give players passive benefits. Any two rings can be equipped at any one time. They are equipped in the player's inventory. Some ring effects stack. Rings can also be combined.

# JojaMart From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | JojaMart | | [![Jojamart.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f9/Jojamart.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Jojamart.png) | | ![Maplocation.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/5/5c/Maplocation.png/40px-Maplocation.png)
![Map.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/43/Map.png) | | Open Hours: | 9:00am to 11:00pm | | Closed: | After the player completes the [Community Center](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Community_Center "Community Center") | | Address: | North of [Blacksmith](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blacksmith "Blacksmith") | | Occupants: | ![Morris Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/3c/Morris_Icon.png)[Morris](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Morris "Morris") | **JojaMart** is a store owned by " [Joja Corporation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Setting#Joja_Corporation "Setting")", [the player](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Player "The Player")'s previous employer. It is managed by [Morris](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Morris "Morris"), who also handles customer service. The store is the main competitor of [Pierre's General Store](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store") and sells a similar variety of seeds and other items, with JojaMart's key advantages being open longer (until 11pm) and on Wednesdays, however without Membership its prices are usually worse than Pierre's. Purchases can be made from the unnamed cashier found at checkout lane 3. Morris can be found inside the kiosk at the bottom right of the store, where he will offer the player a JojaMart Membership for data-sort-value="5000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)5,000g. Membership is available once the [Community Center](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Community_Center "Community Center") is unlocked. Purchasing a Joja Membership from [Morris](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Morris "Morris") causes the [Community Center](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Community_Center "Community Center") to be turned into a [Joja Warehouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Joja_Warehouse "Joja Warehouse"). The player can then purchase community development projects through the [Joja Community Development Form](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Joja_Community_Development_Form "Joja Community Development Form"), rather than through completing [bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles "Bundles") in the Community Center. A red-haired cashier mans the register all day. [Shane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shane "Shane") works there stocking shelves from 8:00 to 5:00 on weekdays. He also works on the weekend if it's raining. [Sam](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sam "Sam") sweeps from 12:50 to 5:00 on Mondays and Wednesdays. Both Sam and Shane are not available to talk to during their work time. ## Contents - [1Community Development Projects](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Community_Development_Projects) - [2Prices](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Prices) - [3Permanent Stock](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Permanent_Stock) - [4Spring Stock](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Spring_Stock) - [5Summer Stock](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Summer_Stock) - [6Fall Stock](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Fall_Stock) - [7Trivia](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Trivia) - [8Gallery](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#Gallery) - [9History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/JojaMart#History) ## Community Development Projects | Name | Description | Price | | --- | --- | --- | | [Minecarts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minecart "Minecart") | Repairs the [minecart](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Minecart "Minecart") system that runs between the [bus stop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bus_Stop "Bus Stop"), [the mountains](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mountain "The Mountain"), and [Pelican Town](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pelican_Town "Pelican Town"). | data-sort-value="15000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)15,000g | | Panning | Removes the glimmering boulder near [the mine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mines "The Mines") entrance. | data-sort-value="20000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)20,000g | | Bridge | Repairs the broken bridge in [the mountains](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mountain "The Mountain").

Harvest with the scythe. | data-sort-value="12">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)12g | ## Trivia - On [Fridays](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Friday "Days of the Week") (before the [Community Center](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Community_Center "Community Center") is complete) [Jodi](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Jodi "Jodi") may say, "The food at JojaMart might not be the healthiest for my family, but with such low prices you'd be crazy to shop anywhere else!" even though most items are more expensive at JojaMart than at [Pierre's](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store"). She may, however, have a Joja membership or Pierre may offer the player discounts to encourage vegetable sales. This is further referenced to in [Penny](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Penny "Penny")'s dialogue "Since mom started shopping at JojaMart she's been able to afford more than shopping at Pierre's ever did!" - The [achievement](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Achievements "Achievements") "Joja Co. Member Of The Year" requires purchasing all of the [Joja Community Development Form](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Joja_Community_Development_Form "Joja Community Development Form") projects, which takes at least six days; one day to build the Joja Warehouse after purchasing a Joja membership, and one day each for the five projects. - The 'Joja' logo has a striking similarity to WatchMojo's, a popular corporate YouTube channel. - There is no music of any kind inside of JojaMart. - It is possible to interact with the shelves to see what item it has on it. - A cold section in the back advertises "fish" and "milk," but neither product is available for sale to the player. - If the [Community Center](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Community_Center "Community Center") is completed, [Sam](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sam "Sam") goes to work at the [Museum](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Museum "Museum") and [Shane](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shane "Shane") becomes unemployed. - Items sold at [Pierre's](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_General_Store "Pierre's General Store") but not at JojaMart are: - General items: [Bouquet](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bouquet "Bouquet"), [Catalogue](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Catalogue "Catalogue"), and the [Grass Starter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Grass_Starter "Grass Starter") Recipe. - Cooking ingredients: [Oil](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oil "Oil"), and [Vinegar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Vinegar "Vinegar"). - Seeds: [Corn Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Corn_Seeds "Corn Seeds") in Summer (both stores have them in the Fall), [Garlic Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garlic_Seeds "Garlic Seeds"), [Rice Shoot](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rice_Shoot "Rice Shoot"), [Blueberry Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Blueberry_Seeds "Blueberry Seeds"), [Red Cabbage Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Red_Cabbage_Seeds "Red Cabbage Seeds"), [Artichoke Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artichoke_Seeds "Artichoke Seeds"). - Fertilizers: [Basic Fertilizer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Basic_Fertilizer "Basic Fertilizer"), [Quality Fertilizer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quality_Fertilizer "Quality Fertilizer"), [Basic Retaining Soil](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Basic_Retaining_Soil "Basic Retaining Soil"), [Quality Retaining Soil](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quality_Retaining_Soil "Quality Retaining Soil"), [Speed-Gro](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Speed-Gro "Speed-Gro"), and [Deluxe Speed-Gro](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Deluxe_Speed-Gro "Deluxe Speed-Gro"). - Fruit Tree saplings: [Cherry Sapling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cherry_Sapling "Cherry Sapling"), [Apricot Sapling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Apricot_Sapling "Apricot Sapling"), [Orange Sapling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Orange_Sapling "Orange Sapling"), [Peach Sapling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Peach_Sapling "Peach Sapling"), [Pomegranate Sapling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pomegranate_Sapling "Pomegranate Sapling"), and [Apple Sapling](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Apple_Sapling "Apple Sapling"). - [Pierre's Missing Stocklist](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre%27s_Missing_Stocklist "Pierre's Missing Stocklist") doesn't affect JojaMart, meaning that Pierre's is the only place where you will be able to buy out-of-season seeds. ## Gallery - [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/09/JojaMart_Closed.png/240px-JojaMart_Closed.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:JojaMart_Closed.png) JojaMart out of business during winter. - [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/0d/JojaDev.png/240px-JojaDev.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:JojaDev.png) [Joja Community Development Form](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Joja_Community_Development_Form "Joja Community Development Form") - [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/5/59/JojaMart_Interior.png/234px-JojaMart_Interior.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:JojaMart_Interior.png) Interior ## History - "Version History"): [Joja Membership](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Joja_Community_Development_Form "Joja Community Development Form") cannot be purchased until after the [Community metadata.title: JojaMart - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: JojaMart is a store owned by "Joja Corporation", the player's previous employer. It is managed by Morris, who also handles customer service. The store is the main competitor of Pierre's General Store and sells a similar variety of seeds and other items, with JojaMart's key advantages being open longer (until 11pm) and on Wednesdays, however without Membership its prices are usually worse than Pierre's. Purchases can be made from the unnamed cashier found at checkout lane 3.
metadata.keywords: Stardew Valley Wiki,Stardew Valley,Villagers,JojaMart,,hours,location

It is prepared using either the kitchen inside an upgraded [farmhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farmhouse "Farmhouse") or a [Cookout Kit](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cookout_Kit "Cookout Kit"). Fried Mushroommay randomly appear in [Krobus](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Krobus "Krobus")' shop on [Saturdays](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Days_of_the_Week#Saturday "Days of the Week"), in the [Garbage Can](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garbage_Can "Garbage Can") outside the saloon, or in [the Stardrop Saloon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Stardrop_Saloon "The Stardrop Saloon")'s rotating stock. One Fried Mushroom can sometimes be purchased for data-sort-value="2500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)2,500g from [Pierre](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pierre "Pierre")'s booth at the [Feast of the Winter Star](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Feast_of_the_Winter_Star "Feast of the Winter Star"). One Fried Mushroom may be received from opening a [Mystery Box](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mystery_Box "Mystery Box"). ## Contents - [1Gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fried_Mushroom#Gifting) # Sprinkler

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sprinkler#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sprinkler#searchInput)

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Sprinkler |
| [![Sprinkler.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/0/08/Sprinkler.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Sprinkler.png) |
| Waters the 4 adjacent tiles every morning. |
| Information |
| Source | [Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting "Crafting") |
| Sell Price | data-sort-value="100">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)100g |
| Crafting |
| Recipe Source | [![Farming Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/8/82/Farming_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Farming_Skill_Icon.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Farming_Skill_Icon.png)[Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") Level 2 |
| Ingredients | ![Copper Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f1/Copper_Bar.png)[Copper Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Copper_Bar "Copper Bar") (1)![Iron Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6c/Iron_Bar.png)[Iron Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Iron_Bar "Iron Bar") (1) |

_This article is about the specific item. For all types of sprinklers, see [Crafting#Sprinklers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Sprinklers "Crafting")._

The **Sprinkler** is a [crafted](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting "Crafting") item that waters 4 tiles (above, below, and to the right and left of it) every morning. Only tilled tiles will be watered. The Sprinkler is unlocked at [Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") level 2.

[Sprinklers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Sprinklers "Crafting") can water [Slime Hutch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slime_Hutch "Slime Hutch") troughs, but cannot be used to water [Garden Pots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Garden_Pot "Garden Pot") or the [pet's](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Cat_or_Dog "Animals") water bowl. Sprinklers cannot be placed on sand.

A [Torch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Torch "Torch") can be placed on a Sprinkler to provide minimal lighting in the dark.

[![Sprinklerexample.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/2b/Sprinklerexample.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Sprinklerexample.png)

## Upgrades

Upgrades can be attached onto a placed sprinkler. Picking up the sprinkler will remove the upgrade without destroying it.

Only one upgrade can be used at a time on a single sprinkler.

| [![Enricher.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/41/Enricher.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Enricher.png) | [Enricher](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Enricher "Enricher") (4) | Place on a sprinkler and load with fertilizer to automatically apply it when planting seeds nearby. | [![EnricherSprinklers.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/42/EnricherSprinklers.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:EnricherSprinklers.png) | data-sort-value="20">![Qi Gem.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/78/Qi_Gem.png) 20 |

## Bundles

The Sprinkler is not used in any [bundles](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bundles "Bundles").

## Quests

The Sprinkler is not used in any [quests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests "Quests").

## History

- [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Improved sprinklers: Sprinklers can now water [slime hutch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Slime_Hutch "Slime Hutch") troughs. [Hoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes") no longer remove sprinklers. Added [enricher](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Enricher "Enricher") and [pressure nozzle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pressure_Nozzle "Pressure Nozzle") upgrades.
- [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Can now have a [Torch](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Torch "Torch") placed on it.

# Trees

From Stardew Valley Wiki

[Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#searchInput)

_This article is about non-fruit trees. For Fruit Trees, see the [Fruit Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fruit_Trees "Fruit Trees") page._

**Trees** that do not yield fruit are of two types: [common](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Common_Trees) and [special](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Special_Trees). Common trees ( [Maple](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Tree "Maple Tree"), [Oak](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oak_Tree "Oak Tree"), [Pine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pine_Tree "Pine Tree"), and [Mahogany](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mahogany_Tree "Mahogany Tree")) are valuable natural resources, being the primary source of multiple products: [Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") for construction and crafting, [Sap](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sap "Sap"), [Maple Syrup](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Syrup "Maple Syrup"), [Oak Resin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oak_Resin "Oak Resin"), and [Pine Tar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pine_Tar "Pine Tar"). Special trees have their own unique characteristics.

## Contents

- [1Common Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Common_Trees)
  - [1.1Harvesting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Harvesting)
  - [1.2Moss](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Moss)
  - [1.3Growth Cycle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Growth_Cycle)
  - [1.4Outside the Farm](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Outside_the_Farm)
  - [1.5Lightning](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Lightning)
  - [1.6Oak Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Oak_Tree)
  - [1.7Maple Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Maple_Tree)
  - [1.8Pine Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Pine_Tree)
  - [1.9Mahogany Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Mahogany_Tree)
- [2Special Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Special_Trees)
  - [2.1Palm Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Palm_Tree)
  - [2.2Mushroom Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Mushroom_Tree)
  - [2.3Mystic Tree](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Mystic_Tree)
  - [2.4Green Rain Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Green_Rain_Trees)
- [3References](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#References)
- [4History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#History)

## Common Trees

### Harvesting

A **mature tree** (stage 5) can be shaken for a seed (see [Growth Cycle](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Growth_Cycle)), [tapped](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper "Tapper") for syrup, or felled by chopping it repeatedly with an [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes"). When chopped down, trees always fall left or right away from the player (if applicable) and produce wood or seeds in the direction of the fall. When chopped from above or below, the player should try to stand off-center on the tile to clearly ensure the direction. If the tree is adjacent to a wall, hug the wall to ensure it falls into playing space. If the tree falls into or near water, the items it drops may disappear into the water. High [Magnetism](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Magnetism "Magnetism") is very helpful for quickly collecting the widely-scattered products. The products (not including those from the stump) are:[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-treeproducts-1)

- ![Wood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Wood.png)[Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") (12-16), _except_ Mahogany trees. The possible 4 bonus pieces of wood are randomly added, based on [Luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck") and [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") skill. For players with the [Forester](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Foraging "Skills") profession, the amounts are 25% larger ( _i.e.,_ 15-20 pieces). If a player has read [Woody's Secret](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woody%27s_Secret "Woody's Secret"), there is a 5% chance to double the amount of wood dropped ( _i.e.,_ 24-32 pieces normally or 30-40 pieces with the profession).
- ![Hardwood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ed/Hardwood.png)[Hardwood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hardwood "Hardwood") (10) for Mahogany trees. For players with the [Forester](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Foraging "Skills") profession, the amounts are 25% larger ( _i.e.,_ 12 or 13 pieces).
- ![Sap.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/73/Sap.png)[Sap](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sap "Sap") (5)
- ![Maple Seed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/36/Maple_Seed.png)[Maple Seed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Seed "Maple Seed") (0-2), ![Acorn.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/cd/Acorn.png)[Acorn](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Acorn "Acorn") (0-2), ![Pine Cone.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/9/90/Pine_Cone.png)[Pine Cone](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pine_Cone "Pine Cone") (0-2) or ![Mahogany Seed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/8/84/Mahogany_Seed.png)[Mahogany Seed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mahogany_Seed "Mahogany Seed") (0-1), depending on tree species. These are in addition to the 1 possible ["loose" seed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#Growth_Cycle) that may fall when shaking the tree. All seeds are only possible if [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") skill is at least 1.
- ![Hardwood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ed/Hardwood.png)[Hardwood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hardwood "Hardwood"), if the player has the [Lumberjack](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging#Foraging_Skill "Foraging") profession. The amount of wood is random: 50% chance for 0 pieces; 25% 1; 12.5% 2; 6.25% 3; 3.125% 4; etc. (without any fixed maximum number).
- 12 [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") experience points.

When tapped, a tree cannot be chopped down or shaken for a seed, unless the tapper is first removed. (However, if the tree is moss-covered, you can shake it without removing the tapper by using a scythe or weapon on the tree.)

A **stump** is left behind after a mature tree is chopped down. Removing the stump with an [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes") yields:[\[2\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-stumpproducts-2)

- ![Wood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Wood.png)[Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") (4-9)
  - In single-player, 5 is the minimum, plus 4 bonus pieces are randomly added, based on [Luck](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Luck "Luck") and [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") skill. For [Foresters](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Foraging "Skills"), the total amount is 6-11 wood.
  - In multiplayer, the amount is fixed at 4 wood (5 for Foresters)
- ![Sap.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/73/Sap.png)[Sap](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sap "Sap") (1)
- 1 [Foraging](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging "Foraging") experience point.

At **stage 4**, tree seedlings can be chopped down with an [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes"). Products are:[\[3\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-seedlingproducts-3)

- ![Wood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Wood.png)[Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") (4) (5 for [Foresters](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Skills#Foraging "Skills"))

At **stages 2 and 3**, tree seedlings can be removed using an [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes"), [Hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes"), [Pickaxe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes "Pickaxes"), [Scythe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Scythe "Scythe"), or [Weapon](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weapons "Weapons"). If an Axe is not used, no products are dropped.[\[4\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-axeOnSeedling-4)

- ![Wood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Wood.png)[Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") (1) may be dropped if an Axe is used. The percent chance is ten times the player's Foraging level ( _i.e.,_ guaranteed at level 10), including [Buffs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Buffs "Buffs").

At **stage 1**, tree seeds can be removed from the ground using an [Axe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Axes "Axes"), [Hoe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hoes "Hoes"), or [Pickaxe](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pickaxes "Pickaxes"). The only product is the seed.

### Moss

[Moss](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Moss "Moss") is found growing on [Maple Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Tree "Maple Tree"), [Oak Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oak_Tree "Oak Tree"), [Pine Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pine_Tree "Pine Tree"), and two types of [Green Rain Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Rain_Trees "Green Rain Trees") during all seasons apart from Winter. Moss is on most trees during the [Green Rain](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weather#GreenRain "Weather") weather event. Trees do not have to be chopped down to harvest Moss; it can be harvested with one use of any tool. Each tree will drop 1-2 Moss.

### Growth Cycle

Each day, there is a 5% chance that a mature tree will generate a "loose" seed. This seed will be dropped if the player shakes the tree. Normally the loose seed matches the mature tree species, with one exception: for the last two weeks of [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall"), shaking a Maple Tree produces a [Hazelnut](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hazelnut "Hazelnut") instead of a [Maple Seed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Seed "Maple Seed").[\[5\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-fallHazelnut-5) Note that the player must reach [Foraging Level 1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging#Foraging_Skill "Foraging") and sleep to view the level-up screen before seeds from chopping down trees will be available. Seeds from shaking trees become available as soon as the player levels up.

In addition, mature trees (excluding stumps) on the farm have a 15% chance each night of trying to spontaneously plant one seed in the ground.[\[6\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-treeDropSeed-6) One tile is randomly chosen, up to 3 tiles away from the parent tree in any direction. The seed becomes "planted", creating a new stage 1 tree, only if the tile is a valid location for a new tree. In particular, the chosen tile must be empty; trees will not destroy paths or crops.

Planted seeds grow through four stages before reaching maturity. Tree seeds do not require watering, nor do they require the surrounding land to be empty (unlike [Fruit Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fruit_Trees "Fruit Trees")): the land can be fully paved; trees can be planted next to water or other features. As long as the seed can be placed in the ground, it can grow. The only limitation on tree seedling growth is that two mature trees cannot be side by side: a seedling will never grow past stage 4 if there is a mature tree in any of its eight adjacent tiles.

With [Tree Fertilizer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tree_Fertilizer "Tree Fertilizer"), trees will grow one stage every night, except at stage 4, which takes two days. In total, a fertilized seed takes five days to reach maturity. Fertilized seeds and seedlings will grow even in [Winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter"). Otherwise, with the exception of trees in [the Desert](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Desert "The Desert") and on [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island"), trees do not grow at all in winter.

Without fertilizer, seedlings have a 20% chance each night of growing to the next stage, except at stage 4, where seedlings spend twice as long. The median growth time from seed to maturity is 24 days, although individual tree growth times will vary considerably. Statistically, 90% of seeds should reach maturity in 38 days (excluding winter), and 99% in 55 days.

Having reached stage 5 maturity, the tree continues growing up to stage 15 with the base change of 20% for the purpose of [Moss](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Moss "Moss") growing. Additionally, if it has a fully grown [Green Rain Tree (Type 1 or 2)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Rain_Trees "Green Rain Trees") in a 5x5 square centered around itself, it has an additional check of 50% for a growth stage increase after stage 5. [\[7\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-mossGrowthStage-7).
Collecting [Moss](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Moss "Moss") reduces the growth stage to 12 - amount of moss dropped in the stack. [\[8\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-mossCollectStageReduction-8).

### Outside the Farm

Common trees in [Cindersap Forest](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cindersap_Forest "Cindersap Forest"), [The Mountain](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Mountain "The Mountain"), [Railroad](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Railroad "Railroad"), [Quarry](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quarry "Quarry"), [Bus Stop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bus_Stop "Bus Stop") and [Backwoods](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Backwoods "Backwoods") can all be chopped down, tapped, or shaken for a seed. However, players cannot interact with the trees in [Town](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pelican_Town "Pelican Town").

Outside the farm, trees never spontaneously spread planted seeds. However, the player can plant seeds in any tillable ground (as long as the ground is un-tilled), which will go through the standard growth stages.

Any pre-existing trees that are chopped down outside the farm, and the stumps removed, have a 20% chance per night of reappearing as a stage 3 seedling (even in winter). After reappearing, it will grow as normal into a mature tree. If the stump is not removed, the tree will not regrow.

### Lightning

Unlike [Fruit Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fruit_Trees "Fruit Trees"), which produce [Coal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coal "Coal") for 3-4 days after being hit by lightning, common trees hit by lightning are destroyed, leaving only a stump (and some wood or sap) behind.

### Oak Tree

[Oak Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oak_Tree "Oak Tree") grow from ![Acorn.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/c/cd/Acorn.png)[Acorns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Acorn "Acorn"). When [tapped](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper "Tapper"), they yield ![Oak Resin.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/40/Oak_Resin.png)[Oak Resin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oak_Resin "Oak Resin") every 7 days (or 3 days with the [Heavy Tapper](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Heavy_Tapper "Heavy Tapper")).

Oak trees that are not in [Pelican Town](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pelican_Town "Pelican Town") or the [Greenhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Greenhouse "Greenhouse") may turn into [Green Rain Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Rain_Trees "Green Rain Trees") in [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall") and will not return to normal until the next [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring"). If a tapper is placed on the tree, this change will not occur. [\[9\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-leafshedding-9).

### Maple Tree

[Maple Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Tree "Maple Tree") grow from ![Maple Seed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/36/Maple_Seed.png)[Maple Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Seed "Maple Seed"). When [tapped](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper "Tapper"), they yield ![Maple Syrup.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/6a/Maple_Syrup.png)[Maple Syrup](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Syrup "Maple Syrup") every 9 days (or 4 days with the [Heavy Tapper](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Heavy_Tapper "Heavy Tapper")). Maple trees have a chance to drop a [Hazelnut](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hazelnut "Hazelnut") during the last 2 weeks of [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall").

[Maple Syrup](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Maple_Syrup "Maple Syrup") is the most profitable of the 3 types of common tree syrup.

Maple trees that are not in [Pelican Town](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pelican_Town "Pelican Town") or the [Greenhouse](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Greenhouse "Greenhouse") may turn into [Green Rain Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Rain_Trees "Green Rain Trees") in [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall") and will not return to normal until the next [Spring](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Spring "Spring"). If a tapper is placed on the tree, this change will not occur. [\[9\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Trees#cite_note-leafshedding-9).

## Special Trees

Special trees have uncommon properties and yields.

### Palm Tree

[Palm Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Palm_Tree "Palm Tree") do not drop any seeds, so they cannot be planted by the farmer and are only found in [The Calico Desert](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Desert "The Desert") and on [Ginger Island](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ginger_Island "Ginger Island"). Palm Trees may occasionally drop a [Coconut](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Coconut "Coconut") (and can also drop a [Golden Coconut](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Coconut "Golden Coconut") if the tree is on Ginger Island) when chopped down or shaken. They cannot be [tapped](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper "Tapper").

### Mushroom Tree

[Mushroom Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mushroom_Tree "Mushroom Tree") grow from ![Mushroom Tree Seed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d4/Mushroom_Tree_Seed.png)[Mushroom Tree Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mushroom_Tree_Seed "Mushroom Tree Seed"). Mushroom Trees are a rare occurrence on the farm. Each [Fall](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fall "Fall"), there is a chance for a fully grown untapped common tree (or stump) to change into a Mushroom Tree (or stump) during the night. A Mushroom Tree can also be grown from a [Mushroom Tree Seed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mushroom_Tree_Seed "Mushroom Tree Seed"). These seeds do not fall from Mushroom Trees when shaken or chopped - they can only be obtained from [Qi's Walnut Room](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Qi%27s_Walnut_Room "Qi's Walnut Room") or from seeds spread from them. They yield [Red](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Red_Mushroom "Red Mushroom") or [Purple Mushrooms](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Purple_Mushroom "Purple Mushroom") when chopped down. They can be [tapped](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper "Tapper") and will yield ![Common Mushroom.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/2e/Common_Mushroom.png)[Common](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Common_Mushroom "Common Mushroom"), ![Red Mushroom.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/e1/Red_Mushroom.png)[Red](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Red_Mushroom "Red Mushroom"), and ![Purple Mushroom.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/4b/Purple_Mushroom.png)[Purple](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Purple_Mushroom "Purple Mushroom") mushrooms over time.

Mushroom Trees hit by lightning will be reduced to a stump and leave mushrooms behind, in the same way as common trees leave wood/sap behind. If the stump is left alone, the following Spring, it will regrow.

### Mystic Tree

Mystic Trees are not native to the Valley; they grow only if planted by the farmer. ### Green Rain Trees

[Green Rain Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Rain_Trees "Green Rain Trees") grow from ![Mossy Seed.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/78/Mossy_Seed.png)[Mossy Seeds](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mossy_Seed "Mossy Seed"). There are three varieties of Green Rain Trees found spawning naturally during the [Green Rain](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Weather "Weather") weather event, and by planting Mossy Seeds. They may drop a Mossy Seed when shaken. When chopped with an axe, they drop possible Moss, [Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood"), [Sap](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sap "Sap"), possible Mossy Seeds, and possible [Hardwood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hardwood "Hardwood") (if the player is a [Lumberjack](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Foraging#Foraging_Skill "Foraging")).

**Type 1**

Some appear with moss, while others do not. They cannot be [tapped](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper "Tapper").

**Type 3**

When chopped down with an axe, they drop [Fiddlehead Ferns](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiddlehead_Fern "Fiddlehead Fern"). When [tapped](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tapper "Tapper"), they yield ![Fiddlehead Fern.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/48/Fiddlehead_Fern.png)[Fiddlehead Fern](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Fiddlehead_Fern "Fiddlehead Fern") (1) every 2 days (or 1 day with the [Heavy Tapper](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Heavy_Tapper "Heavy Tapper")).

## History

- [1.1](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.1 "Version History"): You can no longer tap a stump, and trees no longer say "Wrong Season" message.
- [1.3.27](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.3.27 "Version History"): Breaking small tree stumps now provides +1 Foraging XP.
- [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Fixed bug that caused a stage 2-3 sapling to make a scythe sound when watered. Fixed bug that prevented trees from dropping seeds and seeds disappearing when harvested if a Foraging level up occurred during the day. Planting tree seeds outside the farm no longer requires the spot to be tilled. (This also prevents planting in non-tillable areas dug up by Artifact Spots in Winter).
- [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Added Mahogany Tree.
- [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): Added Mystic Tree and the Green Rain Trees. Fixed tree stumps dropping seeds like full-grown trees. Reading [Woody's Secret](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Woody%27s_Secret "Woody's Secret") has a chance to double wood output from trees. Maple and Oak trees now have a chance to turn into [Green Rain Trees](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Green_Rain_Trees "Green Rain Trees") and lose their leaves in the fall. Trees planted in [the Desert](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Desert "The Desert") will now grow during [Winter](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Winter "Winter") without [Tree Fertilizer](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tree_Fertilizer "Tree Fertilizer").
- [1.6.3](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6.3 "Version History"): Added extended growth stages explanation to the growth cycle, explanation to growth change after collecting.

metadata.title: Trees - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Trees that do not yield fruit are of two types: common and special.  Common trees (Maple, Oak, Pine, and Mahogany) are valuable natural resources, being the primary source of multiple products: Wood for construction and crafting, Sap, Maple Syrup, Oak Resin, and Pine Tar.  Special trees have their own unique characteristics.

# Tailoring From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#searchInput) [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/4/4d/Sewing_Interface.png/400px-Sewing_Interface.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Sewing_Interface.png) [Enlarge](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Sewing_Interface.png "Enlarge") The sewing machine interface. _For instructions on how to dye clothing using the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sewing_Machine "Sewing Machine") or Dye Pots, see [Dyeing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dyeing "Dyeing")._ **Tailoring** involves creating new shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, and hats at the sewing machine located inside [Emily and Haley's house](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/2_Willow_Lane "2 Willow Lane") or the [Sewing Machine](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sewing_Machine "Sewing Machine") received as a reward for the ["Rock Rejuvenation"](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Quests#Rock_Rejuvenation "Quests") special order. Boots and shoes can also be custom-tailored, which does not create a new item, but transfers the stats from one pair to another. Tailoring and Dyeing are unlocked in a cutscene the day after the player acquires at least 1 [Cloth](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cloth "Cloth"). [Emily](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily "Emily") will appear in front of the player's house and tell them that they can tailor clothes using the sewing machine at her house. Each item requires [Cloth](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cloth "Cloth") in the feed and one other item on the spool. Prismatic clothing is _random_, so Cloth + Prismatic Shard can produce any of the 5 prismatic clothing items (including duplicates). Shirts, Pants, and [Hats](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hats "Hats") cannot be sold anywhere in Stardew Valley. [Boots/Shoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Footwear "Footwear") can be sold to the [Adventurer's Guild](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Adventurer%27s_Guild "Adventurer's Guild"). ## Contents - [1Shirts](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Shirts) - [2Pants](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Pants) - [3Hats](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Hats) - [4Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Boots) - [5Notes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#Notes) - [6References](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#References) - [7History](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#History) ## Shirts Shirts chosen at character creation at the start of the game are not dyeable. Their corresponding tailored versions may be dyeable after being created using a sewing machine. The [Oasis](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Oasis "Oasis") sells a random Shirt each day of the week for data-sort-value="1000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)1,000g. Shirts that can be chosen at character creation but cannot be Tailored may be purchased at the Oasis. There is a small, fixed chance to find a random cosmetic item when the player kills a monster, breaks a crate, tills an artifact spot, or shakes or chops a tree, as well as a higher but more variable chance when panning.[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#cite_note-cosmetic_item_drops-1) The possible cosmetic items include most shirts, as well as some hats. Pants and Boots are not obtainable from these drops. [Furniture](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Furniture "Furniture") may also be dropped.[\[2\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#cite_note-cosmetic_item_types-2) Note that there are three shirts called "Bandana Shirt", none of which are dyeable. The non-dyeable "Sailor Shirt" chosen at character creation is visually nearly identical to the dyeable "Sailor Shirt" that can be created with a variety of fish, and has a dyeable neckerchief. For dyeable shirts that can be created with more than one item, the resulting color is dependent on the item used to Tailor it. | Image | Name | Description | Dyeable | Special Property / Notes | Recipe (Cloth + ) | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Shirt000.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/db/Shirt000.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt000.png) | Classic Overalls | A farming classic. | No | Can be chosen at character creation | ![Complete Breakfast.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/3d/Complete_Breakfast.png)[Complete Breakfast](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Complete_Breakfast "Complete Breakfast") | | [![Shirt001.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/25/Shirt001.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt001.png) | Shirt | A wearable shirt. | No | Can be chosen at character creation | ![Clay.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/a/a2/Clay.png)[Clay](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clay "Clay") | | [![Shirt002.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/5/51/Shirt002.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt002.png) | Mint Blouse | A cute, light green blouse. | No | Can be chosen at character creation | ![Dandelion.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/b/b1/Dandelion.png)[Dandelion](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dandelion "Dandelion") | | [![Shirt003.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f5/Shirt003.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt003.png) | Dark Shirt | A dark colored shirt. | No | Can be chosen at character creation | ![Bat Wing.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/3/35/Bat_Wing.png)[Bat Wing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Bat_Wing "Bat Wing") | | [![Shirt004.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/6/61/Shirt004.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Shirt004.png) | Skull Shirt | A shirt with a menacing skull printed on it. | No | Can be chosen at character creation.

shoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Footwear "Footwear") cannot be created, but the stats can be transferred from one pair to another. To custom-tailor boots or shoes, place the item with the desired stats on the spool at the upper right and the item to be tailored in the feed at the lower left. The item on the spool will be consumed in the process. The resulting item in the feed will be called "Custom-tailored \[name of shoe/boot\]". ## Notes Some items that cannot be used to tailor clothing will not be greyed out until cloth is placed in the feed. Similarly, invalid tailoring items placed on the spool will cause cloth to be greyed out. ## References 1. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#cite_ref-cosmetic_item_drops_1-0 "Jump up")Monsters, crates, artifact spots and trees use `Utility::trySpawnRareObject` to drop cosmetic items, with fixed odds ranging from 0.066% to 0.4% depending on activity. Panning instead calls `Utility::getRandomCosmeticItem` directly, with odds controlled by `Tools/Pan::getPanItems`, ranging from 0% to 13.4% depending on pan upgrades, luck, and daily luck. 2. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#cite_ref-cosmetic_item_types_2-0 "Jump up")The function `Utility::getRandomCosmeticItem` is used to determine the type of cosmetic item. 20% will be furniture, 20% will be from a subset of tailorable Hats, and 60% will be from a subset of Shirts, covering most shirts but with some exclusions (excluding all shirts with gendered variants, all shirts that can be chosen at character creation, the seven shirts tailored using items only available after reaching Ginger Island, Emily's Magic Shirt, Magic Sprinkle Shirt, the Prismatic Shirts with dark or light sleeves, and non-numerical IDs such as the Mystery Shirt). 3. [↑](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tailoring#cite_ref-softedgepullover_3-0 "Jump up")One of Emily's makeover outfits (see `Data/MakeoverOutfits.xnb`) for male farmers gives a minor variant of Basic Pullover (M) with the ID `(S)SoftEdgePullover`. This is dyable like the regular Basic Pullover (M) but its sprite differs by 2 pixels, and it has a unique, non-numerical ID, and so cannot be obtained from random cosmetic drops. ## History - [1.4](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.4 "Version History"): Introduced new shirts, hats, shorts, skirts, and pants. Prior to 1.4, shirts and pants could only be selected on the new game character customization menu or at [the Shrine of Illusions](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/The_Shrine_of_Illusions "The Shrine of Illusions") and were not separate items. Prior to 1.4, hats were only available from the [Adventurer's Guild](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Adventurer%27s_Guild "Adventurer's Guild"), at certain festivals, from the [Abandoned House](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Abandoned_House "Abandoned House"), and in a small number of other locations. - [1.5](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.5 "Version History"): Introduced new shirts, hats, and glasses. - [1.6](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Version_History#1.6 "Version History"): New tailoring recipes added. Certain hats and shirts can be dropped randomly by monsters, crates and barrels, trees, Artifact Spots, or panning. Placing a Staircase in the player's pants slot no longer produces Trimmed Lucky Purple Shorts. | [Clothing](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Clothing "Clothing") | | --- | | [Footwear](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Footwear "Footwear") | [Cinderclown Shoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cinderclown_Shoes "Cinderclown Shoes") • [Combat Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Combat_Boots "Combat Boots") • [Cowboy Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cowboy_Boots "Cowboy Boots") • [Crystal Shoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crystal_Shoes "Crystal Shoes") • [Dark Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dark_Boots "Dark Boots") • [Dragonscale Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Dragonscale_Boots "Dragonscale Boots") • [Emily's Magic Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Emily%27s_Magic_Boots "Emily's Magic Boots") • [Firewalker Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Firewalker_Boots "Firewalker Boots") • [Genie Shoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Genie_Shoes "Genie Shoes") • [Leather Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Leather_Boots "Leather Boots") • [Leprechaun Shoes](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Leprechaun_Shoes "Leprechaun Shoes") • [Mermaid Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mermaid_Boots "Mermaid Boots") • [Rubber Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Rubber_Boots "Rubber Boots") • [Sneakers](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sneakers "Sneakers") • [Space Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Space_Boots "Space Boots") • [Thermal Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Thermal_Boots "Thermal Boots") • [Tundra Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Tundra_Boots "Tundra Boots") • [Work Boots](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Work_Boots "Work Boots") | | [Hats](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Hats "Hats") | [???](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/%3F%3F%3F_(hat) "??? metadata.title: Tailoring - Stardew Valley Wiki
metadata.description: Tailoring involves creating new shirts, pants, skirts, shorts, and hats at the sewing machine located inside Emily and Haley's house or the Sewing Machine received as a reward for the "Rock Rejuvenation" special order.  Boots and shoes can also be custom-tailored, which does not create a new item, but transfers the stats from one pair to another.

- Autofeed System | The **Barn** is a type of [farm building](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop#Farm_Buildings "Carpenter's Shop") purchasable and upgradeable from [Robin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Robin "Robin") at the [Carpenter's Shop](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Carpenter%27s_Shop "Carpenter's Shop"). ## Contents - [1Construction](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn#Construction) - [2Features](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn#Features) - [3Bugs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn#Bugs) - [4Interior](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Barn#Interior) ## Construction The Barn takes three days to initially construct. During this time, Robin is unreachable for [dialogue or gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship"). Upgrading the Barn requires two days. During this time, the barn can be used as normal. [Robin](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Robin "Robin") can be found inside the Barn for purposes such as [dialogue or gifting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Friendship "Friendship"). The total cost of a Deluxe Barn, built from scratch, is data-sort-value="43000">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)43,000g![Wood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Wood.png)[Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") (1350)![Stone.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d4/Stone.png)[Stone](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stone "Stone") (650); or, if all wood and stone are bought from Robin during year 1, data-sort-value="69500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)69,500g, and data-sort-value="175500">![Gold.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/10/Gold.png/36px-Gold.png)175,500g if bought in year 2+. ## Features The barn houses [cows](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Cow "Cow"), [goats](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Goat "Goat"), [sheep](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Sheep "Sheep"), [pigs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Pig "Pig"), and [ostriches](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich "Ostrich"). Once you have unlocked an animal by building the barn needed to house it, that animal can be placed in any other non-upgraded barns you have built as well. [Barn Animals](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Barn_Animals "Animals") may be stuck outside at night if the barn doors are closed. The conditions for this are not clear (see [Animals trapped outside](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Animals_Trapped_Outside "Animals")). If an animal is stuck outside the barn at night, the next day their mood will be "grumpy." Animals stuck outside are also subject to [Wild Animal Attacks](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animals#Wild_Animal_Attacks "Animals"). The Barn can also be used in a manner similar to the [Shed](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Shed "Shed") for storing [Chests](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Chest "Chest"), [Artisan Equipment](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Artisan_Equipment "Crafting"), [Furniture](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Furniture "Furniture"), etc.. The animals are undisturbed by the clutter, even if their paths are blocked. - [![Animal left outside dialog.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/0/04/Animal_left_outside_dialog.png/214px-Animal_left_outside_dialog.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Animal_left_outside_dialog.png) ## Bugs It is possible to have 13 animals in a barn at once, if the player has a barn filled with 11 animals and an existing animal gives birth the same night as an [Ostrich Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich_Egg "Ostrich Egg") hatches. ## Interior - [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/e/e7/Barn_Interior.png/240px-Barn_Interior.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Barn_Interior.png) Barn Interior - [![](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/1/1f/Deluxe_Barn_Interior.png/240px-Deluxe_Barn_Interior.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Deluxe_Barn_Interior.png) Deluxe Barn # Mayonnaise Machine From Stardew Valley Wiki [Jump to navigation](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise_Machine#mw-head) [Jump to search](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise_Machine#searchInput) | | | | --- | --- | | Mayonnaise Machine | | [![Mayonnaise Machine.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/e/ef/Mayonnaise_Machine.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Mayonnaise_Machine.png) | | Turns eggs into mayonnaise. | | Information | | Source | [Crafting](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting "Crafting") | | Sell Price | _Cannot be sold_ | | Crafting | | Recipe Source | ![Farming Skill Icon.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/thumb/8/82/Farming_Skill_Icon.png/48px-Farming_Skill_Icon.png)[Farming](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Farming "Farming") (Level 2) | | Ingredients | ![Wood.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/df/Wood.png)[Wood](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Wood "Wood") (15)![Stone.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/d/d4/Stone.png)[Stone](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Stone "Stone") (15)![Earth Crystal.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/7/74/Earth_Crystal.png)[Earth Crystal](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Earth_Crystal "Earth Crystal") (1)![Copper Bar.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/f/f1/Copper_Bar.png)[Copper Bar](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Copper_Bar "Copper Bar") (1) | The **Mayonnaise Machine** is a type of [Artisan Equipment](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Crafting#Artisan_Equipment "Crafting") used to make [Artisan Goods](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Artisan_Goods "Artisan Goods"). It takes eggs and turns them into various kinds of [Mayonnaise](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise "Mayonnaise"). ## Products _See also: [Animal Products Profitability](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Animal_Products_Profitability "Animal Products Profitability")_ Regular white or brown chicken [eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg") produce normal quality Mayonnaise, and [Large white or brown chicken eggs](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Large_Egg "Large Egg") produce gold-quality mayonnaise. A single [Ostrich Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Ostrich_Egg "Ostrich Egg") will produce 10 jars of Mayonnaise, with the quality of the Mayonnaise equal to the quality of the Ostrich Egg used. A [Golden Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Golden_Egg "Golden Egg") will produce three gold-quality Mayonnaise. | Image | Name | Description | Ingredient | Processing Time[\[1\]](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise_Machine#cite_note-processtime-1) | Sell Price | Energy | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | [![Mayonnaise.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/4/4e/Mayonnaise.png)](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/File:Mayonnaise.png) | [Mayonnaise](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Mayonnaise "Mayonnaise") | It looks spreadable. | ![Egg.png](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/mediawiki/images/2/26/Egg.png)[Egg](https://stardewvalleywiki.com/Egg "Egg") (1) _or_
